EXPLANATORY [The Colonel Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry here re - introduced to [the public]260-the public is [the same person who appeared as [_ Eschol _ Sellers]96-_ eschol _ sellers in the first edition of the tale entitled “ [The Gilded Age]1757-the gilded age , ”[98-mrs. sellers] years ago , and as [_ Beriah _ Sellers]97-beriah in the subsequent editions of the same book]261-the same person who appeared as _ eschol _ sellers in the first edition of the tale entitled “ the gilded age , ” years ago , and as _ beriah _ sellers in the subsequent editions of the same book , and finally as [_ Mulberry _ Sellers]98-mrs. sellers in the drama played afterward by [John T. Raymond]99-john t. raymond . The name was changed from [Eschol]1-eschol to [Beriah]97-beriah to accommodate an [Eschol Sellers]96-_ eschol _ sellers who rose up out of [the vasty deeps of uncharted space]262-the vasty deeps of uncharted space and preferred [his]96-_ eschol _ sellers request — backed by threat of a libel suit — then went [his]96-_ eschol _ sellers way appeased , and came no more . In the play [Beriah]97-beriah had to be dropped to satisfy [another member of the race]263-another member of the race , and [Mulberry]95-mulberry was substituted in the hope that [the objectors]264-the objectors would be tired by that time and let it pass unchallenged . So far it has occupied [the field]265-the field in peace ; therefore [we]266-we chance it again , feeling reasonably safe , this time , under shelter of the statute of limitations . [MARK TWAIN]100-mark twain . [Hartford]2-hartford , 1891 . THE WEATHER IN THIS BOOK . No weather will be found in this book . This is an attempt to pull a book through without weather . It being the first attempt of the kind in fictitious literature , it may prove a failure , but it seemed worth the while of [some dare - devil person]267-some dare - devil person to try it , and [the author]268-the author was in just the mood . [Many a reader who wanted to read a tale through was not able to do it because of delays on account of the weather]269-many a reader who wanted to read a tale through was not able to do it because of delays on account of the weather . Nothing breaks up [an author]270-an author ’s progress like having to stop every few pages to fuss - up the weather . Thus it is plain that persistent intrusions of weather are bad for both [reader]271-reader and [author]272-author . Of course weather is necessary to a narrative of human experience . That is conceded . But it ought to be put where it will not be in the way ; where it will not interrupt the flow of the narrative . And it ought to be the ablest weather that can be had , not ignorant , poor - quality , amateur weather . Weather is a literary specialty , and [no untrained hand]273-no untrained hand can turn out a good article of it . [The present author]274-the present author can do only a few trifling ordinary kinds of weather , and [he]274-the present author can not do those very good . So it has seemed wisest to borrow such weather as is necessary for the book from [qualified and recognized experts]275-qualified and recognized experts — giving credit , of course . This weather will be found over in the back part of the book , out of the way . _ See Appendix _ . [The reader]276-the reader is requested to turn over and help [himself]276-the reader from time to time as [he]276-the reader goes along . CHAPTER I. It is a matchless morning in [rural England]277-rural england . On [a fair hill]278-a fair hill [we]266-we see a majestic pile , [the ivied walls and towers of [Cholmondeley Castle]3-cholmondeley castle]279-the ivied walls and towers of cholmondeley castle , huge relic and witness of [the baronial grandeurs of the Middle Ages]280-the baronial grandeurs of the middle ages . This is [one of the seats of [the Earl of]282-the earl of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]281-one of the seats of the earl of rossmore , K. G. G. C. B. K. C. M. G. , etc . , etc . , etc . , etc . , etc . , who possesses [twenty - two thousand acres of English land]283-twenty - two thousand acres of english land , owns [a parish in [London]5-london with [two thousand houses]285-two thousand houses on [its]284-a parish in london with two thousand houses on its lease - roll lease - roll]284-a parish in london with two thousand houses on its lease - roll , and struggles comfortably along on an income of two hundred thousand pounds a year . [The father and founder of this proud old line]286-the father and founder of this proud old line was [[William]101-william the Conqueror [his]101-william very self]287-william the conqueror his very self ; [the mother of it]288-the mother of it was not inventoried in history by name , [she]288-the mother of it being merely a random episode and inconsequential , like [[the tanner]289-the tanner ’s daughter of [Falaise]6-falaise]290-the tanner ’s daughter of falaise . In [a breakfast room of [the castle]292-the castle]291-a breakfast room of the castle on this breezy fine morning there are [two persons]293-two persons and the cooling remains of a deserted meal . [One of these persons]294-one of these persons is [the old lord]295-the old lord , tall , erect , square - shouldered , white - haired , stern - browed , [a man who shows character in every feature , attitude , and movement]296-a man who shows character in every feature , attitude , and movement , and carries [his]295-the old lord seventy years as easily as [most men]297-most men carry fifty . [The other person]298-the other person is [[his]295-the old lord only son]299-his only son and heir , [a dreamy - eyed young fellow]300-a dreamy - eyed young fellow , who looks about twenty - six but is nearer thirty . Candor , kindliness , honesty , sincerity , simplicity , modesty — it is easy to see that these are cardinal traits of [his]295-the old lord character ; and so when [you]301-you have clothed [him]295-the old lord in the formidable components of [his]295-the old lord name , [you]301-you somehow seem to be contemplating a lamb in armor : [his]295-the old lord name and style being [the Honourable Kirkcudbright Llanover Marjoribanks Sellers Viscount - Berkeley]102-berkeley , of [Cholmondeley Castle]3-cholmondeley castle , [Warwickshire]7-warwickshire . ( [Pronounced K’koobry Thlanover Marshbanks Sellers Vycount Barkly]103-pronounced k’koobry thlanover marshbanks sellers vycount barkly , of [Chumly Castle]8-chumly castle , Warrikshr . ) [He]295-the old lord is standing by a great window , in an attitude suggestive of respectful attention to what [[his]295-the old lord father]302-his father is saying and equally respectful dissent from the positions and arguments offered . [The father]303-the father walks the floor as [he]303-the father talks , and [his]303-the father talk shows that [his]303-the father temper is away up toward summer heat . “ Soft - spirited as [you]301-you are , [Berkeley]102-berkeley , [I]303-the father am quite aware that when [you]301-you have once made up [your]301-you mind to do a thing which [your]301-you ideas of honor and justice require [you]301-you to do , argument and reason are ( for the time being , ) wasted upon [you]301-you — yes , and ridicule ; persuasion , supplication , and command as well . To [my]303-the father mind — ”[303-the father] “ [Father]1758-father , if [you]1758-father will look at it without prejudice , without passion , [you]1758-father must concede that [I]304-the son am not doing a rash thing , a thoughtless , wilful thing , with nothing substantial behind it to justify it . _ [I]304-the son _ did not create [the American claimant to [the earldom of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]1760-the earldom of rossmore]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore ; [I]304-the son did not hunt for [him]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore , did not find [him]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore , did not obtrude [him]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore upon [your]1758-father notice . That hearing would either prove [he]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore was [the rightful earl]1762-the rightful earl — in which case [our]1761-our course would be plain — or it would prove that [he]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore wasn’t — in which case [our]1761-our course would be equally plain . Consider what [you]1758-father are saying , [sir]1769-sir . ”[304-the son] “ [Father]104-father , _ if _ [he]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore is [the rightful earl]1762-the rightful earl , would [you]104-father , could [you]104-father — that fact being established — consent to keep [his]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore titles and [[his]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore properties]1771-his properties from [him]1759-the american claimant to the earldom of rossmore a day , an hour , a minute ? ”[304-the son] “ [You]104-father are talking nonsense — nonsense — lurid idiocy ! Now , listen to [me]304-the son . [I]304-the son will make a confession — if [you]104-father wish to call it by that name . [I]304-the son did not read those evidences because [I]304-the son had no occasion to — [I]304-the son was made familiar with them in the time of [[this claimant]1772-this claimant ’s father]1773-this claimant ’s father and of [[my]304-the son own father]1774-my own father forty years ago . [[This fellow]1775-this fellow ’s predecessors]1776-this fellow ’s predecessors have kept [mine]304-the son more or less familiar with [them]1776-this fellow ’s predecessors for close upon a hundred and fifty years . The truth is , [the rightful heir]1777-the rightful heir did go to [America]9-america , with [the Fairfax heir]1778-the fairfax heir or about the same time — but disappeared — somewhere in [the wilds of [Virginia]10-virginia]1779-the wilds of virginia , got married , and began to breed [savages]1780-savages for [the Claimant market]1781-the claimant market ; wrote no letters [home]1782-home ; was supposed to be dead ; [[his]1774-my own father younger brother]1783-his younger brother softly took possession ; presently [the American]1784-the american did die , and straightway [[his]1774-my own father eldest product]1785-his eldest product put in [his]1774-my own father claim — by letter — letter still in existence — and died before [the uncle in - possession]1786-the uncle in - possession found time — or maybe inclination — to — answer . [The infant son of that eldest product]1787-the infant son of that eldest product grew up — long interval , [you]1788-you see — and _ [he]1787-the infant son of that eldest product _ took to writing letters and furnishing evidences . [The Fairfaxes]105-the fairfaxes kept [[their]105-the fairfaxes lordship]1793-their lordship alive , and so [they]105-the fairfaxes have never lost it to this day , although [they]105-the fairfaxes live in [Maryland]12-maryland ; [[their]105-the fairfaxes friend]1794-their friend lost [his]1794-their friend by [his]1794-their friend own neglect . [You]1795-you perceive now , that the facts in this case bring [us]1796-us to precisely this result : morally [the American tramp _ is [_ rightful earl of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]1798-_ rightful earl of rossmore]1797-the american tramp _ is _ rightful earl of rossmore ; legally [he]1797-the american tramp _ is _ rightful earl of rossmore has no more right than [his]1797-the american tramp _ is _ rightful earl of rossmore dog . There now — are [you]304-the son satisfied ? ”[304-the son] There was a pause , then [the son]304-the son glanced at the crest carved in the great oaken mantel and said , with a regretful note in [his]304-the son voice : “ Since the introduction of heraldic symbols,—the motto of [this house]1799-this house has been _ Suum cuique_—to [every man [his]1800-every man his own own]1800-every man his own . For ten years it has pestered [my]304-the son eye — and tortured [my]304-the son ear ; till at last [my]304-the son very footfalls time themselves to the brain - racking rhythm of _ [Simon Lathers!—Simon Lathers]107-simon lathers ! — [Simon Lathers]107-simon lathers ! _ And now , to make its presence in [my]304-the son soul eternal , immortal , imperishable , [you]304-the son have resolved to — to — what is it [you]304-the son have resolved to do ? ”[304-the son] “ To go to [Simon Lathers]107-simon lathers , in [America]9-america , and change places with [him]107-simon lathers . ”[304-the son] “ What ? See here — have [you]304-the son been training with that ass again — that radical , if [you]304-the son prefer the term , though the words are synonymous — [Lord Tanzy]108-lord tanzy , of [Tollmache]109-tollmache ? ”[304-the son] [The son]304-the son did not reply , and [the old lord]295-the old lord continued : “ Yes , [you]304-the son confess . [That puppy]1804-that puppy , that shame to [his]1804-that puppy birth and caste , who holds all hereditary lordships and privilege to be usurpation , [all nobility a tinsel sham]1805-all nobility a tinsel sham , all aristocratic institutions a fraud , all inequalities in rank a legalized crime and an infamy , and no bread honest bread that [a man]1806-a man does n’t earn by [his]1806-a man own work—_work _ , pah!”—and[295-the old lord] [the old patrician]307-the old patrician brushed imaginary labor - dirt from [his]307-the old patrician white hands . “ [You]304-the son have come to hold just those opinions [yourself]304-the son , [I]295-the old lord suppose,”—he[295-the old lord] added with a sneer . A faint flush in [the younger man]308-the younger man ’s cheek told that the shot had hit and hurt ; but [he]308-the younger man answered with dignity : “ [I]308-the younger man have . [I]308-the younger man say it without shame — [I]308-the younger man feel none . And now [my]308-the younger man reason for resolving to renounce [my]308-the younger man heirship without resistance is explained . [I]308-the younger man wish to retire from what to [me]308-the younger man is a false existence , a false position , and begin [my]308-the younger man life over again — begin it right — begin it on the level of mere manhood , unassisted by factitious aids , and succeed or fail by pure merit or the want of it . [I]308-the younger man will go to [America]9-america , where [all men]1807-all men are equal and all have an equal chance ; [I]308-the younger man will live or die , sink or swim , win or lose as just [a man]1806-a man — that alone , and [not a single helping gaud or fiction back of it]1809-not a single helping gaud or fiction back of it . ”[308-the younger man] “ Hear , hear ! ”[308-the younger man] [The two men]309-the two men looked [each other]310-each other steadily in the eye a moment or two , then [the elder one]311-the elder one added , musingly , “ Ab - so - lutely cra - zy — ab - solutely ! ”[311-the elder one] After another silence , [he]311-the elder one said , as [one who , long troubled by clouds]312-one who , long troubled by clouds , detects a ray of sunshine , “ Well , there will be one satisfaction — [Simon Lathers]107-simon lathers will come here to enter into [his]107-simon lathers own , and [I]311-the elder one will drown [him]107-simon lathers in the horsepond . [The poor devil]1810-the poor devil — always so humble in [his]1810-the poor devil letters , so pitiful , so deferential ; so steeped in reverence for [our]1811-our great line and [lofty - station]1812-lofty - station ; so anxious to placate [us]1811-our , so prayerful for recognition as [a relative]1813-a relative , [a bearer in [his]1810-the poor devil veins of [our]1811-our sacred blood]1814-a bearer in his veins of our sacred blood — and withal so poor , so needy , so threadbare and pauper - shod as to raiment , so despised , so laughed at for [his]1810-the poor devil silly claimantship by [the lewd American scum around [him]1810-the poor devil]1815-the lewd american scum around him — ah , [the vulgar , crawling , insufferable tramp]1816-the vulgar , crawling , insufferable tramp ! To read one of [his]1810-the poor devil cringing , nauseating letters — well ? ”[311-the elder one] This to [a splendid flunkey]313-a splendid flunkey , all in inflamed plush and buttons and knee - breeches as to [his]313-a splendid flunkey trunk , and a glinting white frost - work of ground - glass paste as to [his]313-a splendid flunkey head , who stood with [his]313-a splendid flunkey heels together and the upper half of [him]313-a splendid flunkey bent forward , a salver in [his]313-a splendid flunkey hands : “ The letters , [my lord]1763-my lord . ”[313-a splendid flunkey] [[My]0-i lord]1763-my lord took them , and [the servant]315-the servant disappeared . “ Among the rest , an American letter . From [the tramp]1818-the tramp , of course . Jove , but here ’s a change ! No brown paper envelope this time , filched from [a shop]1819-a shop , and carrying [the shop]1820-the shop ’s advertisement in the corner . Oh , no , a proper enough envelope — with a most ostentatiously broad mourning border — for [his]1810-the poor devil cat , perhaps , since [he]1810-the poor devil was [a bachelor]1821-a bachelor — and fastened with red wax — a batch of it as big as a half - crown — and — and — [our]1822-our crest for a seal!—motto and all . STREET]13-sixteenth . street , [WASHINGTON]114-hawkins , May 2 . _ [[My]0-i Lord]1763-my lord _ — It is [my]0-i painful duty to announce to [you]1763-my lord that [the head of [[our]318-our illustrious house]319-our illustrious house]317-the head of our illustrious house is no more — The Right Honourable , The Most Noble , The Most Puissant [Simon Lathers Lord Rossmore]106-simon lathers having departed this life ( “ Gone at last — this is unspeakably precious news , [[my]106-simon lathers son]1803-my son , ”[106-simon lathers] ) at [his]106-simon lathers seat in the environs of [the hamlet of [Duffy]15-duffy ’s Corners]320-the hamlet of duffy ’s corners in [the grand old State of Arkansas,—and [[his]106-simon lathers twin brother]322-his twin brother]321-the grand old state of arkansas,—and his twin brother with [him]106-simon lathers , both being crushed by a log at a smoke - house - raising , owing to carelessness on the part of all present , referable to over - confidence and gaiety induced by overplus of sour - mash—(“Extolled be sour - mash , whatever that may be , eh [Berkeley]102-berkeley ? ”[322-his twin brother] ) five days ago , with [no scion of [our]318-our ancient race]323-no scion of our ancient race present to close [his]106-simon lathers eyes and inter [him]106-simon lathers with the honors due [his]106-simon lathers historic name and lofty rank — in fact , [he]106-simon lathers is on the ice yet , [him]106-simon lathers and [[his]106-simon lathers brother]324-his brother — [friends]325-friends took up a collection for it . But [I]0-i shall take immediate occasion to have [their]326-their noble remains shipped to [you]327-you ( “ Great heavens ! ”[0-i] ) for interment , with due ceremonies and solemnities , in [the family vault or mausoleum of [[our]318-our house]329-our house]328-the family vault or mausoleum of our house . Yas ! ”[336-the old gentleman] CHAPTER II . p027.jpg ( 32 K ) [Colonel Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry — this was some days before [he]95-mulberry wrote [his]95-mulberry letter to [Lord Rossmore]106-simon lathers — was seated in [[his]95-mulberry “ library]1843-his “ library , ”[95-mulberry] which was also [[his]95-mulberry “ drawing - room]1844-his “ drawing - room ”[95-mulberry] and was also [his]95-mulberry “ picture gallery ”[95-mulberry] and likewise [[his]95-mulberry “ work - shop]1845-his “ work - shop . ”[95-mulberry] Sometimes [he]95-mulberry called [it]338-it by one of these names , sometimes by another , according to occasion and circumstance . [He]95-mulberry was constructing what seemed to be some kind of a frail mechanical toy ; and was apparently very much interested in [his]95-mulberry work . [He]95-mulberry was [a white - headed man]339-a white - headed man , now , but otherwise [he]95-mulberry was as young , alert , buoyant , visionary and enterprising as ever . [[His]95-mulberry loving old wife]340-his loving old wife sat near by , contentedly knitting and thinking , with a cat asleep in [her]340-his loving old wife lap . [The room]341-the room was large , light , and had a comfortable look , in fact a [home]1782-home - like look , though the furniture was of a humble sort and not over abundant , and the knickknacks and things that go to adorn [a living - room]343-a living - room not plenty and not costly . But there were natural flowers , and there was an abstract and unclassifiable something about the place which betrayed the presence in [the house of]344-the house of [somebody with a happy taste and an effective touch]345-somebody with a happy taste and an effective touch . Even the deadly chromos on the walls were somehow without offence ; in fact they seemed to belong there and to add an attraction to [the room]341-the room — a fascination , anyway ; for whoever got [his]95-mulberry eye on one of [them]347-them was like to gaze and suffer till [he]95-mulberry died — [you]348-you have seen that kind of pictures . Some of these terrors were landscapes , some libeled [the sea]349-the sea , some were ostensible portraits , all were crimes . All the portraits were recognizable as [dead Americans of distinction]350-dead americans of distinction , and yet , through labeling added , by a daring hand , [they]351-they were all doing duty here as “ [Earls of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]1846-earls of rossmore . ”[351-they] [The newest one]352-the newest one had left [the works]353-the works as [Andrew Jackson]111-andrew jackson , but was doing its best now , as “ [Simon Lathers Lord Rossmore]106-simon lathers , [Present Earl]1847-present earl . ”[352-the newest one] On one wall was a cheap old railroad map of [Warwickshire]7-warwickshire . This had been newly labeled “ [The Rossmore Estates]1848-the rossmore estates . ”[352-the newest one] On the opposite wall was another map , and this was the most imposing decoration of [the establishment]354-the establishment and the first to catch [a stranger]355-a stranger ’s attention , because of [its]356-its great size . It had once borne simply the title [SIBERIA]17-siberia ; but now the word “ FUTURE ”[352-the newest one] had been written in front of that word . [They]421-they do it yet ; for although the flint - arm has gone out and [the forts]422-the forts have tumbled down , the decree has n’t been repealed — been overlooked and forgotten , [you]423-you see — and so [the vacancies where [old Ticonderoga]123-old ticonderoga and [others]425-others used to stand]424-the vacancies where old ticonderoga and others used to stand , still get [their]424-the vacancies where old ticonderoga and others used to stand six quarts of gun - flints a year just the same . ” [Washington]122-washington said musingly after a pause : “[424-the vacancies where old ticonderoga and others used to stand] How strange it seems — to start for Minister to [England]11-england at twenty thousand a year and fail for flintpicker at — ” “[122-washington] Three dollars a week . It ’s human life , [Washington]122-washington — just an epitome of human ambition , and struggle , and the outcome : [you]423-you aim for [the palace]426-the palace and get drowned in the sewer . ” There was another meditative silence . Then [Washington]122-washington said , with earnest compassion in [his]122-washington voice — “[122-washington] And so , after coming here , against [your]423-you inclination , to satisfy [your]423-you sense of patriotic duty and appease [a selfish public clamor]427-a selfish public clamor , [you]423-you get absolutely nothing for it . ” “[122-washington] Nothing ? ” [The Colonel]374-the colonel had to get up and stand , to get room for [his]122-washington amazement to expand . “[423-you] _ Nothing _ , [Washington]122-washington ? [I]0-i ask [you]423-you this : to be [a perpetual Member]428-a perpetual member and [[the _ only _]429-the _ only _]429-the _ only _ [Perpetual Member of [a Diplomatic Body]432-a diplomatic body accredited to [the greatest country on [earth]434-earth]433-the greatest country on earth]431-perpetual member of a diplomatic body accredited to the greatest country on earth do [you]423-you call that nothing ? ” It was [Washington]122-washington ’s turn to be amazed . [He]122-washington was stricken dumb ; but the wide - eyed wonder , the reverent admiration expressed in [his]122-washington face were more eloquent than any words could have been . [The Colonel]374-the colonel ’s wounded spirit was healed and [he]122-washington resumed [his]122-washington seat pleased and content . [He]122-washington leaned forward and said impressively : “[442-they] What was due to [a man who had become forever conspicuous by an experience without precedent in the history of the world?—a man made permanently and diplomatically sacred]435-a man who had become forever conspicuous by an experience without precedent in the history of the world?—a man made permanently and diplomatically sacred , so to speak , by having been connected , temporarily , through solicitation , with every single diplomatic post in [the roster of [this government]437-this government]436-the roster of this government , from [Envoy Extraordinary]438-envoy extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to [the Court of [St. James]23-st. james]439-the court of st. james all the way down to Consul to [a guano rock in [the Strait of Sunda]28-the strait of sunda]440-a guano rock in the strait of sunda — salary payable in [guano — which disappeared by volcanic convulsion]441-guano — which disappeared by volcanic convulsion the day before [they]442-they got down to [my]0-i name in the list of [applicants]443-applicants . Certainly something august enough to be answerable to the size of this unique and memorable experience was [my]0-i due , and [I]0-i got it . By [the common voice of [this community]445-this community]444-the common voice of this community , by acclamation of [the people]446-the people , that mighty utterance which brushes aside laws and legislation , and from whose decrees there is no appeal , [I]0-i was named [Perpetual Member of [the Diplomatic Body representing the multifarious sovereignties and civilizations of [the globe]449-the globe]448-the diplomatic body representing the multifarious sovereignties and civilizations of the globe]447-perpetual member of the diplomatic body representing the multifarious sovereignties and civilizations of the globe near [the republican court of [the United States of [America]9-america]29-the united states of america]450-the republican court of the united states of america . And [they]442-they brought [me]0-i [home]1782-home with a torchlight procession . ” “[442-they] It is wonderful , [Colonel]452-colonel , simply wonderful . ” “[442-they] It ’s the loftiest official position in [the whole earth]453-the whole earth . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should think so — and the most commanding . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i have named the word . Think of it . [I]0-i frown , and there is war ; [I]0-i smile , and [contending nations]454-contending nations lay down [their]454-contending nations arms . ” “[0-i] It is awful . The responsibility , [I]0-i mean . ” “[0-i] It is nothing . Responsibility is no burden to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i am used to it ; have always been used to it . ” “[0-i] And the work — the work ! Do [you]0-i have to attend all the sittings ? ” “[455-the emperor of russia] Who , [I]0-i ? Does [the Emperor of [Russia]30-russia]455-the emperor of russia attend the conclaves of [the governors of [the provinces]457-the provinces]456-the governors of the provinces ? [He]455-the emperor of russia sits at [home]1782-home , and indicates [his]455-the emperor of russia pleasure . ” [Washington]122-washington was silent a moment , then a deep sigh escaped [him]122-washington . “[459-congressional delegate from cherokee strip] How proud [I]0-i was an hour ago ; how paltry seems [my]0-i little promotion now ! [Colonel]95-mulberry , the reason [I]0-i came to [Washington]114-hawkins is,—I am [Congressional Delegate from [Cherokee Strip]20-cherokee strip]459-congressional delegate from cherokee strip ! ” [The Colonel]374-the colonel sprang to [his]374-the colonel feet and broke out with prodigious enthusiasm : “[114-hawkins] Give [me]0-i [your]114-hawkins hand , [[my]0-i boy]1852-my boy — this is immense news ! [I]0-i congratulate [you]114-hawkins with all [my]0-i heart . [My]0-i prophecies stand confirmed . [I]0-i always said it was in [you]114-hawkins . [I]0-i always said [you]114-hawkins were born for high distinction and would achieve it . [You]114-hawkins ask [Polly]117-polly if [I]0-i did n’t . ” [Washington]122-washington was dazed by this most unexpected demonstration . “[452-colonel] Why , [Colonel]452-colonel , there ’s nothing _ to _ it . That little narrow , desolate , unpeopled , oblong streak of grass and gravel , lost in [the remote wastes of [the vast continent]463-the vast continent]462-the remote wastes of the vast continent — why , it ’s like representing a billiard table — a discarded one . ” “[452-colonel] Tut - tut , it ’s a great , it ’s a staving preferment , and just opulent with influence here . ” “[0-i] Shucks , [Colonel]452-colonel , [I]0-i have n’t even a vote . ” “[0-i] That ’s nothing ; [you]452-colonel can make speeches . ” “[465-the population] No , [I]0-i ca n’t . [The population]465-the population ’s only two hundred — ” “[465-the population] That ’s all right , that ’s all right — ” “[466-they] And [they]466-they had n’t any right to elect [me]0-i ; [we]467-we ’re not even [a territory]468-a territory , there ’s no Organic Act , [the government]391-the government has n’t any official knowledge of [us]467-we whatever . ” “[452-colonel] Never mind about that ; [I]0-i ’ll fix that . [I]0-i ’ll rush the thing through , [I]0-i ’ll get [you]452-colonel organized in no time . ” “[471-your old sterling self] _ Will _ [you]452-colonel , [Colonel?—it]470-colonel?—it ’s _ too _ good of [you]452-colonel ; but it ’s just [[your]452-colonel old sterling self]471-your old sterling self , [the same old ever - faithful friend]472-the same old ever - faithful friend , ” and the grateful tears welled up in [Washington]122-washington ’s eyes . “[467-we] It ’s just as good as done , [[my]0-i boy]1852-my boy , just as good as done . Shake hands . [We]467-we ’ll hitch teams together , [you]452-colonel and [I]0-i , and [we]467-we ’ll make things hum ! ” CHAPTER III . [Mrs. Sellers]98-mrs. sellers returned , now , with [her]98-mrs. sellers composure restored , and began to ask after [[Hawkins]114-hawkins ’s wife]1865-hawkins ’s wife , and about [[his]114-hawkins children]1866-his children , and the number of [them]1866-his children , and so on , and [her]98-mrs. sellers examination of [the witness]1867-the witness resulted in a circumstantial history of [the family]1868-the family ’s ups and downs and driftings to and fro in [the far West]1869-the far west during the previous fifteen years . There was a message , now , from out back , and [Colonel Sellers]95-mulberry went out there in answer to it . [Hawkins]114-hawkins took this opportunity to ask how [the world]409-the world had been using [the Colonel]374-the colonel during the past half - generation . “[0-i] Oh , it ’s been using [him]474-he just the same ; it could n’t change its way of using [him]474-he if it wanted to , for [he]474-he would n’t let it . ” “[98-mrs. sellers] [I]0-i can easily believe that , [Mrs. Sellers]98-mrs. sellers . ” “[474-he] Yes , [you]98-mrs. sellers see , [he]474-he does n’t change , [himself]474-he — not the least little bit in [the world]409-the world — [he]474-he ’s always [Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry . ” “[474-he] [I]0-i can see _ that _ plain enough . ” “[478-they] Just the same old scheming , generous , good - hearted , moonshiny , hopeful , no - account failure [he]474-he always was , and still [everybody]404-everybody likes [him]474-he just as well as if [he]474-he was [the shiningest success]477-the shiningest success . ” “[388-a body] [They]478-they always did : and it was natural , because [he]474-he was so obliging and accommodating , and had something about [him]474-he that made it kind of easy to ask help of [him]474-he , or favors — [you]479-you did n’t feel shy , [you]479-you know , or have that wish — [you]479-you — didn’t — have — to — try feeling that [you]479-you have with [other people]480-other people . ” “[482-any selfish tramp out of nobody] It ’s just so , yet ; and [a body]388-a body wonders at it , too , because [he]474-he ’s been shamefully treated , many times , by people that had used [him]474-he for a ladder to climb up by , and then kicked [him]474-he down when [they]478-they did n’t need [him]474-he any more . For a time [you]479-you can see [he]474-he ’s hurt , [his]474-he pride ’s wounded , because [he]474-he shrinks away from that thing and do n’t want to talk about it — and so [I]0-i used to think _ now _ [he]474-he ’s learned something and [he]474-he ’ll be more careful hereafter — but laws ! in a couple of weeks [he]474-he ’s forgotten all about it , and [any selfish tramp out of [nobody]483-nobody]482-any selfish tramp out of nobody knows where can come and put up a poor mouth and walk right into [his]474-he heart with [his]474-he boots on . ” “[482-any selfish tramp out of nobody] It must try [your]479-you patience pretty sharply sometimes . ” p038.jpg ( 36 K ) “[474-he] Oh , no , [I]0-i ’m used to it ; and [I]0-i ’d rather have [him]474-he so than the other way . When [I]0-i call [him]474-he a failure , [I]0-i mean to [the world]409-the world [he]474-he ’s a failure ; [he]474-he is n’t to [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n’t know as [I]0-i want [him]474-he different much different , anyway . [I]0-i have to scold [him]474-he some , snarl at [him]474-he , [you]479-you might even call it , but [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i ’d do that just the same , if [he]474-he was different — it ’s [my]0-i make . But [I]0-i ’m a good deal less snarly and more contented when [he]474-he ’s a failure than [I]0-i am when [he]474-he is n’t . ” “[474-he] Then [he]474-he is n’t always a failure , ” said [Hawking]124-hawking , brightening . “[491-i] [Him]474-he ? Oh , bless [you]479-you , no . [He]474-he makes a strike , as [he]474-he calls it , from time to time . Then ’s [my]0-i time to fret and fuss . For the money just flies — first come first served . Straight off , [he]474-he loads up [the house]365-the house with cripples and [idiots]486-idiots and stray cats and all the different kinds of poor wrecks that [other people]480-other people do n’t want and [he]474-he _ does _ , and then when the poverty comes again [I]0-i ’ve _ got _ to clear the most of [them]488-they out or [we]489-we ’d starve ; and that distresses [him]474-he , and [me]0-i the same , of course . “ Here ’s [old Dan’l]116-dan’l and [old Jinny]125-jinny , that [the sheriff]1872-the sheriff sold south one of the times that [we]489-we got bankrupted before the war — [they]488-they came wandering back after the peace , worn out and used up on [the cotton plantations]1873-the cotton plantations , helpless , and not another lick of work left in [their]488-they old hides for the rest of this earthly pilgrimage — and [we]489-we so pinched , _ oh _ so pinched for the very crumbs to keep life in [us]489-we , and [he]474-he just flung the door wide , and the way [he]474-he received [them]488-they [you]1874-you ’d have thought [they]488-they had come straight down from [heaven]400-heaven in answer to prayer . [I]490-i took [him]474-he one side and said , ‘ [Mulberry]95-mulberry [we]489-we ca n’t have [them]488-they — we’ve nothing for [ourselves]489-we — [we]489-we ca n’t feed [them]488-they . ’ [He]474-he looked at [me]490-i kind of hurt , and said , ‘ Turn [them]488-they out?—and [they]488-they ’ve come to [me]490-i just as confident and trusting as — as — why [Polly]117-polly , [I]490-i must have _ bought _ that confidence sometime or other a long time ago , and given [my]490-i note , so to speak — [you]117-polly do n’t get such things as a _ gift_—and how am [I]490-i going to go back on a debt like that ? And [you]117-polly see , [they]488-they ’re so poor , and old , and friendless , and — ’ But [I]490-i was ashamed by that time , and shut [him]474-he off , and somehow felt a new courage in [me]490-i , and so [I]490-i said , softly , ‘ [We]489-we ’ll keep [them]488-they — [the Lord]1876-the lord will provide . ’ [He]474-he was glad , and started to blurt out one of those over - confident speeches of [his]474-he , but checked [himself]474-he in time , and said humbly , ‘ _ [I]490-i _ will , anyway . ’ It was years and years and years ago . Well , [you]117-polly see [those old wrecks]1877-those old wrecks are here yet . ”[490-i] “ But do n’t [they]488-they do [[your]474-he housework]1878-your housework ? ”[490-i] “ Laws ! The idea . [They]488-they would if [they]488-they could , poor old things , and perhaps [they]488-they think [they]488-they _ do _ do some of it . But it ’s a superstition . [Dan’l]116-dan’l waits on the front door , and sometimes goes on an errand ; and sometimes [you]1879-you ’ll see one or both of [them]488-they letting on to dust around in here — but that ’s because there ’s something [they]488-they want to hear about and mix [their]488-they gabble into . And [they]488-they ’re always around at meals , for the same reason . But the fact is , [we]1880-we have to keep [a young negro girl]1881-a young negro girl just to take care of _ [them]488-they _ , and [a negro woman]1882-a negro woman to do the housework and _ help _ take care of [them]488-they . ”[491-i] “ Well , [they]488-they ought to be tolerably happy , [I]490-i should think . ”[490-i] “ It ’s no name for it . [They]488-they quarrel together pretty much all the time — most always about religion , because [Dan’l]116-dan’l ’s [a Dunker Baptist]1883-a dunker baptist and [Jinny]125-jinny ’s [a shouting Methodist]1884-a shouting methodist , and [Jinny]125-jinny believes in [special Providences]1885-special providences and [Dan’l]116-dan’l do n’t , because [he]116-dan’l thinks [he]116-dan’l ’s [a kind of a free - thinker]1886-a kind of a free - thinker — and [they]488-they play and sing plantation hymns together , and talk and chatter just eternally and forever , and are sincerely fond of [each other]310-each other and think the world of [Mulberry]95-mulberry , and [he]116-dan’l puts up patiently with all [their]488-they spoiled ways and foolishness , and so — ah , well , [they]488-they ’re happy enough if it comes to that . And [I]490-i do n’t mind — [I’ve]490-i got used to it . [I]490-i can get used to anything , with [Mulberry]95-mulberry to help ; and the fact is , [I]490-i do n’t much care what happens , so long as [he]116-dan’l ’s spared to [me]490-i . ”[490-i] “ Well , here ’s to [him]116-dan’l , and hoping [he]116-dan’l ’ll make another strike soon . ”[491-i] “ And rake in the lame , the halt and the blind , and turn [the house]365-the house into [a hospital]1889-a hospital again ? It ’s what [he]116-dan’l would do . [I]490-i ’ve seen aplenty of that and more . No , [Washington]114-hawkins , [I]490-i want [his]116-dan’l strikes to be mighty moderate ones the rest of the way down [the vale]1890-the vale . ”[490-i] “ Well , then , big strike or little strike , or no strike at all , here ’s hoping [he]116-dan’l ’ll never lack for [friends]325-friends — and [I]490-i do n’t reckon [he]116-dan’l ever will while there ’s people around who know enough to — ”[490-i] “ [Him]116-dan’l lack for [friends]325-friends ! ”[491-i] and [she]490-i tilted [her]490-i head up with a frank pride—“why , [Washington]114-hawkins , [you]114-hawkins ca n’t name [a man that ’s anybody that is n’t fond of [him]116-dan’l]1893-a man that ’s anybody that is n’t fond of him . [I]491-i ’ll tell [you]114-hawkins privately , that [I]491-i ’ve had [Satan]126-satan ’s own time to keep [them]1894-they from appointing [him]116-dan’l to [some office]1895-some office or other . [They]1894-they knew [he]116-dan’l ’d no business with [an office]1896-an office , just as well as [I]491-i did , but [he]116-dan’l ’s [the hardest man to refuse anything to a body ever saw]1897-the hardest man to refuse anything to a body ever saw . Why , [they]1894-they ’d come from [the ends of [the earth]1900-the earth]1899-the ends of the earth to see a circus like that . [I]491-i ’d just as [lieves]1901-lieves be married to [Niagara Falls]32-niagara falls , and done with it . ”[491-i] After a reflective pause [she]491-i added — having wandered back , in the interval , to the remark that had been [her]491-i text : “ Friends?—oh , indeed , [no man]1902-no man ever had more ; and _ such _ friends : [Grant]127-grant , [Sherman]128-sherman , [Sheridan]33-sheridan , [Johnston]129-johnston , [Longstreet]130-longstreet , [Lee]131-lee — many ’s the time [they]1903-they ’ve sat in that chair [you]114-hawkins ’re sitting in — ”[114-hawkins] [Hawkins]114-hawkins was out of it instantly , and contemplating it with a reverential surprise , and with the awed sense of having trodden shod upon holy ground — “ _ [They]1903-they ! _ ”[114-hawkins] [he]114-hawkins said . “ Oh , indeed , yes , a many and a many a time . ”[495-she] [He]114-hawkins continued to gaze at the chair fascinated , magnetized ; and for once in [his]114-hawkins life that [continental stretch of dry prairie]492-continental stretch of dry prairie which stood for [his]114-hawkins imagination was afire , and across it was marching a slanting flamefront that joined [its]492-continental stretch of dry prairie wide horizons together and smothered the skies with smoke . [He]114-hawkins was experiencing what [one or another drowsing , geographically ignorant alien]493-one or another drowsing , geographically ignorant alien experiences every day in the year when [he]114-hawkins turns a dull and indifferent eye out of the car window and it falls upon [a certain station]494-a certain station - sign which reads “ [Stratford - on - Avon]34-stratford - on - avon ! ”[98-mrs. sellers] [Mrs. Sellers]98-mrs. sellers went gossiping comfortably along : “ Oh , [they]1903-they like to hear [him]114-hawkins talk , especially if [their]1903-they load is getting rather heavy on one shoulder and [they]1903-they want to shift it . [He]114-hawkins ’s all air , [you]114-hawkins know,—breeze , [you]114-hawkins may say — and [he]114-hawkins freshens [them]1903-they up ; it ’s a trip to [the country]1904-the country , [they]1903-they say . Many a time [he]114-hawkins ’s made [General Grant]127-grant laugh — and that ’s a tidy job , [I]495-she can tell [you]114-hawkins , and as for [Sheridan]33-sheridan , [his]114-hawkins eye lights up and [he]114-hawkins listens to [Mulberry Sellers]98-mrs. sellers the same as if [he]114-hawkins was artillery . [You]114-hawkins see , the charm about [Mulberry]95-mulberry is , [he]95-mulberry is so catholic and unprejudiced that [he]95-mulberry fits in anywhere and everywhere . It makes [him]95-mulberry powerful good company , and as popular as scandal . [You]114-hawkins go to [the White House]1905-the white house when [the President]412-the president ’s holding a general reception — sometime when [Mulberry]95-mulberry ’s [there]1907-there . Why , dear [me]495-she , _ [you]114-hawkins _ ca n’t tell which of [them]412-the president it is that ’s holding that reception . ”[495-she] “ Well , [he]95-mulberry certainly is [a remarkable man]1908-a remarkable man — and [he]95-mulberry always was . Is [he]95-mulberry religious ? ”[495-she] “ Clear to [his]95-mulberry marrow — does more thinking and reading on that subject than any other except [Russia]30-russia and [Siberia]17-siberia : thrashes around over [the whole field]1909-the whole field , too ; nothing bigoted about [him]95-mulberry . ”[495-she] “ What is [his]95-mulberry religion ? ”[495-she] “ [He]95-mulberry — ”[495-she] [She]495-she stopped , and was lost for a moment or two in thinking , then [she]495-she said , with simplicity , “ [I]374-the colonel think [he]95-mulberry was [a Mohammedan]1910-a mohammedan or something last week . ”[374-the colonel] [Washington]114-hawkins started down [town]496-town , now , to bring [his]114-hawkins trunk , for [the hospitable Sellerses]134-the sellerses would listen to no excuses ; [[their]134-the sellerses house]497-their house must be [[his]114-hawkins home]498-his home during the session . [The Colonel]374-the colonel returned presently and resumed work upon [his]374-the colonel plaything . It was finished when [Washington]114-hawkins got back . “ There it is , ”[374-the colonel] said [the Colonel]374-the colonel , “ all finished . ”[374-the colonel] “ What is it for , [Colonel]452-colonel ? ”[114-hawkins] “ Oh , it ’s just a trifle . Toy to amuse [the children]1858-the children . ”[114-hawkins] [Washington]114-hawkins examined it . “ It seems to be a puzzle . ”[374-the colonel] “ Yes , that ’s what it is . [I]114-hawkins call it Pigs in [the Clover]35-the clover . Put them in — see if [you]114-hawkins can put them in the pen . ”[114-hawkins] After many failures [Washington]114-hawkins succeeded , and was as pleased as [a child]501-a child . “ It ’s wonderfully ingenious , [Colonel]95-mulberry , it ’s ever so clever and interesting — why , [I]114-hawkins could play with it all day . What are [you]95-mulberry going to do with it ? ”[114-hawkins] “ Oh , nothing . Patent it and throw it aside . ”[114-hawkins] “ Do n’t [you]95-mulberry do anything of the kind . There ’s money in that thing . ”[374-the colonel] A compassionate look traveled over [the Colonel]374-the colonel ’s countenance , and [he]374-the colonel said : “ Money — yes ; pin money : a couple of hundred thousand , perhaps . Not more . ”[114-hawkins] [Washington]114-hawkins ’s eyes blazed . “ A couple of hundred thousand dollars ! do [you]95-mulberry call that pin money ? ”[374-the colonel] [The colonel]374-the colonel rose and tip - toed [his]374-the colonel way across [the room]341-the room , closed a door that was slightly ajar , tip - toed [his]374-the colonel way to [his]374-the colonel seat again , and said , under [his]374-the colonel breath : “ [You]114-hawkins can keep a secret ? ”[114-hawkins] [Washington]114-hawkins nodded [his]114-hawkins affirmative , [he]114-hawkins was too awed to speak . “ [You]95-mulberry have heard of materialization — materialization of departed spirits ? ”[114-hawkins] [Washington]114-hawkins had heard of it . “ And probably did n’t believe in it ; and quite right , too . The thing as practised by [ignorant charlatans]1913-ignorant charlatans is unworthy of attention or respect — where there ’s a dim light and a dark cabinet , and a parcel of sentimental gulls gathered together , with [their]1913-ignorant charlatans faith and [their]1913-ignorant charlatans shudders and [their]1913-ignorant charlatans tears all ready , and [one and the same fatty degeneration of protoplasm and humbug]1914-one and the same fatty degeneration of protoplasm and humbug comes out and materializes [himself]1914-one and the same fatty degeneration of protoplasm and humbug into [anybody]1915-anybody [you]1916-you want , [grandmother]1917-grandmother , [grandchild]1918-grandchild , [brother - in - law]1919-brother - in - law , [Witch of Endor]135-witch of endor , [John Milton]136-john milton , [Siamese twins]1920-siamese twins , [Peter the Great]137-peter the great , and all such frantic nonsense — no , that is all foolish and pitiful . But when [a man that is competent]1921-a man that is competent brings the vast powers of _ science _ to bear , it ’s a different matter , a totally different matter , [you]1916-you see . [The spectre that answers _ that _ call]1922-the spectre that answers _ that _ call has come to stay . Do [you]1916-you note the commercial value of that detail ? ”[374-the colonel] “ Well , [I]374-the colonel — the — the truth is , that [I]374-the colonel do n’t quite know that [I]374-the colonel do . Do [you]1916-you mean that such , being permanent , not transitory , would give more general satisfaction , and so enhance the price — of tickets to the show — ”[374-the colonel] “ Show ? Folly — listen to [me]374-the colonel ; and get a good grip on [your]1916-you breath , for [you]1916-you are going to need it . Within three days [I]374-the colonel shall have completed [my]374-the colonel method , and then — let [the world]409-the world stand aghast , for it shall see marvels . [Washington]114-hawkins , within three days — ten at the outside — [you]1916-you shall see [me]374-the colonel call [the dead of any century]1924-the dead of any century , and [they]1924-the dead of any century will arise and walk . [Walk?—they]138-walk?—they shall walk forever , and never die again . Walk with all the muscle and spring of [their]1924-the dead of any century pristine vigor . ”[374-the colonel] “ [Colonel]452-colonel ! Indeed it does take [one]372-one ’s breath away . ”[374-the colonel] “ _ Now _ do [you]1916-you see the money that ’s in it ? ”[374-the colonel] “ [I’m]374-the colonel — well , [I’m]374-the colonel — not really sure that [I]374-the colonel do . ”[374-the colonel] “ [Great Scott]115-great scott , look here . [I]374-the colonel shall have a monopoly ; [they]1927-they ’ll all belong to [me]374-the colonel , wo n’t [they]1927-they ? [Two thousand policemen in [the city of [New York]36-new york]1929-the city of new york]1928-two thousand policemen in the city of new york . Wages , four dollars a day . [I]374-the colonel ’ll replace [them]1928-two thousand policemen in the city of new york with [dead ones]1930-dead ones at half the money . ”[374-the colonel] “ Oh , prodigious ! [I]374-the colonel never thought of that . F - o - u - r thousand dollars a day . Now [I]374-the colonel do begin to see ! But will [dead policemen]1931-dead policemen answer ? ”[374-the colonel] “ Have n’t [they]1931-dead policemen — up to this time ? ”[374-the colonel] “ Well , if [you]1916-you put it that way — ”[374-the colonel] “ Put it any way [you]1916-you want to . Modify it to suit [yourself]1916-you , and [[my]374-the colonel lads]1932-my lads shall still be superior . [They]1932-my lads wo n’t eat , [they]1932-my lads wo n’t drink — don’t need those things ; [they]1932-my lads wo n’t wink for cash at [gambling dens]1933-gambling dens and [unlicensed rum - holes]1934-unlicensed rum - holes , [they]1932-my lads wo n’t spark [the scullery maids]1935-the scullery maids ; and moreover the bands of toughs that ambuscade [them]1932-my lads on lonely beats , and cowardly shoot and knife [them]1932-my lads will only damage the uniforms and not live long enough to get more than a momentary satisfaction out of that . ”[374-the colonel] “ Why , [Colonel]452-colonel , if [you]452-colonel can furnish [policemen]1937-policemen , then of course — ”[374-the colonel] “ Certainly — [I]374-the colonel can furnish any line of goods that ’s wanted . Take [the army]1938-the army , for instance — now [twenty - five thousand men]1939-twenty - five thousand men ; expense , twenty - two millions a year . [I]374-the colonel will dig up [the Romans]139-the romans , [I]374-the colonel will resurrect [the Greeks]140-the greeks , [I]374-the colonel will furnish [the government]391-the government , for ten millions a year , ten thousand veterans drawn from [the victorious legions of all the ages]1941-the victorious legions of all the ages — soldiers that will chase [Indians]141-indians year in and year out on materialized horses , and cost never a cent for rations or repairs . [The armies of [Europe]37-europe]1942-the armies of europe cost two billions a year now — [I]374-the colonel will replace [them]1942-the armies of europe all for a billion . [I]374-the colonel will dig up [the trained statesmen of all ages and all climes]1943-the trained statesmen of all ages and all climes , and furnish [this country]1944-this country with [a Congress that knows enough to come in out of the rain — a thing that ’s never happened yet , since the Declaration of Independence]1945-a congress that knows enough to come in out of the rain — a thing that ’s never happened yet , since the declaration of independence , and never will happen till [these practically dead people]1946-these practically dead people are replaced with the genuine article . [I]374-the colonel will restock [the thrones of [Europe]37-europe]1947-the thrones of europe with the best brains and the best morals that [all the royal sepulchres of all the centuries]1948-all the royal sepulchres of all the centuries can furnish — which is n’t promising very much — and [I]374-the colonel ’ll divide the wages and the civil list , fair and square , merely taking [my]374-the colonel half and — ”[374-the colonel] “ [Colonel]452-colonel , if the half of this is true , there ’s millions in it — millions . ”[374-the colonel] “ Billions in it — billions ; that ’s what [you]452-colonel mean . Why , look here ; the thing is so close at hand , so imminent , so absolutely immediate , that if [a man]1806-a man were to come to [me]505-an energetic looking man now and say , [Colonel]452-colonel , [I]505-an energetic looking man am a little short , and if [you]452-colonel could lend [me]505-an energetic looking man a couple of billion dollars for — come in ! ”[505-an energetic looking man] This in answer to a knock . [An energetic looking man]505-an energetic looking man bustled in with a big pocket - book in [his]505-an energetic looking man hand , took a paper from it and presented it , with the curt remark : “ Seventeenth and last call — [you]452-colonel want to out with that three dollars and forty cents this time without fail , [Colonel Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry . ”[374-the colonel] [The Colonel]374-the colonel began to slap this pocket and that one , and feel here and there and everywhere , muttering : “ What _ have _ [I]114-hawkins done with that wallet?—let [me]114-hawkins see — um — not here , not there — Oh , [I]114-hawkins must have left it in [the kitchen]1952-the kitchen ; [I]114-hawkins ’ll just run and — ”[114-hawkins] “ No [you]452-colonel won’t — [you’ll]452-colonel stay right where [you]452-colonel are . And [you]452-colonel ’re going to disgorge , too — this time . ”[374-the colonel] [Washington]114-hawkins innocently offered to go and look . When [he]114-hawkins was gone [the Colonel]374-the colonel said : “ The fact is , [I]95-mulberry ’ve got to throw [myself]95-mulberry on [your]452-colonel indulgence just this once more , [Suggs]142-suggs ; [you]452-colonel see the remittances [I]95-mulberry was expecting — ”[95-mulberry] “ Hang the remittances — it ’s too stale — it wo n’t answer . Come ! ”[95-mulberry] [The Colonel]95-mulberry glanced about [him]374-the colonel in despair . Then [his]95-mulberry face lighted ; [he]95-mulberry ran to the wall and began to dust off a peculiarly atrocious chromo with [his]95-mulberry handkerchief . Then [he]95-mulberry brought it reverently , offered it to [the collector]508-the collector , averted [his]95-mulberry face and said : “ Take it , but do n’t let [me]95-mulberry see it go . After dinner [the two friends]1965-the two friends put in a long and harassing evening trying to decide what to do with the five thousand dollars reward which [they]1965-the two friends were going to get when [they]1965-the two friends should find [One - Armed Pete]143-pete , and catch [him]515-a man on the train , and prove [him]515-a man on the train to be [the right person]1966-the right person , and extradite [him]515-a man on the train , and ship [him]515-a man on the train to [Tahlequah]39-tahlequah in [the Indian Territory]1967-the indian territory . But there were so many dazzling openings for ready cash that [they]1965-the two friends found it impossible to make up [their]1965-the two friends minds and keep [them]1965-the two friends made up . Finally , [Mrs. Sellers]98-mrs. sellers grew very weary of it all , and said : “[524-them] What is the sense in cooking a rabbit before it ’s caught ? ” Then the matter was dropped , for the time being , and [all]1968-all went to bed . Next morning , being persuaded by [Hawkins]114-hawkins , [the colonel]374-the colonel made drawings and specifications and went down and applied for a patent for [his]114-hawkins toy puzzle , and [Hawkins]114-hawkins took the toy itself and started out to see what chance there might be to do something with it commercially . [He]114-hawkins did not have to go far . In [a small old wooden shanty which had once been occupied as [a dwelling]1971-a dwelling by [some humble negro family]1972-some humble negro family]1970-a small old wooden shanty which had once been occupied as a dwelling by some humble negro family [he]525-you found [a keen - eyed Yankee]1973-a keen - eyed yankee engaged in repairing cheap chairs and other second - hand furniture . [This man]1974-this man examined the toy indifferently ; attempted to do the puzzle ; found it not so easy as [he]1974-this man had expected ; grew more interested , and finally emphatically so ; achieved a success at last , and asked : “[524-them] Is it patented ? ” “[524-them] Patent applied for . ” “[525-you] That will answer . What do [you]525-you want for it ? ” “[525-you] What will it retail for ? ” “[525-you] Well , twenty - five cents , [I]0-i should think . ” “[525-you] What will [you]525-you give for the exclusive right ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t give twenty dollars , if [I]0-i had to pay cash down ; but [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]525-you what [I]0-i ’ll do . [I]0-i ’ll make it and market it , and pay [you]525-you five cents royalty on each one . ” [Washington]114-hawkins sighed . Another dream disappeared ; no money in the thing . So [he]0-i said : “[0-i] All right , take it at that . Draw [me]0-i a paper . ” [He]0-i went [his]0-i way with the paper , and dropped the matter out of [his]0-i mind dropped it out to make room for further attempts to think out the most promising way to invest [his]0-i half of the reward , in case a partnership investment satisfactory to [both beneficiaries]1975-both beneficiaries could not be hit upon . [He]0-i had not been very long at [home]1782-home when [Sellers]98-mrs. sellers arrived sodden with grief and booming with glad excitement — working both these emotions successfully , sometimes separately , sometimes together . [He]0-i fell on [Hawkins]114-hawkins ’s neck sobbing , and said : “[529-my lady] Oh , mourn with [me]0-i [[my]0-i friend]526-my friend , mourn for [[my]0-i desolate house]527-my desolate house : death has smitten [[my]0-i last kinsman]528-my last kinsman and [I]0-i am [Earl of Rossmore]110-rossmore — congratulate [me]0-i ! ” [He]0-i turned to [[his]0-i wife]381-his wife , who had entered while this was going on , put [his]0-i arms about [her]381-his wife and said—“You[529-my lady] will bear up , for [my]0-i sake , [[my]0-i lady]529-my lady — it had to happen , it was decreed . ” [She]381-his wife bore up very well , and said : “[0-i] It ’s no great loss . [Simon Lathers]106-simon lathers was a poor well - meaning useless thing and no account , and [[his]106-simon lathers brother]324-his brother never was worth shucks . ” [The rightful earl]1762-the rightful earl continued : “[532-our good friend] [I]0-i am too much prostrated by these conflicting griefs and joys to be able to concentrate [my]0-i mind upon affairs ; [I]0-i will ask [[our]531-our good friend]532-our good friend here to break the news by wire or post to [the Lady Gwendolen]144-gwendolen and instruct [her]532-our good friend to — ” “[144-gwendolen] _ What _ [Lady Gwendolen]144-gwendolen ? ” “[144-gwendolen] [[Our]531-our poor daughter]533-our poor daughter , who , alas ! — ” “[110-rossmore] [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen ? [The Colonel]95-mulberry grumbled something about its being “[569-you] _ always _ out of order when [you]569-you ’ve got particular and especial use for it , ” but [he]95-mulberry did n’t explain that one of the reasons for this was that the thing was only a dummy and had n’t any wire attached to it . And yet [the Colonel]374-the colonel often used it — when [visitors]1984-visitors were present — and seemed to get messages through it . Mourning paper and a seal were ordered , then [the friends]1985-the friends took a rest . Next afternoon , while [Hawkins]114-hawkins , by request , draped [Andrew Jackson]111-andrew jackson ’s portrait with crape , [the rightful earl]1762-the rightful earl , wrote off the family bereavement to [the usurper in [England]11-england]1987-the usurper in england — a letter which [we]1988-we have already read . [He]114-hawkins also , by letter to [the village]1989-the village authorities at [Duffy ’s Corners]42-duffy ’s corners , [Arkansas]43-arkansas , gave order that the remains of [the late twins]1990-the late twins be embalmed by some [St. Louis]44-st. louis expert and shipped at once to the usurper — with bill . Then [he]114-hawkins drafted out the Rossmore arms and motto on a great sheet of brown paper , and [he]114-hawkins and [Hawkins]114-hawkins took it to [[Hawkins]114-hawkins ’s Yankee furniture - mender]1991-hawkins ’s yankee furniture - mender and at the end of an hour came back with a couple of stunning hatchments , which [they]1985-the friends nailed up on the front of [the house]365-the house — attractions calculated to draw , and [they]1985-the friends did ; for [it]1993-it was mainly [an idle and shiftless negro neighborhood]1994-an idle and shiftless negro neighborhood , with plenty of [ragged children]1995-ragged children and indolent dogs to spare for a point of interest like that , and keep on sparing [them]1985-the friends for it , days and days together . [The new earl]1996-the new earl found — without surprise — this society item in the evening paper , and cut it out and scrapbooked it : By a recent bereavement [[our]1988-we esteemed fellow citizen]1997-our esteemed fellow citizen , [Colonel Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry , [Perpetual Member - at - large of the Diplomatic Body]1998-perpetual member - at - large of the diplomatic body , succeeds , as [rightful lord]1999-rightful lord , to [the great earldom of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]2000-the great earldom of rossmore , third by order of precedence in [the earldoms of [Great Britain]45-great britain]2001-the earldoms of great britain , and will take early measures , by suit in [the House of Lords]2002-the house of lords , to wrest the title and estates from [the present usurping holder of them]2003-the present usurping holder of them . Until the season of mourning is past , the usual Thursday evening receptions at [Rossmore Towers]46-rossmore towers will be discontinued . [Lady Rossmore]145-lady rossmore ’s comment — to [herself]145-lady rossmore : “[0-i] Receptions ! People who do n’t rightly know [him]570-him may think [he]570-him is commonplace , but to [my]0-i mind [he]570-him is [one of [the most unusual men [I]0-i ever saw]572-the most unusual men i ever saw]571-one of the most unusual men i ever saw . As for suddenness and capacity in imagining things , [his]570-him beat do n’t exist , [I]0-i reckon . As like as not it would n’t have occurred to [anybody else]573-anybody else to name this poor old rat - trap [Rossmore Towers]46-rossmore towers , but it just comes natural to [him]570-him . Well , no doubt it ’s a blessed thing to have an imagination that can always make [you]574-you satisfied , no matter how [you]574-you are fixed . [Uncle Dave Hopkins]151-uncle dave hopkins used to always say , ‘ Turn [me]0-i into [John Calvin]152-john calvin , and [I]0-i want to know which place [I]0-i ’m going to ; turn [me]0-i into [Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry and [I]0-i do n’t care . ’ ” [The rightful earl]1762-the rightful earl ’s comment — to [himself]0-i : “[0-i] It ’s a beautiful name , beautiful . Pity [I]0-i did n’t think of it before [I]0-i wrote [the usurper]575-the usurper . But [I]0-i ’ll be ready for [him]575-the usurper when [he]575-the usurper answers . ” CHAPTER V. No answer to that telegram ; [no arriving daughter]2005-no arriving daughter . Yet [nobody]483-nobody showed any uneasiness or seemed surprised ; that is , [nobody]483-nobody but [Washington]114-hawkins . After three days of waiting , [he]0-i asked [Lady Rossmore]145-lady rossmore what [she]145-lady rossmore supposed the trouble was . [She]145-lady rossmore answered , tranquilly : “[576-she] Oh , it ’s some notion of [hers]576-she , [you]577-you never can tell . [She]576-she ’s [a Sellers]578-a sellers , all through — at least in some of [her]576-she ways ; and [a Sellers]578-a sellers ca n’t tell [you]577-you beforehand what [he]578-a sellers ’s going to do , because [he]578-a sellers do n’t know [himself]578-a sellers till [he]578-a sellers ’s done it . _ [She]576-she ’s _ all right ; no occasion to worry about _ [her]576-she _ . When [she]576-she ’s ready [she]576-she ’ll come or [she]576-she ’ll write , and [you]577-you ca n’t tell which , till it ’s happened . ” It turned out to be a letter . It was handed in at that moment , and was received by [the mother]2008-the mother without trembling hands or feverish eagerness , or any other of the manifestations common in the case of long delayed answers to imperative telegrams . [She]145-lady rossmore polished [her]145-lady rossmore glasses with tranquility and thoroughness , pleasantly gossiping along , the while , then opened the letter and began to read aloud : [KENILWORTH KEEP]48-kenilworth keep , [REDGAUNTLET HALL]49-redgauntlet hall , [ROWENA - IVANHOE COLLEGE]2009-rowena - ivanhoe college , THURSDAY . [DEAR PRECIOUS MAMMA ROSSMORE]153-dear precious mamma rossmore : Oh , the joy of [it!—you]2010-it!—you ca n’t think . [They]2011-they had always turned up [their]2011-they noses at [our]2012-our pretentions , [you]577-you know ; and [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers had fought back as well as [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers could by turning up [mine]580-lady gwendolen sellers at [theirs]2011-they . [They]2011-they always said it might be something great and fine to be the rightful Shadow of an earldom , but to merely be shadow _ of _ a shadow , and two or three times removed at that — pooh - pooh ! And [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers always retorted that not to be able to show [four generations of American - Colonial - Dutch Peddler - and - Salt - Cod - McAllister - Nobility]2013-four generations of american - colonial - dutch peddler - and - salt - cod - mcallister - nobility might be endurable , but to _ have _ to confess such an origin — pfew - few ! Well , the telegram , it was just a cyclone ! [The messenger]2014-the messenger came right into [the great Rob Roy Hall of Audience]50-the great rob roy hall of audience , as excited as [he]2014-the messenger could be , singing out , “[580-lady gwendolen sellers] Dispatch for [Lady Gwendolen Sellers]580-lady gwendolen sellers ! ” and [you]577-you ought to have seen [that simpering chattering assemblage of pinchbeck aristocrats]2015-that simpering chattering assemblage of pinchbeck aristocrats , turn to stone ! [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers was off in the corner , of course , by [myself]580-lady gwendolen sellers — it ’s where [Cinderella]154-cinderella belongs . [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers took the telegram and read it , and tried to faint — and [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers could have done it if [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers had had any preparation , but it was all so sudden , [you]577-you know — but no matter , [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers did the next best thing : [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers put [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers handkerchief to [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers eyes and fled sobbing to [[my]580-lady gwendolen sellers room]523-my room , dropping the telegram as [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers started . [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers released one corner of [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers eye a moment — just enough to see the herd swarm for the telegram — and then continued [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers broken - hearted flight just as happy as a bird . Then the visits of condolence began , and [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers had to accept the loan of [[Miss Augusta - Templeton - Ashmore Hamilton]155-miss augusta - templeton - ashmore hamilton ’s quarters]2017-miss augusta - templeton - ashmore hamilton ’s quarters because the press was so great and there is n’t room for three and a cat in mine . And [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers ’ve been holding [a Lodge of Sorrow]2018-a lodge of sorrow ever since and defending [myself]580-lady gwendolen sellers against [people]1954-people ’s attempts to claim kin . And do [you]577-you know , [the very first girl]2020-the very first girl to fetch [her]2020-the very first girl tears and sympathy to [[my]580-lady gwendolen sellers market]2021-my market was [that foolish Skimperton girl who has always snubbed [me]580-lady gwendolen sellers so shamefully and claimed lordship and precedence of [the whole college]2023-the whole college]2022-that foolish skimperton girl who has always snubbed me so shamefully and claimed lordship and precedence of the whole college because [some ancestor of [hers]2020-the very first girl]2024-some ancestor of hers , some time or other , was [a McAllister]156-a mcallister . Why it was like the bottom bird in the menagerie putting on airs because its head ancestor was a pterodactyl . But the ger - reatest triumph of all was — guess . But [you]577-you ’ll never . This is it . [That little fool]2025-that little fool and [two others]2026-two others have always been fussing and fretting over which was entitled to precedence — by rank , [you]577-you know . [They]2026-two others ’ve nearly starved [themselves]2026-two others at it ; for [each]2027-each claimed the right to take precedence of all [the college]2028-the college in leaving the table , and so neither of [them]2026-two others ever finished [her]2025-that little fool dinner , but broke off in the middle and tried to get out ahead of [the others]373-the others . Well , after [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers first day ’s grief and seclusion — [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers was fixing up a mourning dress [you]577-you see — [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers appeared at the public table again , and then — what do [you]577-you think ? [Those three fluffy goslings]2030-those three fluffy goslings sat there contentedly , and squared up the long famine — lapped and lapped , munched and munched , ate and ate , till the gravy appeared in [their]2030-those three fluffy goslings eyes — humbly waiting for [the Lady Gwendolen]144-gwendolen to take precedence and move out first , [you]577-you see ! Oh , yes , [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers ’ve been having a darling good time . And do [you]577-you know , [not one of these collegians]2031-not one of these collegians has had the cruelty to ask [me]580-lady gwendolen sellers how [I]580-lady gwendolen sellers came by [my]580-lady gwendolen sellers new name . [She]581-her ’s bright — that ’s plain . ” “[134-the sellerses] Oh , [they]582-they ’re all bright — [the Sellerses]134-the sellerses . Anyway , [they]582-they would be , if there were any . [Here]158-here was [the most beautiful young creature [he]114-hawkins had ever seen in [his]114-hawkins life]2035-the most beautiful young creature he had ever seen in his life . It was [Sally Sellers Lady Gwendolen]144-gwendolen ; [she]144-gwendolen had come in the night . And it seemed to [him]114-hawkins that [her]581-her clothes were the prettiest and the daintiest [he]114-hawkins had ever looked upon , and the most exquisitely contrived and fashioned and combined , as to decorative trimmings , and fixings , and melting harmonies of color . It was only a morning dress , and inexpensive , but [he]114-hawkins confessed to [himself]114-hawkins , in the English common to [Cherokee Strip]20-cherokee strip , that it was a “[134-the sellerses] corker . ” And now , as [he]114-hawkins perceived , the reason why [the Sellers household]144-gwendolen poverties and sterilities had been made to blossom like the rose , and charm the eye and satisfy the spirit , stood explained ; here was [the magician]2036-the magician ; here in the midst of [her]581-her works , and furnishing in [her]581-her own person the proper accent and climaxing finish of the whole . “[588-the late earl] [[My]0-i daughter]584-my daughter , [Major Hawkins]160-hawkins — come [home]1782-home to mourn ; flown [home]1782-home at the call of affliction to help [the authors of [her]584-my daughter being]587-the authors of her being bear the burden of bereavement . The speech made [him]1758-father [[her]1758-father friend]2038-her friend ; it could n’t well help it . In truth the beauty of [this fair creature]2039-this fair creature was of a rare type , and may well excuse a moment of [our]2040-our time spent in its consideration . It did not consist in the _ fact _ that [she]1758-father had eyes , nose , mouth , chin , hair , ears , it consisted in [their]2041-their arrangement . In true beauty , more depends upon right location and judicious distribution of feature than upon multiplicity of them . So also as regards color . The very combination of colors which in a volcanic irruption would add beauty to a landscape might detach it from [a girl]549-a girl . Such was [Gwendolen Sellers]2043-gwendolen sellers . Coming to [Washington]114-hawkins . The excitement died out of [both men]2044-both men ’s faces . There was a brooding silence for a while , then [the younger one]2045-the younger one said with a sigh : “[511-the man] Why , _ [we]611-we _ ca n’t wait ten days for the money . ” “[511-the man] No — [the man]511-the man ’s unreasonable ; [we]611-we are down to the bed rock , financially speaking . ” “[511-the man] If [we]611-we could explain to [him]511-the man in some way , that [we]611-we are so situated that time is of the utmost importance to [us]611-we — ” “[611-we] Yes — yes , that ’s it — and so if it would be as convenient for [him]511-the man to come at once it would be a great accommodation to [us]611-we , and one which [we]611-we — which [we]611-we — which [we]611-we — wh — well , which [we]611-we should sincerely appreciate — ” “[611-we] That ’s it — and most gladly reciprocate — ” “[0-i] Certainly — that’ll fetch [him]511-the man . Worded right , if [he]511-the man ’s a _ man_—got any of the _ feelings _ of [a man]1806-a man , _ sympathies _ and all that , [he]511-the man ’ll be here inside of twenty - four hours . Pen and paper — come , [we]611-we ’ll get right at it . ” Between [them]611-we [they]611-we framed twenty - two different advertisements , but none was satisfactory . A main fault in all of [them]611-we was urgency . That feature was very troublesome : if made prominent , it was calculated to excite [Pete]143-pete ’s suspicion ; if modified below the suspicion - point it was flat and meaningless . Finally [the Colonel]374-the colonel resigned , and said : “[615-they] [I]0-i have noticed , in such literary experiences as [I]0-i have had , that one of the most taking things to do is to conceal [your]614-you meaning when [you]614-you are _ trying _ to conceal it . Whereas , if [you]614-you go at literature with a free conscience and nothing to conceal , [you]614-you can turn out a book , every time , that the very elect ca n’t understand . [They]615-they all do . ” Then [Hawkins]160-hawkins resigned also , and [the two]2047-the two agreed that [they]611-we must manage to wait the ten days some how or other . Next , [they]611-we caught a ray of cheer : since [they]611-we had something definite to go upon , now , [they]611-we could probably borrow money on the reward — enough , at any rate , to tide [them]611-we over till [they]611-we got it ; and meantime the materializing recipe would be perfected , and then good bye to trouble for good and all . The next day , May the tenth , a couple of things happened — among others .
