In the course of time [the twins]2055-the twins arrived and were delivered to [[their]2055-the twins great kinsman]2056-their great kinsman . To try to describe the rage of [that old man]2057-that old man would profit nothing , the attempt would fall so far short of the purpose . However when [he]2057-that old man had worn [himself]2057-that old man out and got quiet again , [he]2057-that old man looked the matter over and decided that [the twins]2055-the twins had some moral rights , although [they]2055-the twins had no legal ones ; [they]2055-the twins were of [his]2057-that old man blood , and it could not be decorous to treat [them]2055-the twins as common clay . So [he]2057-that old man laid [them]2055-the twins with [[their]2055-the twins majestic kin]2059-their majestic kin in [the Cholmondeley church]2060-the cholmondeley church , with imposing state and ceremony , and added the supreme touch by officiating as [chief mourner]2061-chief mourner [himself]2057-that old man . But [he]2057-that old man drew the line at hatchments . [[Our]2062-our friends in [Washington]114-hawkins]2063-our friends in washington watched the weary days go by , while [they]2063-our friends in washington waited for [Pete]143-pete and covered [his]143-pete name with reproaches because of [his]143-pete calamitous procrastinations . Meantime , [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen , who was as practical and democratic as [the Lady Gwendolen Sellers]2064-the lady gwendolen sellers was romantic and aristocratic , was leading a life of intense interest and activity and getting the most [she]144-gwendolen could out of [her]144-gwendolen double personality . All day long in the privacy of [[her]144-gwendolen work - room]2065-her work - room , [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen earned bread for [the Sellers family]2066-the sellers family ; and all the evening [Lady Gwendolen Sellers]2067-lady gwendolen sellers supported [the Rossmore]106-simon lathers dignity . All day [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers was [American]2068-american , practically , and proud of the work of [her]2067-lady gwendolen sellers head and hands and its commercial result ; all the evening [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers took holiday and dwelt in [a rich shadow - land peopled with titled and coroneted fictions]2069-a rich shadow - land peopled with titled and coroneted fictions . By day , to [her]2067-lady gwendolen sellers , [the place]411-the place was [a plain , unaffected , ramshackle old trap]2071-a plain , unaffected , ramshackle old trap — just that , and nothing more ; by [night]2072-night [it]411-the place was [Rossmore Towers]46-rossmore towers . At college [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers had learned a trade without knowing it . [The girls]2073-the girls had found out that [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers was the designer of [her]2067-lady gwendolen sellers own gowns . [She]2067-lady gwendolen sellers had no idle moments after that , and wanted none ; for the exercise of an extraordinary gift is the supremest pleasure in life , and it was manifest that [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen possessed a gift of that sort in the matter of costume - designing . Within three days after reaching [home]1782-home [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers had hunted up some work ; before [Pete]143-pete was yet due in [Washington]114-hawkins , and before [the twins]2055-the twins were fairly asleep in [English soil]2076-english soil , [she]2067-lady gwendolen sellers was already nearly swamped with work , and the sacrificing of the family chromos for debt had got an effective check . “[616-she] [She]616-she ’s a brick , ” said [Rossmore]106-simon lathers to [the Major]2077-the major ; “[620-rossmore of the peerage] just [[her]616-she father]617-her father all over : prompt to labor with head or hands , and not ashamed of it ; capable , always capable , let the enterprise be what it may ; successful by nature — don’t know what defeat is ; thus , intensely and practically American by inhaled nationalism , and at the same time intensely and aristocratically European by [inherited nobility of blood]618-inherited nobility of blood . [I]0-i do n’t quite make out which window [you]452-colonel — ” “[648-we] All the windows , all of them . Let [him]537-the earl have [his]537-the earl choice — [I’m]0-i indifferent , now that [I]0-i have located [him]537-the earl . [You]452-colonel go and stand on the corner and wait ; [I]0-i ’ll prospect [the hotel]2087-the hotel . ” [The earl]537-the earl drifted here and there through [the swarming lobby]2089-the swarming lobby , and finally took a waiting position in [the neighborhood of the elevator]2090-the neighborhood of the elevator . During an hour [crowds]2091-crowds went up and [crowds]2091-crowds came down ; and all complete as to limbs ; but at last [the watcher]2093-the watcher got a glimpse of a figure that was satisfactory — got a glimpse of the back of it , though [he]2093-the watcher had missed [his]2093-the watcher chance at the face through waning alertness . The glimpse revealed a cowboy hat , and below it a plaided sack of rather loud pattern , and an empty sleeve pinned up to the shoulder . Then [the elevator]2094-the elevator snatched the vision aloft and [the watcher]2093-the watcher fled away in joyful excitement , and rejoined [the fellow - conspirator]2096-the fellow - conspirator . “[648-we] [We]648-we ’ve got [him]537-the earl , [Major]602-major — got [him]537-the earl sure ! [I]0-i ’ve seen [him]537-the earl — seen [him]537-the earl good ; and [I]0-i do n’t care where or when [that man]650-that man approaches [me]0-i backwards , [I]0-i ’ll recognize [him]537-the earl every time . [We]648-we ’re all right . Now for the requisition . ” [They]648-we got it , after the delays usual in such cases . By half past eleven [they]648-we were at [home]1782-home and happy , and went to bed full of dreams of the morrow ’s great promise . Among the elevator load which had the suspect for [fellow - passenger]2098-fellow - passenger was [a young kinsman of [Mulberry Sellers]95-mulberry]2099-a young kinsman of mulberry sellers , but [Mulberry]95-mulberry was not aware of it and did n’t see [him]537-the earl . It was [Viscount Berkeley]102-berkeley . CHAPTER VII . Arrived in [[his]102-berkeley room]2100-his room [Lord Berkeley]166-lord berkeley made preparations for that first and last and all - the - time duty of [the visiting Englishman]2101-the visiting englishman — the jotting down in [his]102-berkeley diary of [his]102-berkeley “[648-we] impressions ” to date . [His]102-berkeley preparations consisted in ransacking [his]102-berkeley “[648-we] box ” for a pen . There was a plenty of steel pens on [his]102-berkeley table with the ink bottle , but [he]102-berkeley was English . [The English people]2102-the english people manufacture steel pens for nineteen - twentieths of [the globe]449-the globe , but [they]2102-the english people never use any [themselves]2102-the english people . [They]2102-the english people use exclusively the pre - historic quill . [[My]663-my lord]1763-my lord not only found a quill pen , but the best one [he]1763-my lord had seen in several years — and after writing diligently for some time , closed with the following entry : p071.jpg ( 18 K ) BUT IN ONE THING [I]663-my HAVE MADE AN IMMENSE MISTAKE , [I]663-my OUGHT TO HAVE SHUCKED [MY]663-my TITLE AND CHANGED [MY]663-my NAME BEFORE [I]663-my STARTED . [He]0-i sat admiring that pen a while , and then went on : “[663-my] All attempts to mingle with [the common people]651-the common people and become [permanently one of [them]651-the common people]652-permanently one of them are going to fail , unless [I]0-i can get rid of it , disappear from it , and re - appear with the solid protection of a new name . [I]0-i am astonished and pained to see how eager [the most of these Americans]653-the most of these americans are to get acquainted with [a lord]654-a lord , and how diligent [they]653-the most of these americans are in pushing attentions upon [him]654-a lord . [They]653-the most of these americans lack English servility , it is true — but [they]653-the most of these americans could acquire it , with practice . [My]0-i quality travels ahead of [me]0-i in the most mysterious way . [I]0-i write [my]0-i family name without additions , on the register of [this hotel]655-this hotel , and imagine that [I]0-i am going to pass for [an obscure and unknown wanderer]656-an obscure and unknown wanderer , but [the clerk]657-the clerk promptly calls out , ‘ Front ! show [[his]654-a lord lordship]1841-his lordship to four - eighty - two ! ’ and before [I]0-i can get to [the lift]659-the lift there is [a reporter]660-a reporter trying to interview [me]0-i as [they]660-a reporter call it . This sort of thing shall cease at once . [I]0-i will hunt up [the American Claimant]661-the american claimant the first thing in the morning , accomplish [my]0-i mission , then change [my]0-i lodging and vanish from scrutiny under a fictitious name . ” [He]0-i left [his]0-i diary on the table , where it would be handy in case any new “[663-my] impressions ” should wake [him]0-i up in the night , then [he]0-i went to bed and presently fell asleep . An hour or two passed , and then [he]0-i came slowly to consciousness with a confusion of mysterious and augmenting sounds hammering at the gates of [his]0-i brain for admission ; the next moment [he]0-i was sharply awake , and those sounds burst with the rush and roar and boom of an undammed freshet into [his]0-i ears . Banging and slamming of shutters ; smashing of windows and the ringing clash of falling glass ; clatter of flying feet along [the halls]2105-the halls ; shrieks , supplications , dumb moanings of despair , within , hoarse shouts of command outside ; cracklings and snappings , and the windy roar of victorious flames ! Bang , bang , bang ! on the door , and a cry : “[663-my] Turn out — [the house]365-the house is on fire ! ” The cry passed on , and the banging . [Lord Berkeley]166-lord berkeley sprang out of bed and moved with all possible speed toward the clothes - press in the darkness and the gathering smoke , but fell over a chair and lost [his]166-lord berkeley bearings . [He]166-lord berkeley groped desperately about on [his]166-lord berkeley hands , and presently struck [his]166-lord berkeley head against the table and was deeply grateful , for it gave [him]166-lord berkeley [his]166-lord berkeley bearings again , since it stood close by the door . [He]166-lord berkeley seized [his]166-lord berkeley most precious possession ; [his]166-lord berkeley journaled Impressions of [America]9-america , and darted from [the room]341-the room . p074.jpg ( 34 K ) [He]0-i ran down [the deserted hall]2107-the deserted hall toward the red lamp which [he]0-i knew indicated [the place of a fire - escape]2108-the place of a fire - escape . The door of [the room beside it]2109-the room beside it was open . In [the room]341-the room the gas was burning full head ; on a chair was a pile of clothing . [He]0-i ran to the window , could not get it up , but smashed it with a chair , and stepped out on the landing of [the fire - escape]2111-the fire - escape ; below [him]0-i was [a crowd of men , with a sprinkling of women]2112-a crowd of men , with a sprinkling of women and youth , massed in a ruddy light . Must [he]0-i go down in [his]0-i spectral night dress ? No — [this side of [the house]365-the house]2113-this side of the house was not yet on fire except at the further end ; [he]0-i would snatch on those clothes . Which [he]0-i did . [They]2115-they fitted well enough , though a trifle loosely , and they were just a shade loud as to pattern . Also as to hat — which was of a new breed to [him]0-i , [Buffalo Bill]167-buffalo bill not having been to [England]11-england yet . One side of the coat went on , but the other side refused ; one of its sleeves was turned up and stitched to the shoulder . [He]0-i started down without waiting to get it loose , made the trip successfully , and was promptly hustled outside the limit - rope by [the police]2116-the police . The cowboy hat and the coat but half on made [him]0-i too much of a centre of attraction for comfort , although nothing could be more profoundly respectful , not to say deferential , than was the manner of [the crowd]2117-the crowd toward [him]0-i . In [his]0-i mind [he]0-i framed a discouraged remark for early entry in [his]0-i diary : “[663-my] It is of no use ; [they]663-my know [a lord]654-a lord through any disguise , and show awe of [him]654-a lord — even something very like fear , indeed . ” Presently one of [the gaping and adoring half - circle of [boys]2119-boys]2118-the gaping and adoring half - circle of boys ventured a timid question . [[My]665-cowboy lord]1763-my lord answered it . [The boys]2121-the boys glanced wonderingly at [each other]310-each other and from somewhere fell the comment : “[665-cowboy] _ English _ cowboy ! Well , if that ai n’t curious . ” Another mental note to be preserved for the diary : “[666-a cowboy] [Cowboy]665-cowboy . Now what might [a cowboy]666-a cowboy be ? Perhaps — ” But [the viscount]2123-the viscount perceived that some more questions were about to be asked ; so [he]0-i worked [his]0-i way out of [the crowd]2117-the crowd , released the sleeve , put on the coat and wandered away to seek [a humble and obscure lodging]2125-a humble and obscure lodging . [He]0-i found it and went to bed and was soon asleep . In the morning , [he]0-i examined [his]0-i clothes . They were rather assertive , it seemed to [him]0-i , but they were new and clean , at any rate . There was considerable property in the pockets . Item , five one - hundred dollar bills . Item , near fifty dollars in small bills and silver . Plug of tobacco . Hymn - book , which refuses to open ; found to contain whiskey . Memorandum book bearing no name . Scattering entries in it , recording in a sprawling , ignorant hand , appointments , bets , horse - trades , and so on , with [people of strange , hyphenated name]2126-people of strange , hyphenated name — [Six - Fingered [Jake]168-six - fingered jake , young - man - afraid - of - his - shadow , [Young - Man]2127-young - man - afraid - of - [his]2127-young - man - Shadow]168-six - fingered jake , young - man - afraid - of - his - shadow , and the like . No letters , no documents . [The young man]2128-the young man muses — maps out [his]2128-the young man course . [His]2128-the young man letter of credit is burned ; [he]2128-the young man will borrow the small bills and the silver in these pockets , apply part of it to advertising for [the owner]2129-the owner , and use the rest for sustenance while [he]2128-the young man seeks work . [He]2128-the young man sends out for the morning paper , next , and proceeds to read about the fire . The biggest line in the display - head announces [his]2128-the young man own death ! The body of the account furnishes all the particulars ; and tells how , with the inherited heroism of [[his]0-i caste]2130-his caste , [he]0-i went on saving [women]2131-women and [children]2132-children until escape for [himself]0-i was impossible ; then with the eyes of [weeping multitudes]2133-weeping multitudes upon [him]0-i , [he]0-i stood with folded arms and sternly awaited the approach of [the devouring fiend]2134-the devouring fiend ; “[669-men] and so standing , amid a tossing sea of flame and on - rushing billows of smoke , [the noble young heir of [the great house of [Rossmore]110-rossmore]668-the great house of rossmore]667-the noble young heir of the great house of rossmore was caught up in a whirlwind of fiery glory , and disappeared forever from the vision of [men]669-men . ” The thing was so fine and generous and knightly that it brought the moisture to [his]0-i eyes . Presently [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i : “[114-hawkins] What to do is as plain as day , now . [[My]0-i Lord [Berkeley]166-lord berkeley]670-my lord berkeley is dead — let [him]670-my lord berkeley stay so . Died creditably , too ; that will make the calamity the easier for [[my]0-i father]671-my father . And [I]0-i do n’t have to report to [the American Claimant]661-the american claimant , now . Yes , nothing could be better than the way matters have turned out . [I]0-i have only to furnish [myself]0-i with a new name , and take [my]0-i new start in life totally untrammeled . Now [I]0-i breathe [my]0-i first breath of real freedom ; and how fresh and breezy and inspiring it is ! At last [I]0-i am [a man]1806-a man ! [a man on equal terms with [[my]0-i neighbor]675-my neighbor]674-a man on equal terms with my neighbor ; and by [my]0-i manhood , and by it alone , [I]0-i shall rise and be seen of [the world]409-the world , or [I]0-i shall sink from sight and deserve it . This _ is _ the gladdest day , and the proudest , that ever poured it ’s sun upon [my]0-i head ! ” CHAPTER VIII . “[114-hawkins] God bless [my]0-i soul , [Hawkins]114-hawkins ! ” The morning paper dropped from [the Colonel]95-mulberry ’s nerveless - grasp . “[114-hawkins] What is it ? ” “[114-hawkins] [He]677-he ’s gone!—the bright , the young , the gifted , [the noblest of [his]677-he illustrious race]678-the noblest of his illustrious race — gone ! gone up in flames and unimaginable glory ! ” “[114-hawkins] Who ? ” “[114-hawkins] [[My]0-i precious , precious young kinsman]679-my precious , precious young kinsman — [Kirkcudbright Llanover Marjoribanks Sellers Viscount Berkeley]102-berkeley , [son and heir of usurping [Rossmore]110-rossmore]680-son and heir of usurping rossmore . ” “[114-hawkins] No ! ” “[114-hawkins] It ’s true — too true . ” “[114-hawkins] When ? ” “[114-hawkins] Last night . ” “[114-hawkins] Where ? ” “[114-hawkins] Right here in [Washington]114-hawkins ; where [he]677-he arrived from [England]11-england last night , the papers say . ” “[114-hawkins] [You]114-hawkins do n’t say ! ” “[114-hawkins] [Hotel]629-hotel burned down . ” “[58-the new gadsby] [What hotel]682-what hotel ? ” “[58-the new gadsby] [The New Gadsby]58-the new gadsby ! ” “[685-both _ who] Oh , [my]0-i goodness ! It ’s well [you]95-mulberry spoke , for [I]537-the earl ’m not naturally discreet with [my]537-the earl tongue when [I]537-the earl ’m not warned . ”[537-the earl] [Sellers]95-mulberry reached out and touched a bell - button in the wall ; set [his]95-mulberry eye upon the rear door and waited ; touched it again and waited ; and just as [Hawkins]114-hawkins was remarking admiringly that [the Colonel]374-the colonel was [the most progressive and most alert man [he]114-hawkins had ever seen]698-the most progressive and most alert man he had ever seen , in the matter of impressing into [his]374-the colonel service every modern convenience the moment it was invented , and always keeping breast to breast with [the drum major]699-the drum major in the great work of material civilization , [he]95-mulberry forsook the button ( which had n’t any wire attached to it , ) rang a vast dinner bell which stood on the table , and remarked that [he]95-mulberry had tried that new - fangled dry battery , now , to [his]95-mulberry entire satisfaction , and had got enough of it ; and added : “ Nothing would do [Graham Bell]170-graham bell but [I]537-the earl must try it ; said the mere _ fact _ of [my]537-the earl trying it would secure public confidence , and get it a chance to show what it could do . [I]537-the earl _ told _ [him]374-the colonel that in theory a dry battery was just a curled darling and no mistake , but when it come to _ practice _ , sho!—and here ’s the result . Was [I]537-the earl right ? What should _ [you]114-hawkins _ say , [Washington Hawkins]114-hawkins ? [You]114-hawkins ’ve seen [me]537-the earl try that button twice . When a bell ring for [anybody]1915-anybody , en [old marster]2155-old marster tell [me]537-the earl to — ”[537-the earl] “ Clear out , and settle it in [the kitchen]1952-the kitchen ! ”[537-the earl] The noise of the quarreling presently sank to a murmur in the distance , and [the earl]537-the earl added : “ That ’s a trouble with [old house servants that were [[your]537-the earl slaves]2158-your slaves once and have been [[your]537-the earl personal friends]2159-your personal friends always]2157-old house servants that were your slaves once and have been your personal friends always . ”[537-the earl] “ Yes , and [members of the family]2160-members of the family . ”[537-the earl] “ [Members of [the family]1868-the family]2160-members of the family is just what [they]2160-members of the family become—_the _ [members of [the family]1868-the family]2160-members of the family , in fact . And sometimes [master]2165-master and [mistress of the household]2166-mistress of the household . [These two]2167-these two are mighty good and loving and faithful and honest , but hang it , [they]2167-these two do just about as [they]2167-these two please , [they]2167-these two chip into a conversation whenever [they]2167-these two want to , and the plain fact is , [they]2167-these two ought to be killed . ”[537-the earl] It was a random remark , but it gave [him]537-the earl an idea — however , nothing could happen without that result . “ What [I]537-the earl wanted , [Hawkins]114-hawkins , was to send for [the family]1868-the family and break the news to [them]1868-the family . ”[537-the earl] “ O , never mind bothering with [the servants]512-the servants , then . [I]537-the earl will go and bring [them]512-the servants down . ”[537-the earl] While [he]537-the earl was gone , [the earl]537-the earl worked [his]537-the earl idea . “ Yes , ”[537-the earl] [he]537-the earl said to [himself]537-the earl , “ when [I]715-the wife ’ve got the materializing down to a certainty , [I]715-the wife will get [Hawkins]114-hawkins to kill [them]512-the servants , and after that [they]512-the servants will be under better control . Without doubt [a materialized negro]2170-a materialized negro could easily be hypnotized into a state resembling silence . And this could be made permanent — yes , and also modifiable , at will — sometimes _ very _ silent , sometimes turn on more talk , more action , more emotion , according to what [you]2171-you want . It ’s a prime good idea . Make it adjustable — with a screw or something . ”[715-the wife] [The two ladies]703-the two ladies entered , now , with [Hawkins]114-hawkins , and [the two negroes]704-the two negroes followed , uninvited , and fell to brushing and dusting around , for [they]703-the two ladies perceived that there was matter of interest to the fore , and were willing to find out what it was . [Sellers]171-marse sellers broke the news with stateliness and ceremony , first warning [the ladies]705-the ladies , with gentle art , that a pang of peculiar sharpness was about to be inflicted upon [their]705-the ladies hearts — hearts still sore from a like hurt , still lamenting a like loss — then [he]171-marse sellers took the paper , and with trembling lips and with tears in [his]171-marse sellers voice [he]171-marse sellers gave [them]705-the ladies that heroic death - picture . The result was a very genuine outbreak of sorrow and sympathy from [all the hearers]706-all the hearers . [The elder lady]707-the elder lady cried , thinking how proud [[that great - hearted young hero]708-that great - hearted young hero ’s mother]709-that great - hearted young hero ’s mother would be , if [she]709-that great - hearted young hero ’s mother were living , and how unappeasable [her]709-that great - hearted young hero ’s mother grief ; and [the two old servants]710-the two old servants cried with [her]709-that great - hearted young hero ’s mother , and spoke out [their]710-the two old servants applauses and [their]710-the two old servants pitying lamentations with the eloquent sincerity and simplicity native to [[their]710-the two old servants race]711-their race . [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was touched , and the romantic side of [her]144-gwendolen nature was strongly wrought upon . [She]144-gwendolen said that such a nature as [that young man]712-that young man ’s was rarely and truly noble , and nearly perfect ; and that with [nobility of birth]713-nobility of birth added it was entirely perfect . For [such a man]714-such a man [she]144-gwendolen could endure all things , suffer all things , even to the sacrificing of [her]144-gwendolen life . [She]144-gwendolen wished [she]144-gwendolen could have seen [him]714-such a man ; the slightest , the most momentary contact with such a spirit would have ennobled [her]144-gwendolen whole character and made ignoble thoughts and ignoble acts thereafter impossible to [her]144-gwendolen forever . “ Have [they]710-the two old servants found the body , [Rossmore]106-simon lathers ? ”[715-the wife] asked [the wife]715-the wife . “ Yes , that is , [they]710-the two old servants ’ve found several . It must be one of them , but none of them are recognizable . ”[144-gwendolen] “ What are [you]106-simon lathers going to do ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ [I]715-the wife am going down there and identify [one of [them]710-the two old servants]2172-one of them and send it [home]1782-home to [the stricken father]2174-the stricken father . ”[715-the wife] “ But [papa]2175-papa , did [you]2175-papa ever see [the young man]2128-the young man ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ No , [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen - why ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ How will [you]2175-papa identify it ? ”[715-the wife] “ [I]144-gwendolen — well , [you]2175-papa know it says [none of [them]710-the two old servants]2177-none of them are recognizable . [I]144-gwendolen ’ll send [[his]2128-the young man father]302-his father one of [them]710-the two old servants — there ’s probably no choice . ”[144-gwendolen] [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen knew it was not worth while to argue the matter further , since [[her]144-gwendolen father]617-her father ’s mind was made up and there was a chance for [him]617-her father to appear upon that sad scene down yonder in an authentic and official way . So [she]144-gwendolen said no more — till [he]617-her father asked for a basket . “ A basket , [papa]2175-papa ? What for ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ It might be ashes . ”[114-hawkins] CHAPTER IX . [The earl]537-the earl and [Washington]114-hawkins started on the sorrowful errand , talking as [they]718-they walked . “ And as _ usual ! _ ”[144-gwendolen] “ What , [Colonel]452-colonel ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ Seven of [them]710-the two old servants in [that hotel]2181-that hotel . [Experience]173-experience teaches [them]710-the two old servants nothing ; [they]710-the two old servants ca n’t seem to learn anything except out of a book . In some cases there ’s manifestly a fatality about it . For instance , take What’s - [her]144-gwendolen - name , that plays those sensational thunder and lightning parts . [She]144-gwendolen ’s got a perfectly immense reputation — draws like a dog - fight — and it all came from getting burnt out in [hotels]2183-hotels . ”[144-gwendolen] “ Why , how could that give [her]144-gwendolen a reputation as [an actress]2184-an actress ? ”[144-gwendolen] “ It didn’t — it only made [her]144-gwendolen name familiar . All the papers were full of it . [She]144-gwendolen struck for higher pay and got it . Well , [she]144-gwendolen got burnt out again and lost all [her]144-gwendolen diamonds , and it gave [her]144-gwendolen such a lift that [she]144-gwendolen went starring . ”[144-gwendolen] “ Well , if hotel fires are all [she]144-gwendolen ’s got to depend on to keep up [her]144-gwendolen name , it ’s a pretty precarious kind of a reputation [I]144-gwendolen should think . ”[144-gwendolen] “ Not with [her]144-gwendolen . [We]2248-we ’ll place [them]2247-they reverently away , and [he]166-lord berkeley shall never know . ”[166-lord berkeley] CHAPTER X. [The young Lord Berkeley]166-lord berkeley , with the fresh air of freedom in [his]166-lord berkeley nostrils , was feeling invincibly strong for [his]166-lord berkeley new career ; and yet — and yet — if the fight should prove a very hard one at first , very discouraging , very taxing on untoughened moral sinews , [he]166-lord berkeley might in some weak moment want to retreat . Not likely , of course , but possibly that might happen . And so on the whole it might be pardonable caution to burn [[his]166-lord berkeley bridges]766-his bridges behind [him]166-lord berkeley . Oh , without doubt . [He]166-lord berkeley must not stop with advertising for [the owner of that money]767-the owner of that money , but must put it where [he]166-lord berkeley could not borrow from it [himself]166-lord berkeley , meantime , under stress of circumstances . So [he]166-lord berkeley went down [town]496-town , and put in [his]166-lord berkeley advertisement , then went to [a bank]769-a bank and handed in $ 500 for deposit . “ What name ? ”[166-lord berkeley] [He]166-lord berkeley hesitated and colored a little ; [he]166-lord berkeley had forgotten to make a selection . [He]166-lord berkeley now brought out the first one that suggested itself : “ [Howard Tracy]179-tracy . ”[770-the clerks] When [he]166-lord berkeley was gone [the clerks]770-the clerks , marveling , said : “ [The cowboy blushed]2249-the cowboy blushed . ”[166-lord berkeley] The first step was accomplished . The money was still under [his]166-lord berkeley command and at [his]166-lord berkeley disposal , but the next step would dispose of that difficulty . [He]166-lord berkeley went to [another bank]771-another bank and drew upon [the first bank]772-the first bank for the $ 500 by check . The money was collected and deposited a second time to the credit of [Howard Tracy]179-tracy . [He]166-lord berkeley was asked to leave a few samples of [his]166-lord berkeley signature , which [he]166-lord berkeley did . Then [he]166-lord berkeley went away , once more proud and of perfect courage , saying : “ No help for [me]166-lord berkeley now , for henceforth [I]166-lord berkeley could n’t draw that money without identification , and that is become legally impossible . No resources to fall back on . It is work or starve from now to the end . [I]166-lord berkeley am ready — and not afraid ! ”[166-lord berkeley] Then [he]166-lord berkeley sent this cablegram to [[his]166-lord berkeley father]302-his father : “ Escaped unhurt from [burning hotel]2250-burning hotel . Have taken fictitious name . [Goodbye]180-goodbye . ”[166-lord berkeley] During the evening while [he]166-lord berkeley was wandering about in [one of [the outlying districts of [the city]776-the city]775-the outlying districts of the city]774-one of the outlying districts of the city , [he]166-lord berkeley came across [a small brick church]777-a small brick church , with a bill posted there with these words printed on it : “ [MECHANICS ’ CLUB DEBATE]2251-mechanics ’ club debate . ALL INVITED . ”[784-the chairman] [He]166-lord berkeley saw [people]1954-people , apparently mainly of [the working class]779-the working class , entering [the place]411-the place , and [he]166-lord berkeley followed and took [his]166-lord berkeley seat . [It]777-a small brick church was [a humble little church]781-a humble little church , quite bare as to ornamentation . [It]777-a small brick church had painted pews without cushions , and no pulpit , properly speaking , but [it]777-a small brick church had [a platform]782-a platform . On [the platform]783-the platform sat [the chairman]784-the chairman , and by [his]784-the chairman side sat [a man who held a manuscript in [his]785-a man who held a manuscript in his hand and had the waiting look of one who is going to perform the principal part hand and had the waiting look of [one who is going to perform the principal part]786-one who is going to perform the principal part]785-a man who held a manuscript in his hand and had the waiting look of one who is going to perform the principal part . [The church]787-the church was soon filled with [a quiet and orderly congregation of decently dressed and modest people]788-a quiet and orderly congregation of decently dressed and modest people . This is what [the chairman]784-the chairman said : “ [The essayist for this evening]2252-the essayist for this evening is [an old member of [[our]2254-our club]2255-our club whom [you]2256-you all know]2253-an old member of our club whom you all know , [Mr. Parker]181-mr. parker , [assistant editor of the Daily Democrat]2257-assistant editor of the daily democrat . The subject of [his]181-mr. parker essay is the American Press , and [he]181-mr. parker will use as [his]181-mr. parker text a couple of paragraphs taken from [Mr. Matthew Arnold]182-mr. arnold ’s new book . [He]181-mr. parker asks [me]183-goethe to read these texts for [him]181-mr. parker . The first is as follows : “[183-goethe] ‘ [Goethe]183-goethe says somewhere that “ the thrill of awe , ”[183-goethe] that is to say , REVERENCE , is the best thing humanity has . ” “[182-mr. arnold] [Mr. Arnold]182-mr. arnold ’s other paragraph is as follows : “ ‘ [I]790-the essayist should say that if one were searching for the best means to efface and kill in [a whole nation]2258-a whole nation the discipline of respect , one could not do better than take the American newspapers . ”[790-the essayist] p095.jpg ( 18 K ) [Mr. Parker]181-mr. parker rose and bowed , and was received with warm applause . [He]181-mr. parker then began to read in a good round resonant voice , with clear enunciation and careful attention to [his]181-mr. parker pauses and emphases . [His]181-mr. parker points were received with approval as [he]181-mr. parker went on . [The essayist]790-the essayist took the position that the most important function of a public journal in [any country]791-any country was the propagating of national feeling and pride in the national name — the keeping [the people]446-the people “ in love with _ [[their]446-the people _ country]2259-their _ country and [_ [its]2259-their _ country _ institutions]2260-_ its _ institutions , and shielded from the allurements of alien and inimical systems . ”[790-the essayist] [He]790-the essayist sketched the manner in which [the reverent Turkish or Russian journalist]793-the reverent turkish or russian journalist fulfilled this function — the one assisted by the prevalent “ discipline of respect ”[182-mr. arnold] for [the bastinado]794-the bastinado , the other for [Siberia]17-siberia . Continuing , [he]790-the essayist said : The chief function of [an English journal]795-an english journal is that of all other journals [the world over]796-the world over : it must keep the public eye fixed admiringly upon certain things , and keep it diligently diverted from certain others . For instance , it must keep the public eye fixed admiringly upon [the glories of [England]11-england]797-the glories of england , a processional splendor stretching its receding line down the hazy vistas of time , with the mellowed lights of a thousand years glinting from its banners ; and it must keep it diligently diverted from the fact that all these glories were for the enrichment and aggrandizement of [the petted and privileged few]798-the petted and privileged few , at cost of the blood and sweat and poverty of [the unconsidered masses who achieved them but might not enter in and partake of them]799-the unconsidered masses who achieved them but might not enter in and partake of them . [It]800-it must keep the public eye fixed in loving and awful reverence upon the throne as a sacred thing , and diligently divert [it]800-it from the fact that no throne was ever set up by the unhampered vote of [a majority of [any nation]802-any nation]801-a majority of any nation ; and that hence no throne exists that has a right to exist , and no symbol of it , flying from any flagstaff , is righteously entitled to wear any device but the skull and crossbones of that kindred industry which differs from [royalty]803-royalty only business - wise — merely as retail differs from wholesale . [It]800-it must keep [the citizen]804-the citizen ’s eye fixed in reverent docility upon that curious invention of machine politics , [an Established Church]805-an established church , and upon that bald contradiction of common justice , [a hereditary nobility]806-a hereditary nobility ; and diligently divert [it]800-it from the fact that [the one]807-the one damns [him]790-the essayist if [he]790-the essayist does n’t wear its collar , and robs [him]790-the essayist under the gentle name of taxation whether [he]790-the essayist wears it or not , and [the other]808-the other gets all the honors while [he]790-the essayist does all the work . [The essayist]790-the essayist thought that [Mr. Arnold]182-mr. arnold , with [his]182-mr. arnold trained eye and intelligent observation , ought to have perceived that the very quality which [he]182-mr. arnold so regretfully missed from [our]810-our press — respectfulness , reverence — was exactly the thing which would make [our]810-our press useless to [us]810-our if it had it — rob [it]811-it of the very thing which differentiates [it]811-it from all other journalism in [the world]409-the world and makes it distinctively and preciously American , its frank and cheerful irreverence being by all odds the most valuable of all its qualities . “ For [its]811-it mission — overlooked by [Mr. Arnold]182-mr. arnold — is to stand guard over [a nation]2261-a nation ’s liberties , not its humbugs and shams . ”[182-mr. arnold] [He]182-mr. arnold thought that if during fifty years the institutions of [the old world]813-the old world could be exposed to the fire of [a flouting and scoffing press like [ours]810-our]814-a flouting and scoffing press like ours , “ monarchy and its attendant crimes would disappear from [Christendom]60-christendom . ”[182-mr. arnold] [Monarchists]815-monarchists might doubt this ; then “ why not persuade [the Czar]2262-the czar to give it a trial in [Russia]30-russia ? ”[832-the creator , nurse] Concluding , [he]182-mr. arnold said : Well , the charge is , that [our]810-our press has but little of that old world quality , reverence . Let [us]810-our be candidly grateful that it is so . With its limited reverence [it]811-it at least reveres the things which [this nation]816-this nation reveres , as a rule , and that is sufficient : what [other people]480-other people revere is fairly and properly matter of light importance to [us]810-our . [Our]810-our press does not reverence [kings]818-kings , it does not reverence so called nobilities , it does not reverence [established ecclesiastical slaveries]819-established ecclesiastical slaveries , it does not reverence laws which rob [a younger son]820-a younger son to fatten [an elder one]821-an elder one , it does not reverence any fraud or sham or infamy , howsoever old or rotten or holy , which sets [one citizen]822-one citizen above [[his]822-one citizen neighbor]823-his neighbor by accident of birth : it does not reverence any law or custom , howsoever old or decayed or sacred , which shuts against [the best man in [the land]825-the land]824-the best man in the land [the best place in [the land]825-the land]826-the best place in the land and the divine right to prove property and go up and occupy [it]825-the land . In the sense of [the poet Goethe]828-the poet goethe — that [meek idolater of [provincial three carat royalty and nobility]830-provincial three carat royalty and nobility]829-meek idolater of provincial three carat royalty and nobility — [[our]810-our press]831-our press is certainly bankrupt in the “ thrill of awe”—otherwise[179-tracy] reverence ; reverence for nickel plate and brummagem . Let [us]810-our sincerely hope that this fact will remain a fact forever : for to [my]0-i mind a discriminating irreverence is the creator and protector of human liberty — even as the other thing is [the creator , nurse]832-the creator , nurse , and steadfast protector of all forms of human slavery , bodily and mental . [Tracy]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , almost shouted to [himself]179-tracy , “ [I]784-the chairman ’m glad [I]784-the chairman came to [this country]1944-this country . [I]784-the chairman was right . [I]784-the chairman was right to seek out [a land where such healthy principles and theories are in [men]669-men ’s hearts and minds]2264-a land where such healthy principles and theories are in men ’s hearts and minds . Think of the innumerable slaveries imposed by misplaced reverence ! How well [he]179-tracy brought that out , and how true it is . There ’s manifestly prodigious force in reverence . If [you]2266-your can get [a man]1806-a man to reverence [your]2266-your ideals , [he]1806-a man ’s [[your]2266-your slave]2268-your slave . Oh , yes , in all the ages [the peoples of [Europe]37-europe]2269-the peoples of europe have been diligently taught to avoid reasoning about the shams of monarchy and [nobility]2270-nobility , been taught to avoid examining [them]2269-the peoples of europe , been taught to reverence [them]2269-the peoples of europe ; and now , as a natural result , to reverence [them]2269-the peoples of europe is second nature . In order to shock [them]2269-the peoples of europe it is sufficient to inject a thought of the opposite kind into [their]2269-the peoples of europe dull minds . For ages , any expression of so - called irreverence from [their]2269-the peoples of europe lips has been sin and crime . The sham and swindle of all this is apparent the moment [one]372-one reflects that [he]372-one is [himself]372-one the only legitimately qualified judge of what is entitled to reverence and what is not . Come , [I]784-the chairman had n’t thought of that before , but it is true , absolutely true . What right has [Goethe]183-goethe , what right has [Arnold]182-mr. arnold , what right has any dictionary , to define the word Irreverence for [me]784-the chairman ? What [their]2269-the peoples of europe ideals are is nothing to [me]784-the chairman . So long as [I]784-the chairman reverence [my]784-the chairman own ideals [my]784-the chairman whole duty is done , and [I]784-the chairman commit no profanation if [I]784-the chairman laugh at [theirs]2269-the peoples of europe . [I]784-the chairman may scoff at [other people]480-other people ’s ideals as much as [I]784-the chairman want to . It is [my]784-the chairman right and [my]784-the chairman privilege . [No man]1902-no man has any right to deny it . ”[784-the chairman] [Tracy]179-tracy was expecting to hear the essay debated , but this did not happen . [The chairman]784-the chairman said , by way of explanation : “ [I]179-tracy would say , for the information of [the strangers present here]2274-the strangers present here , that in accordance with [our]2275-we custom the subject of this meeting will be debated at the next meeting of [the club]2276-the club . This is in order to enable [[our]2275-we members]2277-our members to prepare what [they]2277-our members may wish to say upon the subject with pen and paper , for [we]2275-we are mainly mechanics and unaccustomed to speaking . [We]2275-we are obliged to write down what [we]2275-we desire to say . ”[179-tracy] Many brief papers were now read , and several offhand speeches made in discussion of the essay read at the last meeting of [the club]2276-the club , which had been a laudation , by [some visiting professor , of college culture]835-some visiting professor , of college culture , and the grand results flowing from it to [the nation]836-the nation . One of the papers was read by [a man approaching middle age]837-a man approaching middle age , who said [he]837-a man approaching middle age had n’t had a college education , that [he]837-a man approaching middle age had got [his]837-a man approaching middle age education in [a printing office]838-a printing office , and had graduated from there into [the patent office]839-the patent office , where [he]837-a man approaching middle age had been [a clerk]840-a clerk now for a great many years . Then [he]837-a man approaching middle age continued to this effect : [The essayist]790-the essayist contrasted [the America]9-america of to - day with the [America]9-america of bygone times , and certainly the result is the exhibition of a mighty progress . But [I]0-i think [he]837-a man approaching middle age a little overrated the college - culture share in the production of that result . It can no doubt be easily shown that [the colleges]842-the colleges have contributed the intellectual part of this progress , and that that part is vast ; but that the material progress has been immeasurably vaster , [I]0-i think [you]843-you will concede . Now [I]0-i have been looking over a list of [inventors]844-inventors — [the creators of this amazing material development]845-the creators of this amazing material development — and [I]0-i find that [they]844-inventors were [not college - bred men]846-not college - bred men . Of course there are exceptions — like [[Professor Henry]184-professor henry of [Princeton]62-princeton]847-professor henry of princeton , [the inventor of [Mr. Morse]185-mr. morse ’s system of telegraphy]848-the inventor of mr. morse ’s system of telegraphy — but these exceptions are few . It is not overstatement to say that the imagination - stunning material development of this century , the only century worth living in since time itself was invented , is the creation of [men not college - bred]849-men not college - bred . [We]850-we think [we]850-we see what [these inventors]851-these inventors have done : no , [we]850-we see only the visible vast frontage of [their]851-these inventors work ; behind it is [their]851-these inventors far vaster work , and it is invisible to the careless glance . [They]851-these inventors have reconstructed [this nation]816-this nation — made it over , that is — and metaphorically speaking , have multiplied [its]816-this nation numbers almost beyond the power of figures to express . [I]0-i will explain what [I]0-i mean . What constitutes [the population of [a land]854-a land]853-the population of a land ? Merely the numberable packages of meat and bones in it called by [courtesy men]855-courtesy men and [women]2131-women ? Shall a million ounces of brass and a million ounces of gold be held to be of the same value ? Take a truer standard : the measure of [a man]1806-a man ’s contributing capacity to [his]1806-a man time and [[his]1806-a man people]858-his people — the work [he]1806-a man can do — and then number the population of [this country]1944-this country to - day , as multiplied by what [a man]1806-a man can now do , more than [[his]1806-a man grandfather]861-his grandfather could do . By this standard of measurement , [this nation]816-this nation , two or three generations ago , consisted of [mere cripples]863-mere cripples , [paralytics]864-paralytics , [dead men]865-dead men , as compared with [the men of to - day]866-the men of to - day . In 1840 [our]867-our population was 17,000,000 . By way of rude but striking illustration , let [us]867-our consider , for argument ’s sake , that four of these millions consisted of [aged people]868-aged people , [little children]869-little children , and [other incapables]870-other incapables , and that the remaining 13,000,000 were divided and employed as follows : 2,000,000 as [ginners of cotton]871-ginners of cotton . 6,000,000 ( [women ) as stocking - knitters]872-women ) as stocking - knitters . 2,000,000 ( [women ) as thread - spinners]873-women ) as thread - spinners . 500,000 as [screw makers]874-screw makers . 400,000 as [reapers]875-reapers , [binders]876-binders , etc . 1,000,000 as corn - shellers . 40,000 as [weavers]877-weavers . 1,000 as [stitchers of shoe soles]878-stitchers of shoe soles . Now the deductions which [I]0-i am going to append to these figures may sound extravagant , but they are not . [I]0-i take them from Miscellaneous Documents No . 50 , second session 45th Congress , and they are official and trustworthy . To - day , the work of [those 2,000,000 cotton - ginners]879-those 2,000,000 cotton - ginners is done by [2,000 men]880-2,000 men ; that of [the 6,000,000 stocking - knitters]881-the 6,000,000 stocking - knitters is done by [3,000 boys]882-3,000 boys ; that of [the 2,000,000 thread - spinners]883-the 2,000,000 thread - spinners is done by [1,000 girls]884-1,000 girls ; that of [the 500,000 screw makers]885-the 500,000 screw makers is done by [500 girls]886-500 girls ; that of [the 400,000 reapers , binders]887-the 400,000 reapers , binders , etc . , is done by [4,000 boys]888-4,000 boys ; that of [the 1,000,000 corn - shellers]889-the 1,000,000 corn - shellers is done by [7,500 men]890-7,500 men ; that of [the 40,000 weavers]891-the 40,000 weavers is done by [1,200 men]892-1,200 men ; and that of [the 1,000 stitchers of shoe soles]893-the 1,000 stitchers of shoe soles is done by [6 men]894-6 men . To bunch the figures , [17,900 persons]895-17,900 persons to - day do the above - work , whereas fifty years ago it would have taken thirteen millions of [persons]896-persons to do it . Now then , how many of [that ignorant race]897-that ignorant race — [[our]898-our fathers]899-our fathers and [grandfathers]900-grandfathers — with [their]897-that ignorant race ignorant methods , would it take to do [our]898-our work to - day ? It would take forty thousand millions — a hundred times [the swarming population of [China]26-china]901-the swarming population of china — twenty times the present population of [the globe]449-the globe . [You]903-you look around [you]903-you and [you]903-you see [a nation of sixty millions]904-a nation of sixty millions — apparently ; but secreted in [their]904-a nation of sixty millions hands and brains , and invisible to [your]903-you eyes , is [the true population of [this Republic]906-this republic]905-the true population of this republic , and it numbers [forty billions]907-forty billions ! It is the stupendous creation of [those humble unlettered , un - college - bred inventors]908-those humble unlettered , un - college - bred inventors — all honor to [their]908-those humble unlettered , un - college - bred inventors name . “ How grand that is ! ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy , as [he]179-tracy wended homeward . “ What [a civilization it]2278-a civilization it is , and what prodigious results these are ! and brought about almost wholly by [common men]2279-common men ; not by [Oxford - trained aristocrats]2280-oxford - trained aristocrats , but [men who stand shoulder to shoulder in the humble ranks of life]2281-men who stand shoulder to shoulder in the humble ranks of life and earn the bread that [they]2281-men who stand shoulder to shoulder in the humble ranks of life eat . Again , [I]179-tracy ’m glad [I]179-tracy came . [I]179-tracy have found [a country at last where [one]372-one may start fair , and breast to breast]2282-a country at last where one may start fair , and breast to breast with [[his]372-one fellow man]2284-his fellow man , rise by [his]372-one own efforts , and be something in [the world]409-the world and be proud of that something ; not be something created by [an ancestor three hundred years ago]2286-an ancestor three hundred years ago . ”[179-tracy] CHAPTER XI . During the first few days [he]179-tracy kept the fact diligently before [his]179-tracy mind that [he]179-tracy was in [a land where there was “ work and bread for all]2287-a land where there was “ work and bread for all . ”[179-tracy] In fact , for convenience ’ sake [he]179-tracy fitted it to a little tune and hummed it to [himself]179-tracy ; but as time wore on the fact itself began to take on a doubtful look , and next the tune got fatigued and presently ran down and stopped . [His]179-tracy first effort was to get an upper clerkship in one of [the departments]909-the departments , where [his]179-tracy Oxford education could come into play and do [him]179-tracy service . But [he]179-tracy stood no chance whatever . There , competency was no recommendation ; political backing , without competency , was worth six of it . [He]179-tracy was glaringly English , and that was necessarily against [him]179-tracy in [the political centre of [a nation where both parties]911-a nation where both parties]910-the political centre of a nation where both parties prayed for the Irish cause on the house - top and blasphemed it in [the cellar]912-the cellar . By [his]179-tracy dress [he]179-tracy was [a cowboy]666-a cowboy ; that won [him]179-tracy respect — when [his]179-tracy back was not turned — but it could n’t get a clerkship for [him]179-tracy . But [he]179-tracy had said , in a rash moment , that [he]179-tracy would wear those clothes till [the owner]2129-the owner or [[the owner]2129-the owner ’s friends]916-the owner ’s friends caught sight of [them]917-them and asked for that money , and [his]179-tracy conscience would not let [him]179-tracy retire from that engagement now . At the end of a week things were beginning to wear rather a startling look . [He]179-tracy had hunted everywhere for work , descending gradually the scale of quality , until apparently [he]179-tracy had sued for all the various kinds of work [a man without a special calling]918-a man without a special calling might hope to be able to do , except ditching and the other coarse manual sorts — and had got neither work nor the promise of it . [He]179-tracy was mechanically turning over the leaves of [his]179-tracy diary , meanwhile , and now [his]179-tracy eye fell upon the first record made after [he]179-tracy was burnt out : “ [I]179-tracy [myself]179-tracy did not doubt [my]179-tracy stamina before , [nobody]483-nobody could doubt it now , if [they]2289-they could see how [I]179-tracy am housed , and realise that [I]179-tracy feel absolutely no disgust with [these quarters]2290-these quarters , but am as serenely content with them as any dog would be in [a similar kennel]2291-a similar kennel . Terms , twenty - five dollars a week . [I]179-tracy said [I]179-tracy would start at the bottom . [I]179-tracy have kept [my]179-tracy word . ”[179-tracy] A shudder went quaking through [him]179-tracy , and [he]179-tracy exclaimed : “ What have [I]186-mrs. marsh been thinking of ! _ This _ the bottom ! Mooning along a whole week , and these terrific expenses climbing and climbing all the time ! [I]186-mrs. marsh must end this folly straightway . ”[186-mrs. marsh] [He]179-tracy settled up at once and went forth to find [less sumptuous lodgings]919-less sumptuous lodgings . [He]179-tracy had to wander far and seek with diligence , but [he]179-tracy succeeded . [They]920-they made [him]179-tracy pay in advance — four dollars and a half ; this secured both bed and food for a week . [The good - natured , hardworked landlady]921-the good - natured , hardworked landlady took [him]179-tracy up [three flights of narrow , uncarpeted stairs]922-three flights of narrow , uncarpeted stairs and delivered [him]179-tracy into [[his]179-tracy room]2100-his room . There were [two double - bedsteads in [it]2100-his room]924-two double - bedsteads in it , and [one single one]925-one single one . [He]179-tracy would be allowed to sleep alone in one of [the double beds]926-the double beds until [some new boarder]927-some new boarder should come , but [he]179-tracy would n’t be charged extra . So [he]179-tracy would presently be required to sleep with [some stranger]928-some stranger ! The thought of it made [him]179-tracy sick . [Mrs. Marsh]186-mrs. marsh , [the landlady]929-the landlady , was very friendly and hoped [he]179-tracy would like [[her]186-mrs. marsh house]930-her house — [they]931-they all liked [it]930-her house , [she]186-mrs. marsh said . “ And [they]931-they ’re [a very nice set of boys]2292-a very nice set of boys . [They]931-they carry on a good deal , but that ’s [their]931-they fun . [You]2293-you see , [this room]2294-this room opens right into [this back one]2295-this back one , and sometimes [they]931-they ’re all in one and sometimes in the other ; and hot nights [they]931-they all sleep on the roof when it do n’t rain . [They]931-they get out [there]1907-there the minute it ’s hot enough . The season ’s so early that [they]931-they ’ve already had a night or two up there . If [you]2293-you ’d like to go up and pick out [a place]2297-a place , [you]2293-you can . [You]2293-you ’ll find chalk in the side of the chimney where there ’s a brick wanting . [You]2293-you just take the chalk and — but of course [you]2293-you ’ve done it before . ”[186-mrs. marsh] “ Oh , no , [I]186-mrs. marsh have n’t . ”[186-mrs. marsh] “ Why , of course [you]2293-you haven’t — what am [I]186-mrs. marsh thinking of ? [Plenty of room on [the Plains]63-the plains]2298-plenty of room on the plains without chalking , [I]186-mrs. marsh ’ll be bound . Well , [you]2293-you just chalk out [a place the size of a blanket anywhere on the tin that ai n’t already marked off , [you]2293-you know]2299-a place the size of a blanket anywhere on the tin that ai n’t already marked off , you know , and that ’s [[your]2293-you property]2300-your property . [You]2293-you and [[your]2293-you bed - mate]2301-your bed - mate take turnabout carrying up the blanket and pillows and fetching them down again ; or one carries [them]2302-them up and the other fetches [them]2302-them down , [you]2293-you fix it the way [you]2293-you like , [you]2293-you know . [You]2293-you ’ll like [the boys]2121-the boys , [they]2121-the boys ’re everlasting sociable — except the printer .
