Over there , [twenty thousand people in a million]2400-twenty thousand people in a million elect [themselves]2400-twenty thousand people in a million [gentlemen]2383-gentlemen and [ladies]2368-ladies , and [the nine hundred and eighty thousand]2403-the nine hundred and eighty thousand _ accept _ that decree and swallow the affront which it puts upon [them]2403-the nine hundred and eighty thousand . Why , if [they]2403-the nine hundred and eighty thousand did n’t accept it , it would n’t _ be _ an election , it would be a dead letter and have no force at all . Over [here]2214-here [the twenty thousand would - be exclusives]2405-the twenty thousand would - be exclusives come up to the polls and vote [themselves]2405-the twenty thousand would - be exclusives to be [ladies]2368-ladies and [gentlemen]2383-gentlemen . But the thing does n’t stop there . [The nine hundred and eighty thousand]2403-the nine hundred and eighty thousand come and vote [themselves]2403-the nine hundred and eighty thousand to be [ladies]2368-ladies and [gentlemen]2383-gentlemen _ too _ , and that elects [the whole nation]2411-the whole nation . Since [the whole million]2412-the whole million vote [themselves]2412-the whole million [ladies]2368-ladies and [gentlemen]2383-gentlemen , there is no question about that election . It _ does _ make absolute equality , and there is no fiction about it ; while over yonder the _ inequality _ , ( by decree of the infinitely feeble , and consent of [the infinitely strong]2415-the infinitely strong , ) is also absolute — as real and absolute as [our]2416-our equality . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy had shrunk promptly into [his]179-tracy English shell when this speech began , notwithstanding [he]179-tracy had now been in severe training several weeks for contact and intercourse with [the common herd on the common herd]962-the common herd on the common herd ’s terms ; but [he]179-tracy lost no time in pulling [himself]179-tracy out again , and so by the time the speech was finished [his]179-tracy valves were open once more , and [he]179-tracy was forcing [himself]179-tracy to accept without resentment [the common herd]963-the common herd ’s frank fashion of dropping sociably into [other people]480-other people ’s conversations unembarrassed and uninvited . The process was not very difficult this time , for [the man]511-the man ’s smile and voice and manner were persuasive and winning . [Tracy]179-tracy would even have liked [him]179-tracy on the spot , but for the fact — fact which [he]179-tracy was not really aware of — that the equality of [men]669-men was not yet a reality to [him]179-tracy , it was only a theory ; the _ mind _ perceived , but [the _ man]967-the _ man _ failed to feel it . It was [Hattie]187-hattie ’s ghost over again , merely turned around . [Theoretically Barrow]191-barrow was [his]179-tracy equal , but it was distinctly distasteful to see [him]179-tracy exhibit it . [He]179-tracy presently said : “ [I]179-tracy hope in all sincerity that what [you]2417-you have said is true , as regards [the Americans]189-the americans , for doubts have crept into [my]179-tracy mind several times . It seemed that the equality must be ungenuine where the sign - names of [castes]2418-castes were still in vogue ; but those sign - names have certainly lost [their]2418-castes offence and are wholly neutralized , nullified and harmless if they are the undisputed property of [every individual in [the nation]836-the nation]2419-every individual in the nation . [I]179-tracy think [I]179-tracy realize that caste does not exist and can not exist except by common consent of [the masses]2421-the masses outside of [its]2418-castes limits . [I]179-tracy thought caste created itself and perpetuated itself ; but it seems quite true that it only creates itself , and is perpetuated by [the people whom it despises , and who can dissolve it at any time]2422-the people whom it despises , and who can dissolve it at any time by assuming its mere sign - names [themselves]2422-the people whom it despises , and who can dissolve it at any time . ”[179-tracy] “ It ’s what [I]179-tracy think . There is n’t any power on [earth]434-earth that can prevent [England]11-england ’s thirty millions from electing [themselves]2422-the people whom it despises , and who can dissolve it at any time [dukes and duchesses]2424-dukes and duchesses to - morrow and calling [themselves]2422-the people whom it despises , and who can dissolve it at any time so . And within six months [all the former dukes and duchesses]2425-all the former dukes and duchesses would have retired from the business . [I]179-tracy wish [they]2425-all the former dukes and duchesses ’d try that . [Royalty]803-royalty [itself]803-royalty could n’t survive such a process . A handful of [frowners against thirty million laughers]2427-frowners against thirty million laughers in a state of irruption . Why , it ’s Herculaneum against [Vesuvius]64-vesuvius ; it would take another eighteen centuries to find that Herculaneum after the cataclysm . What ’s [a Colonel]2428-a colonel in [[our]2429-our South]2430-our south ? [He]2428-a colonel ’s [a nobody]2431-a nobody ; because [they]2428-a colonel ’re [all colonels down there]2432-all colonels down there . No , [Tracy]179-tracy ”[179-tracy] ( shudder from [Tracy]179-tracy ) “ [nobody in [England]11-england]2433-nobody in england would call [you]2434-you [a gentleman]2336-a gentleman and [you]2434-you would n’t call [yourself]2434-you [one]372-one ; and [I]191-barrow tell [you]2434-you it ’s a state of things that makes [a man]1806-a man put [himself]1806-a man into most unbecoming attitudes sometimes — the broad and general recognition and acceptance of caste _ as _ caste does , [I]191-barrow mean . Makes [him]1806-a man do it unconsciously — being bred in [him]1806-a man , [you]2434-you see , and never thought over and reasoned out . [You]2434-you could n’t conceive of the Matterhorn being flattered by the notice of one of [[your]2434-you comely little English hills]2438-your comely little english hills , could [you]2434-you ? ”[191-barrow] “ Why , no . ”[179-tracy] “ Well , then , let [a man in [his]2439-a man in his right mind right mind]2439-a man in his right mind try to conceive of [Darwin]192-darwin feeling flattered by the notice of [a princess]2440-a princess . It ’s so grotesque that it — well , it paralyzes the imagination . Yet that [Memnon _]193-memnon _ was _ flattered by the notice of that statuette ; [he]193-memnon _ _ says _ so — says so [himself]193-memnon _ . The system that can make [a god]2441-a god disown [his]2441-a god godship and profane it — oh , well , it ’s all wrong , it ’s all wrong and ought to be abolished , [I]191-barrow should say . ”[191-barrow] The mention of [Darwin]192-darwin brought on a literary discussion , and this topic roused such enthusiasm in [Barrow]191-barrow that [he]191-barrow took off [his]191-barrow coat and made [himself]191-barrow the more free and comfortable for it , and detained [him]191-barrow so long that [he]191-barrow was still at it when [the noisy proprietors of [the room]341-the room]968-the noisy proprietors of the room came shouting and skylarking in and began to romp , scuffle , wash , and otherwise entertain [themselves]968-the noisy proprietors of the room . [He]191-barrow lingered yet a little longer to offer the hospitalities of [[his]191-barrow room]2100-his room and [his]191-barrow book shelf to [Tracy]179-tracy and ask [him]179-tracy a personal question or two : “ What is [your]179-tracy trade ? ”[191-barrow] “ [They]2442-they — well , [they]2442-they call [me]191-barrow [a cowboy]666-a cowboy , but that is a fancy . [I]191-barrow ’m not that . [I]191-barrow have n’t any trade . ”[191-barrow] “ What do [you]179-tracy work at for [your]179-tracy living ? ”[191-barrow] “ Oh , anything — [I]191-barrow mean [I]191-barrow _ would _ work at , anything [I]191-barrow could get to do , but thus far [I]191-barrow have n’t been able to find an occupation . ”[191-barrow] “ Maybe [I]191-barrow can help [you]179-tracy ; [I]191-barrow ’d like to try . ”[191-barrow] “ [I]191-barrow shall be very glad . [I]191-barrow ’ve tried , [myself]191-barrow , to weariness . ”[191-barrow] “ Well , of course where [a man]1806-a man has n’t a regular trade [he]1806-a man ’s pretty bad off in [this world]386-this world . What [you]179-tracy needed , [I]990-the young girl puss reckon , was less book learning and more bread - and - butter learning . [I]990-the young girl puss do n’t know what [[your]179-tracy father]2446-your father could have been thinking of . [You]179-tracy ought to have had a trade , [you]179-tracy ought to have had a trade , by _ all _ means . But never mind about that ; [we]2447-we ’ll stir up _ something _ to do , [I]990-the young girl puss guess . And do n’t [you]179-tracy get homesick ; that ’s a bad business . [We]2447-we ’ll talk the thing over and look around a little . [You]179-tracy ’ll come out all right . Wait for [me]990-the young girl puss — [I’ll]990-the young girl puss go down to supper with [you]179-tracy . ”[990-the young girl puss] By this time [Tracy]179-tracy had achieved a very friendly feeling for [Barrow]191-barrow and would have _ called _ [him]191-barrow [a friend]971-a friend , maybe , if not taken too suddenly on a straight - out requirement to realize on [his]191-barrow theories . [He]191-barrow was glad of [his]191-barrow society , anyway , and was feeling lighter hearted than before . Also [he]191-barrow was pretty curious to know what vocation it might be which had furnished [Barrow]191-barrow such a large acquaintanceship with books and allowed [him]191-barrow so much time to read . CHAPTER XII . Presently the supper bell began to ring in [the depths of [the house]365-the house]972-the depths of the house , and the sound proceeded steadily upward , growing in intensity all the way up towards [the upper floors]974-the upper floors . The higher it came the more maddening was the noise , until at last what it lacked of being absolutely deafening , was made up of the sudden crash and clatter of an avalanche of [boarders]975-boarders down [the uncarpeted stairway]976-the uncarpeted stairway . [The peerage]977-the peerage did not go to meals in this fashion ; [Tracy]179-tracy ’s training had not fitted [him]191-barrow to enjoy this hilarious zoological clamor and enthusiasm . [He]191-barrow had to confess that there was something about this extraordinary outpouring of animal spirits which [he]191-barrow would have to get inured to before [he]191-barrow could accept it . No doubt in time [he]191-barrow would prefer it ; but [he]191-barrow wished the process might be modified and made just a little more gradual , and not quite so pronounced and violent . [Barrow]191-barrow and [Tracy]179-tracy followed the avalanche down through an ever increasing and ever more and more aggressive stench of bygone cabbage and kindred smells ; smells which are to be found nowhere but in [a cheap private boarding house]978-a cheap private boarding house ; smells which once encountered can never be forgotten ; smells which encountered generations later are instantly recognizable , but never recognizable with pleasure . To [Tracy]179-tracy these odors were suffocating , horrible , almost unendurable ; but [he]179-tracy held [his]179-tracy peace and said nothing . Arrived in [the basement]979-the basement , [they]980-they entered [a large dining - room]981-a large dining - room where [thirty - five or forty people]982-thirty - five or forty people sat at a long table . [They]980-they took [their]980-they places . The feast had already begun and the conversation was going on in the liveliest way from one end of the table to the other . The table cloth was of very coarse material and was liberally spotted with coffee stains and grease . The knives and forks were iron , with bone handles , the spoons appeared to be iron or sheet iron or something of the sort . The tea and coffee cups were of the commonest and heaviest and most durable stone ware . All the furniture of the table was of the commonest and cheapest sort . There was a single large thick slice of bread by [each boarder]983-each boarder ’s plate , and it was observable that [he]191-barrow economized it as if [he]191-barrow were not expecting it to be duplicated . Dishes of butter were distributed along the table within reach of [people]1954-people ’s arms , if [they]1954-people had long ones , but there were no private butter plates . The butter was perhaps good enough , and was quiet and well behaved ; but it had more bouquet than was necessary , though [nobody]483-nobody commented upon that fact or seemed in any way disturbed by it . The main feature of the feast was a piping hot Irish stew made of the potatoes and meat left over from a procession of previous meals . [Everybody]404-everybody was liberally supplied with this dish . On the table were a couple of great dishes of sliced ham , and there were some other eatables of minor importance — preserves and New Orleans molasses and such things . There was also plenty of tea and coffee of an infernal sort , with brown sugar and condensed milk , but the milk and sugar supply was not left at the discretion of [the boarders]2352-the boarders , but was rationed out at headquarters — one spoonful of sugar and one of condensed milk to each cup and no more . The table was waited upon by [two stalwart negro women who raced back and forth from [the bases of supplies with splendid dash and clatter and energy]989-the bases of supplies with splendid dash and clatter and energy]988-two stalwart negro women who raced back and forth from the bases of supplies with splendid dash and clatter and energy . [Their]988-two stalwart negro women who raced back and forth from the bases of supplies with splendid dash and clatter and energy labors were supplemented after a fashion by [the young girl Puss]990-the young girl puss . [She]990-the young girl puss carried coffee and tea back and forth among [the boarders]2352-the boarders , but [she]990-the young girl puss made pleasure excursions rather than business ones in this way , to speak strictly . [She]990-the young girl puss made jokes with [various people]992-various people . [She]990-the young girl puss chaffed [the young men]993-the young men pleasantly and wittily , as [she]990-the young girl puss supposed , and as [the rest]994-the rest also supposed , apparently , judging by the applause and laughter which [she]990-the young girl puss got by [her]990-the young girl puss efforts . Manifestly [she]990-the young girl puss was a favorite with [most of [the young fellows]996-the young fellows]995-most of the young fellows and [sweetheart of the rest of [them]996-the young fellows]997-sweetheart of the rest of them . Where [she]990-the young girl puss conferred notice [she]990-the young girl puss conferred happiness , as was seen by the face of [the recipient]998-the recipient ; and at the same time [she]990-the young girl puss conferred unhappiness — one could see it fall and dim the faces of [the other young fellows]999-the other young fellows like a shadow . [She]990-the young girl puss never “ Mistered ”[990-the young girl puss] [these friends of hers]1000-these friends of hers , but called [them]1000-these friends of hers “ [Billy]167-buffalo bill , ”[990-the young girl puss] “ [Tom]194-tom , ”[1000-these friends of hers] “ [John]152-john calvin , ”[990-the young girl puss] and [they]1000-these friends of hers called [her]990-the young girl puss “ Puss ”[1000-these friends of hers] or “ [Hattie]187-hattie . ”[186-mrs. marsh] [Mr. Marsh]195-mr. marsh sat at the head of the table , [[his]195-mr. marsh wife]381-his wife sat at the foot . [Marsh]195-mr. marsh was [a man of sixty]1002-a man of sixty , and was [an American]1003-an american ; but if [he]195-mr. marsh had been born a month earlier [he]195-mr. marsh would have been [a Spaniard]1004-a spaniard . [He]195-mr. marsh was plenty good enough [Spaniard]196-spaniard as it was ; [his]195-mr. marsh face was very dark , [his]195-mr. marsh hair very black , and [his]195-mr. marsh eyes were not only exceedingly black but were very intense , and there was something about them that indicated that they could burn with passion upon occasion . [He]195-mr. marsh was stoop - shouldered and lean - faced , and the general aspect of [him]195-mr. marsh was disagreeable ; [he]195-mr. marsh was evidently not a very companionable person . If looks went for anything , [he]195-mr. marsh was the very opposite of [[his]195-mr. marsh wife]381-his wife , who was all motherliness and charity , good will and good nature . [All the young men]1006-all the young men and [the women]1007-the women called [her]381-his wife [Aunt Rachael]197-aunt rachael , which was another sign . [Tracy]179-tracy ’s wandering and interested eye presently fell upon [one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew . [He]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew was very pale and looked as if [he]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew had but lately come out of a sick bed , and also as if [he]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew ought to get back into it again as soon as possible . [His]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew face was very melancholy . The waves of laughter and conversation broke upon it without affecting it any more than if it had been a rock in [the sea]349-the sea and the words and the laughter veritable waters . [He]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew held [his]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew head down and looked ashamed . [Some of [the women]1007-the women]1010-some of the women cast glances of pity toward [him]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew from time to time in a furtive and half afraid way , and [some of [the youngest of [the men]1014-the men]1013-the youngest of the men]1012-some of the youngest of the men plainly had compassion on [the young fellow]1015-the young fellow — a compassion exhibited in [their]1012-some of the youngest of the men faces but not in any more active or compromising way . But [the great majority of [the people present]1017-the people present]1016-the great majority of the people present showed entire indifference to [the youth]1018-the youth and [his]1008-one boarder who had been overlooked in the distribution of the stew sorrows . [Marsh]195-mr. marsh sat with [his]195-mr. marsh head down , but [one]372-one could catch the malicious gleam of [his]195-mr. marsh eyes through [his]195-mr. marsh shaggy brows . [He]195-mr. marsh was watching [that young fellow]1020-that young fellow with evident relish . [He]195-mr. marsh had not neglected [him]1020-that young fellow through carelessness , and apparently the table understood that fact . The spectacle was making [Mrs. Marsh]186-mrs. marsh very uncomfortable . [She]186-mrs. marsh had the look of [one who hopes against hope that the impossible may happen]1021-one who hopes against hope that the impossible may happen . But as the impossible did not happen , [she]186-mrs. marsh finally ventured to speak up and remind [[her]186-mrs. marsh husband]1022-her husband that [Nat Brady]198-brady had n’t been helped to the Irish stew . [Marsh]186-mrs. marsh lifted [his]195-mr. marsh head and gasped out with mock courtliness , “ Oh , [he]198-brady has n’t , has n’t [he]198-brady ? What a pity that is . [I]191-barrow do n’t know how [I]191-barrow came to overlook [him]198-brady . Ah , [he]198-brady must pardon [me]191-barrow . [You]1022-her husband must indeed Mr — er — [Baxter — Barker]199-baxter — barker , [you]1022-her husband must pardon [me]191-barrow . [I]191-barrow — er — [my]191-barrow attention was directed to some other matter , [I]191-barrow do n’t know what . The thing that grieves [me]191-barrow mainly is , that it happens every meal now . But [you]1022-her husband must try to overlook these little things , [Mr. Bunker]200-mr. bunker , these little neglects on [my]191-barrow part . [They]2448-they ’re always likely to happen with [me]191-barrow in any case , and they are especially likely to happen where [a person]2449-a person has — er — well , where [a person]2449-a person is , say , about three weeks in arrears for [his]2449-a person board . [You]1022-her husband get [my]191-barrow meaning?—you get [my]191-barrow idea ? Here is [your]1022-her husband Irish stew , and — er — it gives [me]191-barrow the greatest pleasure to send it to [you]1022-her husband , and [I]191-barrow hope that [you]1022-her husband will enjoy the charity as much as [I]191-barrow enjoy conferring it . ”[191-barrow] A blush rose in [Brady]198-brady ’s white cheeks and flowed slowly backward to [his]198-brady ears and upward toward [his]198-brady forehead , but [he]198-brady said nothing and began to eat [his]198-brady food under the embarrassment of a general silence and the sense that all eyes were fastened upon [him]198-brady . [Barrow]191-barrow whispered to [Tracy]179-tracy : “ [The old man]2451-the old man ’s been waiting for that . [He]2451-the old man would n’t have missed that chance for anything . ”[179-tracy] “ It ’s a brutal business , ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy . Then [he]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , purposing to set the thought down in [his]179-tracy diary later : “ Well , here in [this very house]2452-this very house is [a republic where [all are free and equal]2454-all are free and equal]2453-a republic where all are free and equal , if [men]669-men are free and equal anywhere in [the earth]1900-the earth , therefore [I]191-barrow have arrived at [the place [I]191-barrow started to find]2457-the place i started to find , and [I]191-barrow am [a man]1806-a man among [men]669-men , and on the strictest equality possible to [men]669-men , no doubt . Yet here on the threshold [I]191-barrow find an inequality . There are [people at this table who are looked up to for some reason or another]2461-people at this table who are looked up to for some reason or another , and here is [a poor devil of [a boy who is looked down upon , treated with indifference , and shamed by humiliations]2463-a boy who is looked down upon , treated with indifference , and shamed by humiliations , when [he]191-barrow has committed no crime but that common one of being poor]2462-a poor devil of a boy who is looked down upon , treated with indifference , and shamed by humiliations , when he has committed no crime but that common one of being poor . Equality ought to make [men]669-men noble - minded . In fact [I]191-barrow had supposed it did do that . ”[191-barrow] After supper , [Barrow]191-barrow proposed a walk , and [they]1023-they started . [Barrow]191-barrow had a purpose . [He]191-barrow wanted [Tracy]179-tracy to get rid of that cowboy hat . [He]191-barrow did n’t see [his]191-barrow way to finding mechanical or manual employment for [a person rigged in that fashion]1024-a person rigged in that fashion . [Barrow]191-barrow presently said : “ As [I]191-barrow understand it , [you]179-tracy ’re not [a cowboy]666-a cowboy . ”[191-barrow] “ No , [I]191-barrow ’m not . ”[191-barrow] “ Well , now if [you]191-barrow will not think [me]179-tracy too curious , how did [you]191-barrow come to mount that hat ? Where is [he]355-a stranger ? ”[191-barrow] “ [I]191-barrow do n’t know . [I]191-barrow supposed the best way to find [him]355-a stranger would be to continue to wear [his]355-a stranger clothes , which are conspicuous enough to attract [his]355-a stranger attention if [I]191-barrow should meet [him]355-a stranger on [the street]741-the street . ”[191-barrow] “ Oh , very well , ”[191-barrow] said [Barrow]191-barrow , “ the rest of the outfit , is well enough , and while it ’s not too conspicuous , it is n’t quite like the clothes that [anybody else]573-anybody else wears . Suppress the hat . When [you]2469-you meet [[your]2469-you man]2470-your man [he]2470-your man ’ll recognize the rest of [his]2470-your man suit . [I]1032-both do n’t believe [an angel]2472-an angel could get employment in [Washington]114-hawkins in a halo like that . ”[1032-both] p124.jpg ( 22 K ) [Tracy]179-tracy agreed to replace the hat with something of a modester form , and [they]1025-they stepped aboard [a crowded car]1026-a crowded car and stood with [others]425-others on [the rear platform]1028-the rear platform . Presently , as [the car]1029-the car moved swiftly along the rails , [two men crossing [the street]741-the street]1030-two men crossing the street caught sight of the backs of [Barrow]191-barrow and [Tracy]179-tracy , and [both]1032-both exclaimed at once , “ There [he]1035-the next one is ! ”[374-the colonel] It was [Sellers]95-mulberry and [Hawkins]160-hawkins . [Both]1032-both were so paralyzed with joy that before [they]1032-both could pull [themselves]1032-both together and make an effort to stop [the car]1029-the car , it was gone too far , and [they]1032-both decided to wait for [the next one]1035-the next one . [They]1032-both waited a while ; then it occurred to [Washington]114-hawkins that there could be no use in chasing [one horse - car]1036-one horse - car with another , and [he]114-hawkins wanted to hunt up a hack . But [the Colonel]374-the colonel said : “ When [you]191-barrow come to think of it , there ’s no occasion for that at all . Now that [I]191-barrow ’ve got [him]1035-the next one materialized , [I]191-barrow can command [his]1035-the next one motions . [I]191-barrow ’ll have [him]1035-the next one at [the house]365-the house by the time [we]1032-both get [there]1907-there . ”[191-barrow] Then [they]1032-both hurried off [home]1782-home in a state of great and joyful excitement . The hat exchange accomplished , [the two new friends]1039-the two new friends started to walk back leisurely to [the boarding house]1040-the boarding house . [Barrow]191-barrow ’s mind was full of curiosity about [this young fellow]1041-this young fellow . [He]191-barrow said , “ [You]1041-this young fellow ’ve never been to [the Rocky Mountains]65-the rocky mountains ? ”[191-barrow] “ No . ”[374-the colonel] “ [You]1041-this young fellow ’ve never been out on [the plains]2475-the plains ? ”[191-barrow] “ No . ”[191-barrow] “ How long have [you]1041-this young fellow been in [this country]1944-this country ? ”[374-the colonel] “ Only a few days . ”[374-the colonel] “ [You]1041-this young fellow ’ve never been in [America]9-america before ? ”[191-barrow] “ No . ”[191-barrow] Then [Barrow]191-barrow communed with [himself]191-barrow . “ Now what odd shapes the notions of [romantic people]2477-romantic people take . Here ’s [a young fellow who ’s read in [England]11-england about cowboys and adventures on [the plains]2475-the plains]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains . [He]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains comes [here]2214-here and buys [a cowboy]666-a cowboy ’s suit . Thinks [he]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains can play [himself]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains on [folks]2482-folks for [a cowboy]666-a cowboy , all inexperienced as [he]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains is . It is that exchange that [he]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains has put up as an explanation . It ’s rather thin , too thin altogether . Well , [he]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains ’s young , never been anywhere , knows nothing about [the world]409-the world , sentimental , no doubt . Perhaps it was the natural thing for [him]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains to do , but it was a most singular choice , curious freak , altogether . ”[179-tracy] [Both men]2044-both men were busy with [their]2044-both men thoughts for a time , then [Tracy]179-tracy heaved a sigh and said , “ [Mr. Barrow]191-barrow , the case of [that young fellow]1020-that young fellow troubles [me]374-the colonel . ”[374-the colonel] “ [You]191-barrow mean [Nat Brady]198-brady ? ”[191-barrow] “ Yes , [Brady]198-brady , or [Baxter]199-baxter — barker , or whatever it was . [The old landlord]2486-the old landlord called [him]2478-a young fellow who ’s read in england about cowboys and adventures on the plains by several different names . ”[179-tracy] “ Oh , yes , [he]2486-the old landlord has been very liberal with names for [Brady]198-brady , since [Brady]198-brady fell into arrears for [his]2486-the old landlord board . Well , that ’s one of [his]2486-the old landlord sarcasms — [the old man]2451-the old man thinks [he]2486-the old landlord ’s great on sarcasm . ”[374-the colonel] “ Well , what is [Brady]198-brady ’s difficulty ? What is [Brady]198-brady — who is [he]198-brady ? ”[191-barrow] “ [Brady]198-brady is [a tinner]2488-a tinner . [He]198-brady ’s [a young journeyman tinner who was getting along all right till [he]198-brady fell sick and lost [his]198-brady job]2489-a young journeyman tinner who was getting along all right till he fell sick and lost his job . [He]198-brady was very popular before [he]198-brady lost [his]198-brady job ; [everybody in [the house]365-the house]2490-everybody in the house liked [Brady]198-brady . [The old man]2451-the old man was rather especially fond of [him]198-brady , but [you]2493-you know that when [a man]1806-a man loses [his]1806-a man job and loses [his]1806-a man ability to support [himself]1806-a man and to pay [his]1806-a man way as [he]1806-a man goes , it makes a great difference in the way [people]1954-people look at [him]1806-a man and feel about [him]1806-a man . ”[191-barrow] “ Is that so ! _ Is _ it so ? ”[179-tracy] [Barrow]191-barrow looked at [Tracy]179-tracy in a puzzled way . “ Why of course it ’s so . Would n’t [you]191-barrow know that , naturally . Do n’t [you]191-barrow know that the wounded deer is always attacked and killed by its companions and [friends]325-friends ? ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , while a chilly and boding discomfort spread itself through [his]179-tracy system , “ In a republic of deer and [men where all are free and equal]2497-men where all are free and equal , misfortune is a crime , and [the prosperous]2498-the prosperous gore [the unfortunate]2499-the unfortunate to death . ”[179-tracy] Then [he]179-tracy said aloud , “ Here in [the boarding house]1040-the boarding house , if [one]372-one would have [friends]325-friends and be popular instead of having the cold shoulder turned upon [him]372-one , [he]372-one must be prosperous . ”[191-barrow] “ Yes , ”[191-barrow] [Barrow]191-barrow said , “ that is so . It ’s [their]2503-they human nature . [They]2503-they do turn against [Brady]198-brady , now that [he]198-brady ’s unfortunate , and [they]2503-they do n’t like [him]198-brady as well as [they]2503-they did before ; but it is n’t because of any lack in [Brady]198-brady — [he]198-brady ’s just as [he]198-brady was before , has the same nature and the same impulses , but [they]2503-they — well , [Brady]198-brady is a thorn in [their]2503-they consciences , [you]2504-you see . [They]2503-they know [they]2503-they ought to help [him]198-brady and [they]2503-they ’re too stingy to do it , and [they]2503-they ’re ashamed of [themselves]2503-they for that , and [they]2503-they ought also to hate [themselves]2503-they on that account , but instead of that [they]2503-they hate [Brady]198-brady because [he]198-brady makes [them]2503-they ashamed of [themselves]2503-they . [I]179-tracy say that ’s human nature ; that occurs everywhere ; [this boarding house]2505-this boarding house is merely [the world]409-the world in little , it ’s the case all over — they’re all alike . In prosperity [we]2507-we are popular ; popularity comes easy in that case , but when the other thing comes [[our]2507-we friends]2508-our friends are pretty likely to turn against [us]2507-we . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy ’s noble theories and high purposes were beginning to feel pretty damp and clammy . [He]179-tracy wondered if by any possibility [he]179-tracy had made a mistake in throwing [his]179-tracy own prosperity to the winds and taking up the cross of [other people]480-other people ’s unprosperity . But [he]179-tracy would n’t listen to that sort of thing ; [he]179-tracy cast it out of [his]179-tracy mind and resolved to go ahead resolutely along the course [he]179-tracy had mapped out for [himself]179-tracy . Extracts from [his]179-tracy diary : Have now spent several days in this singular hive . [I]0-i do n’t know quite what to make out of [these people]1044-these people . [They]1044-these people have merits and virtues , but [they]1044-these people have some other qualities , and some ways that are hard to get along with . [I]0-i ca n’t enjoy [them]1044-these people . The moment [I]0-i appeared in a hat of the period , [I]0-i noticed a change . The respect which had been paid [me]0-i before , passed suddenly away , and [the people]446-the people became friendly — more than that — [they]446-the people became familiar , and [I]0-i ’m not used to familiarity , and ca n’t take to it right off ; [I]0-i find that out . [These people]1044-these people ’s familiarity amounts to impudence , sometimes . [I]0-i suppose it ’s all right ; no doubt [I]0-i can get used to it , but it ’s not a satisfactory process at all . [I]0-i have accomplished [my]0-i dearest wish , [I]0-i am [a man among [men]669-men]1047-a man among men , on an equal footing with [Tom]194-tom , [Dick]201-dick and [Harry]184-professor henry , and yet it is n’t just exactly what [I]0-i thought it was going to be . [I]0-i — [I]0-i miss [home]1782-home . Am obliged to say [I]0-i am homesick . Another thing — and this is a confession — a reluctant one , but [I]0-i will make it : The thing [I]0-i miss most and most severely , is the respect , the deference , with which [I]0-i was treated all [my]0-i life in [England]11-england , and which seems to be somehow necessary to [me]0-i . [I]0-i get along very well without the luxury and the wealth and the sort of society [I]0-i ’ve been accustomed to , but [I]0-i do miss the respect and ca n’t seem to get reconciled to the absence of it . There is respect , there is deference here , but it does n’t fall to [my]0-i share . It is lavished on [two men]1050-two men . [One of [them]1050-two men]2172-one of them is [a portly man of middle age]1052-a portly man of middle age who is [a retired plumber]1053-a retired plumber . [Everybody]404-everybody is pleased to have [that man]650-that man ’s notice . [He]650-that man ’s full of pomp and circumstance and self complacency and bad grammar , and at table [he]650-that man is [Sir Oracle]202-sir oracle and when [he]650-that man opens [his]650-that man mouth not any dog in the kennel barks . [The other person]298-the other person is [a policeman at [the capitol - building]1058-the capitol - building]1057-a policeman at the capitol - building . [He]298-the other person represents [the government]391-the government . The deference paid to [these two men]1060-these two men is not so very far short of that paid to [an earl in [England]11-england]1061-an earl in england , though the method of it differs . Not so much courtliness , but the deference is all there . Yes , and there is obsequiousness , too . It does rather look as if in [a republic where all are free and equal]2453-a republic where all are free and equal , prosperity and position constitute _ rank _ . CHAPTER XIII . The days drifted by , and they grew ever more dreary . For [Barrow]191-barrow ’s efforts to find work for [Tracy]179-tracy were unavailing . Always the first question asked was , “ What Union do [you]179-tracy belong to ? ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy was obliged to reply that [he]179-tracy did n’t belong to [any trade - union]1063-any trade - union . “ Very well , then , it ’s impossible to employ [you]179-tracy . [[My]179-tracy men]2509-my men would n’t stay with [me]179-tracy if [I]179-tracy should employ a ‘ scab , ’ or ‘ rat , ’ ”[179-tracy] or whatever the phrase was . Finally , [Tracy]179-tracy had a happy thought . [He]179-tracy said , “ Why the thing for [me]191-barrow to do , of course , is to _ join _ a trade - union . ”[191-barrow] “ Yes , ”[191-barrow] [Barrow]191-barrow said , “ that is the thing for [you]179-tracy to do — if [you]179-tracy can . ”[179-tracy] “ If [I]191-barrow _ can ? _ Is it difficult ? ”[191-barrow] “ Well , Yes , ”[191-barrow] [Barrow]191-barrow said , “ it ’s sometimes difficult — in fact , very difficult . But [you]179-tracy can try , and of course it will be best to try . ”[179-tracy] Therefore [Tracy]179-tracy tried ; but [he]179-tracy did not succeed . [He]179-tracy was refused admission with a good deal of promptness , and was advised to go back [home]1782-home , where [he]179-tracy belonged , not come here taking [honest men]1065-honest men ’s bread out of [their]1065-honest men mouths . [Tracy]179-tracy began to realize that the situation was desperate , and the thought made [him]179-tracy cold to the marrow . [He]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , “ So there is [an aristocracy of position]2510-an aristocracy of position [here]2214-here , and an aristocracy of prosperity , and apparently there is also [an aristocracy of the ins]2512-an aristocracy of the ins as opposed to the outs , and [I]996-the young fellows am with the outs . So the ranks grow daily , here . Plainly there are all kinds of [castes]2418-castes [here]2214-here and only one that [I]996-the young fellows belong to , [the outcasts]2515-the outcasts . ”[996-the young fellows] But [he]179-tracy could n’t even smile at [his]179-tracy small joke , although [he]179-tracy was obliged to confess that [he]179-tracy had a rather good opinion of it . [He]179-tracy was feeling so defeated and miserable by this time that [he]179-tracy could no longer look with philosophical complacency on the horseplay of [the young fellows]996-the young fellows in [the upper rooms]1067-the upper rooms at night . At first it had been pleasant to see [them]996-the young fellows unbend and have a good time after having so well earned it by the labors of the day , but now it all rasped upon [his]179-tracy feelings and [his]179-tracy dignity . [He]179-tracy lost patience with the spectacle . When [they]996-the young fellows were feeling good , [they]996-the young fellows shouted , [they]996-the young fellows scuffled , [they]996-the young fellows sang songs , [they]996-the young fellows romped about [the place]411-the place like cattle , and [they]996-the young fellows generally wound up with a pillow fight , in which [they]996-the young fellows banged [each other]310-each other over the head , and threw the pillows in all directions , and every now and then [he]179-tracy got a buffet [himself]179-tracy ; and [they]996-the young fellows were always inviting [him]179-tracy to join in . [They]996-the young fellows called [him]179-tracy “ [Johnny Bull]203-johnny bull , ”[179-tracy] and invited [him]179-tracy with excessive familiarity to take a hand . At first [he]179-tracy had endured all this with good nature , but latterly [he]179-tracy had shown by [his]179-tracy manner that it was distinctly distasteful to [him]179-tracy , and very soon [he]179-tracy saw a change in the manner of [these young people]1070-these young people toward [him]179-tracy . [They]996-the young fellows were souring on [him]179-tracy as [they]996-the young fellows would have expressed it in [their]996-the young fellows language . [He]179-tracy had never been what might be called popular . That was hardly the phrase for it ; [he]179-tracy had merely been liked , but now dislike for [him]179-tracy was growing . [His]179-tracy case was not helped by the fact that [he]179-tracy was out of luck , could n’t get work , did n’t belong to [a union]1071-a union , and could n’t gain admission to one . [He]179-tracy got a good many slights of that small ill - defined sort that [you]1072-you ca n’t quite put [your]1072-you finger on , and it was manifest that there was only one thing which protected [him]179-tracy from open insult , and that was [his]179-tracy muscle . [These young people]1070-these young people had seen [him]179-tracy exercising , mornings , after [his]179-tracy cold sponge bath , and [they]1070-these young people had perceived by [his]179-tracy performance and the build of [his]179-tracy body , that [he]179-tracy was athletic , and also versed in boxing . [He]179-tracy felt pretty naked now , recognizing that [he]179-tracy was shorn of all respect except respect for [his]179-tracy fists . One night when [he]179-tracy entered [[his]179-tracy room]2100-his room [he]179-tracy found about a dozen of [the young fellows there]1075-the young fellows there carrying on a very lively conversation punctuated with horse - laughter . The talking ceased instantly , and the frank affront of a dead silence followed . [He]179-tracy said , “ Good evening [gentlemen]2383-gentlemen , ”[204-allen] and sat down . There was no response . [He]179-tracy flushed to the temples but forced [himself]179-tracy to maintain silence . [He]179-tracy sat there in this uncomfortable stillness some time , then got up and went out . The moment [he]179-tracy had disappeared [he]179-tracy heard a prodigious shout of laughter break forth . [He]179-tracy saw that [their]1070-these young people plain purpose had been to insult [him]179-tracy . [He]179-tracy ascended to the flat roof , hoping to be able to cool down [his]179-tracy spirit there and get back [his]179-tracy tranquility . [He]179-tracy found [the young tinner up there]1076-the young tinner up there , alone and brooding , and entered into conversation with [him]1076-the young tinner up there . [They]1077-they were pretty fairly matched , now , in unpopularity and general ill - luck and misery , and [they]1077-they had no trouble in meeting upon this common ground with advantage and something of comfort to both . But [Tracy]179-tracy ’s movements had been watched , and in a few minutes [the tormentors]1078-the tormentors came straggling one after another to the roof , where [they]1078-the tormentors began to stroll up and down in an apparently purposeless way . But presently [they]1078-the tormentors fell to dropping remarks that were evidently aimed at [Tracy]179-tracy , and some of them at [the tinner]1079-the tinner . [The ringleader of this little mob]1080-the ringleader of this little mob was [a short - haired bully]1081-a short - haired bully and [amateur prize - fighter named [Allen]204-allen , who was accustomed to lording it over [the upper floor]1083-the upper floor]1082-amateur prize - fighter named allen , who was accustomed to lording it over the upper floor , and had more than once shown a disposition to make trouble with [Tracy]179-tracy . Now there was an occasional cat - call , and hootings , and whistlings , and finally the diversion of an exchange of connected remarks was introduced : “ How many does it take to make a pair ? ”[204-allen] “ Well , two generally makes a pair , but sometimes there ai n’t stuff enough in them to make a whole pair . ”[204-allen] General laugh . “ What were [you]179-tracy saying about [the English]190-the english a while ago ? ”[204-allen] “ Oh , nothing , [the English]190-the english are all right , only — [I]204-allen — ”[204-allen] “ What was it [you]179-tracy _ said _ about [them]190-the english ? ”[204-allen] “ Oh , [I]204-allen only said [they]190-the english swallow well . ”[204-allen] “ Swallow better than [other people]480-other people ? ”[204-allen] “ Oh , yes , [the English]190-the english swallow a good deal better than [other people]480-other people . ”[204-allen] “ What is it [they]190-the english swallow best ? ”[1084-another general] “ Oh , insults . ”[1084-another general] [Another general]1084-another general laugh . “ Pretty hard to make [’em]2519-’em fight , ai n’t it ? ”[204-allen] “ No , taint hard to make [’em]2519-’em fight . ”[204-allen] “ Ai n’t it , really ? ”[1084-another general] “ No , taint hard . It ’s impossible . ”[1084-another general] Another laugh . “ [This one]1828-this one ’s kind of spiritless , that ’s certain . ”[204-allen] “ _ Could n’t _ be the other way — in [his]1828-this one case . ”[204-allen] “ Why ? ”[1084-another general] “ Do n’t [you]204-allen know the secret of [his]1828-this one birth ? ”[204-allen] “ No ! has _ [he]1828-this one _ got a secret of [his]1828-this one birth ? ”[204-allen] “ [You]204-allen bet [he]1828-this one has . ”[204-allen] “ What is it ? ”[204-allen] “ [[His]1828-this one father]302-his father was [a wax - figger]2522-a wax - figger . ”[204-allen] [Allen]204-allen came strolling by where [the pair]1085-the pair were sitting ; stopped , and said to [the tinner]1079-the tinner ; “ How are [you]204-allen off for [friends]325-friends , these days ? ”[204-allen] “ Well enough off . ”[204-allen] “ Got a good many ? ”[204-allen] “ Well , as many as [I]204-allen need . ”[204-allen] “ [A friend]971-a friend is valuable , sometimes — as [a protector]2525-a protector , [you]204-allen know . What do [you]204-allen reckon would happen if [I]204-allen was to snatch [your]204-allen cap off and slap [you]204-allen in the face with it ? ”[204-allen] “ Please do n’t trouble [me]204-allen , [Mr. Allen]204-allen , [I]204-allen ai n’t doing anything to [you]204-allen . ”[204-allen] “ [You]204-allen answer [me]179-tracy ! What do [you]204-allen reckon would happen ? ”[179-tracy] “ Well , [I]179-tracy do n’t know . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy spoke up with a good deal of deliberation and said : “ Do n’t trouble [the young fellow]1015-the young fellow , [I]179-tracy can tell [you]1015-the young fellow what would happen . ”[179-tracy] “ Oh , [you]1015-the young fellow can , can [you]1015-the young fellow ? [Boys]2119-boys , [Johnny Bull]203-johnny bull can tell [us]2119-boys what would happen if [I]179-tracy was to snatch [this chump]2528-this chump ’s cap off and slap [him]2528-this chump in the face with it . Now [you]2119-boys ’ll see . ”[179-tracy] [He]179-tracy snatched the cap and struck [the youth]1018-the youth in the face , and before [he]179-tracy could inquire what was going to happen , it had already happened , and [he]179-tracy was warming the tin with the broad of [his]179-tracy back . Instantly there was a rush , and shouts of : “ A ring , a ring , make a ring ! Fair play all round ! [Johnny]203-johnny bull ’s grit ; give [him]2528-this chump a chance . ”[179-tracy] The ring was quickly chalked on the tin , and [Tracy]179-tracy found [himself]179-tracy as eager to begin as [he]179-tracy could have been if [[his]179-tracy antagonist]1088-his antagonist had been [a prince]1089-a prince instead of [a mechanic]2331-a mechanic . At bottom [he]179-tracy was a little surprised at this , because although [his]179-tracy theories had been all in that direction for some time , [he]179-tracy was not prepared to find [himself]179-tracy actually eager to measure strength with quite so common [a man]1806-a man as [this ruffian]1092-this ruffian . In a moment all the windows in [the neighborhood]1093-the neighborhood were filled with [people]1954-people , and the roofs also . [The men]1014-the men squared off , and the fight began . But [Allen]204-allen stood no chance whatever , against [the young Englishman]936-the young englishman . Neither in muscle nor in science was [he]204-allen [his]204-allen equal . [He]204-allen measured [his]204-allen length on the tin time and again ; in fact , as fast as [he]204-allen could get up [he]204-allen went down again , and the applause was kept up in liberal fashion from [all the neighborhood around]1097-all the neighborhood around . Finally , [Allen]204-allen had to be helped up . Then [Tracy]179-tracy declined to punish [him]204-allen further and the fight was at an end . [Allen]204-allen was carried off by [some of [[his]204-allen friends]1099-his friends]1098-some of his friends in a very much humbled condition , [his]204-allen face black and blue and bleeding , and [Tracy]179-tracy was at once surrounded by [the young fellows]996-the young fellows , who congratulated [him]179-tracy , and told [him]179-tracy that [he]179-tracy had done [the whole house]1101-the whole house a service , and that from this out [Mr. Allen]204-allen would be a little more particular about how [he]204-allen handled slights and insults and maltreatment around amongst [the boarders]2352-the boarders . p135.jpg ( 28 K ) [Tracy]179-tracy was [a hero]1103-a hero now , and exceedingly popular . Perhaps [nobody]483-nobody had ever been quite so popular on [that upper floor]1105-that upper floor before . But if being discountenanced by [these young fellows]1106-these young fellows had been hard to bear , [their]1106-these young fellows lavish commendations and approval and hero - worship were harder still to endure . [He]179-tracy felt degraded , but [he]179-tracy did not allow [himself]179-tracy to analyze the reasons why , too closely . [He]179-tracy was content to satisfy [himself]179-tracy with the suggestion that [he]179-tracy looked upon [himself]179-tracy as degraded by the public spectacle which [he]179-tracy had made of [himself]179-tracy , fighting on a tin roof , for the delectation of [everybody a block or two around]1107-everybody a block or two around . But [he]179-tracy was n’t entirely satisfied with that explanation of it . Once [he]179-tracy went a little too far and wrote in [his]179-tracy diary that [his]179-tracy case was worse than that of [the prodigal son]1108-the prodigal son . [He]179-tracy said [the prodigal son]1108-the prodigal son merely fed swine , [he]179-tracy did n’t have to chum with [them]1110-them . But [he]179-tracy struck that out , and said “ [All men]1807-all men are equal . [I]187-hattie will not disown [my]187-hattie principles . [These men]2530-these men are as good as [I]187-hattie am . ”[187-hattie] [Tracy]179-tracy was become popular on [the lower floors]1111-the lower floors also . [Everybody]404-everybody was grateful for [Allen]204-allen ’s reduction to the ranks , and for [his]179-tracy transformation from [a doer of outrages]1113-a doer of outrages to [a mere threatener of [them]1110-them]1114-a mere threatener of them . [The young girls , of whom there were half a dozen]1115-the young girls , of whom there were half a dozen , showed many attentions to [Tracy]179-tracy , particularly [that boarding house]1116-that boarding house pet [Hattie]187-hattie , [[the landlady]929-the landlady ’s daughter]1118-the landlady ’s daughter . [She]187-hattie said to [him]179-tracy , very sweetly , “ [I]187-hattie think [you]179-tracy ’re ever so nice . ”[187-hattie] And when [he]179-tracy said , “ [I]187-hattie ’m glad [you]187-hattie think so , [Miss Hattie]187-hattie , ”[187-hattie] [she]187-hattie said , still more sweetly , “ Do n’t call [me]179-tracy [Miss Hattie]187-hattie — call [me]179-tracy [Puss]188-puss . ”[179-tracy] Ah , here was promotion ! [He]179-tracy had struck [the summit]1119-the summit . There were no higher heights to climb in [that boarding house]1116-that boarding house . [His]179-tracy popularity was complete . In the presence of [people]1954-people , [Tracy]179-tracy showed a tranquil outside , but [his]179-tracy heart was being eaten out of [him]179-tracy by distress and despair . In a little while [he]179-tracy should be out of money , and then what should [he]179-tracy do ? [He]179-tracy wished , now , that [he]179-tracy had borrowed a little more liberally from [[that stranger]1122-that stranger ’s store]1123-that stranger ’s store . [He]179-tracy found it impossible to sleep . A single torturing , terrifying thought went racking round and round in [his]179-tracy head , wearing a groove in [his]179-tracy brain : What should [he]179-tracy do — What was to become of [him]179-tracy ? And along with it began to intrude a something presently which was very like a wish that [he]179-tracy had not joined the great and noble ranks of martyrdom , but had stayed at [home]1782-home and been content to be merely [an earl]1125-an earl and nothing better , with nothing more to do in this world of a useful sort than [an earl]1125-an earl finds to do . But [he]179-tracy smothered that part of [his]179-tracy thought as well as [he]179-tracy could ; [he]179-tracy made every effort to drive it away , and with fair success , but [he]179-tracy could n’t keep it from intruding a little now and then , and when it intruded it came suddenly and nipped [him]179-tracy like a bite , a sting , a burn . [He]179-tracy recognized that thought by the peculiar sharpness of its pang . The others were painful enough , but that one cut to the quick when it came . Night after night [he]179-tracy lay tossing to the music of the hideous snoring of [the honest bread - winners]1127-the honest bread - winners until two and three o’clock in the morning , then got up and took refuge on the roof , where [he]179-tracy sometimes got a nap and sometimes failed entirely . [His]179-tracy appetite was leaving [him]179-tracy and the zest of life was going along with it . Finally , one day , being near the imminent verge of total discouragement , [he]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy — and took occasion to blush privately when [he]179-tracy said it , “ If [[my]179-tracy father]671-my father knew what [my]179-tracy American name is,—he — well , [my]179-tracy duty to [[my]179-tracy father]671-my father rather _ requires _ that [I]179-tracy furnish [him]671-my father [my]179-tracy name . [I]179-tracy have no right to make [his]671-my father days and nights unhappy , [I]179-tracy can do enough unhappiness for [the family]1868-the family all by [myself]179-tracy . Really [he]671-my father ought to know what [my]179-tracy American name is . ”[179-tracy] [He]179-tracy thought over it a while and framed a cablegram in [his]179-tracy mind to this effect : “ [My]179-tracy American name is [Howard Tracy]179-tracy . ”[179-tracy] That would n’t be suggesting anything . [[His]179-tracy father]302-his father could understand that as [he]179-tracy chose , and doubtless [he]302-his father would understand it as it was meant , as a dutiful and affectionate desire on the part of [a son]1129-a son to make [[his]1129-a son old father]1130-his old father happy for a moment . Continuing [his]179-tracy train of thought , [Tracy]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , “ Ah , but if [he]671-my father should cable [me]179-tracy to come [home]1782-home ! [I]179-tracy — [I]179-tracy — couldn’t do that — [I]179-tracy _ must n’t _ do that . [I]179-tracy ’ve started out on a mission , and [I]179-tracy must n’t turn [my]179-tracy back on it in cowardice . No , no , [I]179-tracy could n’t go [home]1782-home , at — at — least [I]179-tracy should n’t want to go [home]1782-home . ”[179-tracy] After a reflective pause : “ Well , maybe — perhaps — it would be [my]1131-i _ duty _ to go in the circumstances ; [he]671-my father ’s very old and [he]671-my father does need [me]1131-i by [him]671-my father to stay [his]671-my father footsteps down [the long hill that inclines westward toward the sunset of [his]671-my father life]2537-the long hill that inclines westward toward the sunset of his life . Well , [I]1131-i ’ll think about that . Yes , of course it would n’t be right to stay [here]2214-here . If [I]1131-i — well , perhaps [I]1131-i could just drop [him]671-my father a line and put it off a little while and satisfy [him]671-my father in that way . It would be — well , it would mar everything to have [him]671-my father require [me]1131-i to come instantly . ”[1131-i] Another reflective pause — then : “ And yet if [he]671-my father should do that [I]1131-i do n’t know but — oh , dear me—_home ! _ how good it sounds ! and [a body]388-a body is excusable for wanting to see [[his]671-my father home]498-his home again , now and then , anyway . ”[1131-i] [He]1131-i went to [one of [the telegraph offices]1133-the telegraph offices in [the avenue]1134-the avenue]1132-one of the telegraph offices in the avenue and got the first end of what [Barrow]191-barrow called the “ usual [Washington]114-hawkins courtesy , ”[191-barrow] where “ [they]2541-they treat [you]2542-you as [a tramp]1768-a tramp until [they]2541-they find out [you]2542-you ’re [a congressman]2544-a congressman , and then [they]2541-they slobber all over [you]2542-you . ”[179-tracy] There was [a boy of seventeen on duty there]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there , tying [his]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there shoe . [He]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there had [his]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there foot on a chair and [his]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there back turned toward the wicket . [He]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there glanced over [his]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there shoulder , took [Tracy]179-tracy ’s measure , turned back , and went on tying [his]1135-a boy of seventeen on duty there shoe . [Tracy]179-tracy finished writing [his]179-tracy telegram and waited , still waited , and still waited , for that performance to finish , but there did n’t seem to be any finish to it ; so finally [Tracy]179-tracy said : “ Ca n’t [you]179-tracy take [my]1018-the youth telegram ? ”[1018-the youth] [The youth]1018-the youth looked over [his]1018-the youth shoulder and said , by [his]1018-the youth manner , not [his]1018-the youth words : “ Do n’t [you]179-tracy think [you]179-tracy could wait a minute , if [you]179-tracy tried ? ”[1137-the boy] However , [he]1018-the youth got the shoe tied at last , and came and took the telegram , glanced over it , then looked up surprised , at [Tracy]179-tracy . There was something in [his]1018-the youth look that bordered upon respect , almost reverence , it seemed to [Tracy]179-tracy , although [he]179-tracy had been so long without anything of this kind [he]179-tracy was not sure that [he]179-tracy knew the signs of it . [The boy]1137-the boy read the address aloud , with pleased expression in face and voice . “ [The Earl of Rossmore]110-rossmore ! [Cracky]205-cracky ! Do [you]179-tracy know [him]110-rossmore ? ”[1137-the boy] “ Yes . ”[1137-the boy] “ Is that so ! Does [he]110-rossmore know [you]179-tracy ? ”[1137-the boy] “ Well — yes . ”[1137-the boy] “ Well , [I]1137-the boy swear ! Will [he]110-rossmore answer [you]179-tracy ? ”[1137-the boy] “ [I]1137-the boy think [he]110-rossmore will . ”[1137-the boy] “ Will [he]110-rossmore though ? Where ’ll [you]179-tracy have it sent ? ”[1137-the boy] “ Oh , nowhere . [I]1137-the boy ’ll call here and get it . When shall [I]1137-the boy call ? ”[1137-the boy] “ Oh , [I]179-tracy do n’t know — [I’ll]179-tracy send it to [you]1137-the boy . Where shall [I]179-tracy send it ? Give [me]179-tracy [your]1137-the boy address ; [I]179-tracy ’ll send it to [you]1137-the boy soon ’s it comes . ”[179-tracy] But [Tracy]179-tracy did n’t propose to do this . [He]179-tracy had acquired [the boy]1137-the boy ’s admiration and deferential respect , and [he]179-tracy was n’t willing to throw these precious things away , a result sure to follow if [he]179-tracy should give the address of [that boarding house]1116-that boarding house . So [he]179-tracy said again that [he]179-tracy would call and get the telegram , and went [his]179-tracy way . [He]179-tracy idled along , reflecting . [He]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , “ There _ is _ something pleasant about being respected . [I]1137-the boy have acquired the respect of [Mr. Allen]204-allen and some of [those others]2545-those others , and almost the deference of some of [them]2545-those others on pure merit , for having thrashed [Allen]204-allen . While [their]2545-those others respect and [their]2545-those others deference — if it is deference — is pleasant , a deference based upon a sham , a shadow , does really seem pleasanter still . It ’s no real merit to be in correspondence with [an earl]1125-an earl , and yet after all , [that boy]2547-that boy makes [me]1137-the boy feel as if there was . ”[1137-the boy] The cablegram was actually gone [home]1782-home ! the thought of it gave [him]179-tracy an immense uplift . [He]179-tracy walked with a lighter tread . [His]179-tracy heart was full of happiness . [He]179-tracy threw aside all hesitances and confessed to [himself]179-tracy that [he]179-tracy was glad through and through that [he]179-tracy was going to give up this experiment and go back to [[his]179-tracy home]498-his home again . [His]179-tracy eagerness to get [[his]179-tracy father]302-his father ’s answer began to grow , now , and it grew with marvelous celerity , after it began . [He]179-tracy waited an hour , walking about , putting in [his]179-tracy time as well as [he]179-tracy could , but interested in nothing that came under [his]179-tracy eye , and at last [he]179-tracy presented [himself]179-tracy at [the office]1143-the office again and asked if any answer had come yet . [The boy]1137-the boy said , “ No , no answer yet , ”[1137-the boy] then glanced at the clock and added , “ [I]1137-the boy do n’t think it ’s likely [you]1137-the boy ’ll get one to - day . ”[1137-the boy] “ Why not ? ”[1137-the boy] “ Well , [you]1137-the boy see it ’s getting pretty late . [You]1137-the boy ca n’t always tell where ’ bouts [a man]1806-a man is when [he]1806-a man ’s on the other side , and [you]1137-the boy ca n’t always find [him]1806-a man just the minute [you]1137-the boy want [him]1806-a man , and [you]1137-the boy see it ’s getting about six o’clock now , and over there it ’s pretty late at night . ”[179-tracy] “ Why yes , ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy , “ [I]1137-the boy had n’t thought of that . ”[1137-the boy] “ Yes , pretty late , now , half past ten or eleven . Oh yes , [you]179-tracy probably wo n’t get any answer to - night . ”[191-barrow] CHAPTER XIV . So [Tracy]179-tracy went [home]1782-home to supper . The odors in [that supper room]1146-that supper room seemed more strenuous and more horrible than ever before , and [he]179-tracy was happy in the thought that [he]179-tracy was so soon to be free from [them]1147-them again . When the supper was over [he]179-tracy hardly knew whether [he]179-tracy had eaten any of it or not , and [he]179-tracy certainly had n’t heard any of the conversation . [His]179-tracy heart had been dancing all the time , [his]179-tracy thoughts had been faraway from these things , and in the visions of [his]179-tracy mind the sumptuous appointments of [[[his]179-tracy father]302-his father ’s castle]1149-his father ’s castle had risen before [him]179-tracy without rebuke . Even the plushed flunkey , that walking symbol of a sham inequality , had not been unpleasant to [his]179-tracy dreaming view . After the meal [Barrow]191-barrow said , “ Come with [me]179-tracy . [I]179-tracy ’ll give [you]179-tracy a jolly evening . ”[179-tracy] “ Very good . Where are [you]179-tracy going ? ”[191-barrow] “ To [[my]191-barrow club]2549-my club . ”[191-barrow] “ What club is that ? ”[179-tracy] “ [Mechanics ’ Debating Club]2550-mechanics ’ debating club . ”[784-the chairman] p144.jpg ( 33 K ) [Tracy]179-tracy shuddered , slightly . [He]179-tracy did n’t say anything about having visited [that place]1150-that place [himself]179-tracy . Somehow [he]179-tracy did n’t quite relish the memory of that time . The sentiments which had made [his]179-tracy former visit [there]1907-there so enjoyable , and filled [him]179-tracy with such enthusiasm , had undergone a gradual change , and they had rotted away to such a degree that [he]179-tracy could n’t contemplate another visit [there]1907-there with anything strongly resembling delight . In fact [he]179-tracy was a little ashamed to go ; [he]179-tracy did n’t want to go [there]1907-there and find out by the rude impact of the thought of [those people]1154-those people upon [his]179-tracy reorganized condition of mind , how sharp the change had been . [He]179-tracy would have preferred to stay away . [He]179-tracy expected that now [he]179-tracy should hear nothing except sentiments which would be a reproach to [him]179-tracy in [his]179-tracy changed mental attitude , and [he]179-tracy rather wished [he]179-tracy might be excused . And yet [he]179-tracy did n’t quite want to say that , [he]179-tracy did n’t want to show how [he]179-tracy did feel , or show any disinclination to go , and so [he]179-tracy forced [himself]179-tracy to go along with [Barrow]191-barrow , privately purposing to take an early opportunity to get away . After [the essayist of the evening]1155-the essayist of the evening had read [his]179-tracy paper , [the chairman]784-the chairman announced that the debate would now be upon the subject of the previous meeting , “ The American Press . ”[1159-a blacksmith named tompkins] It saddened [the backsliding disciple]1157-the backsliding disciple to hear this announcement . It brought up too many reminiscences . [He]179-tracy wished [he]179-tracy had happened upon some other subject . But the debate began , and [he]179-tracy sat still and listened . In the course of the discussion one of [the speakers]1158-the speakers — [a blacksmith named [Tompkins]206-tompkins]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins arraigned [all monarchs]1160-all monarchs and [all lords in [the earth]1900-the earth]1161-all lords in the earth for [their]1161-all lords in the earth cold selfishness in retaining [their]1161-all lords in the earth unearned dignities . [He]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins said that [no monarch]1163-no monarch and [no son of a monarch]1164-no son of a monarch , [no lord]1165-no lord and [no son of]1166-no son of [a lord]654-a lord ought to be able to look [[his]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins fellow man]2284-his fellow man in the face without shame . Shame for consenting to keep [his]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins unearned titles , property , and privileges — at the expense of [other people]480-other people ; shame for consenting to remain , on any terms , in dishonourable possession of these things , which represented bygone robberies and wrongs inflicted upon [the general people of [the nation]836-the nation]1170-the general people of the nation . [He]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins said , “ if there were [a lord]654-a lord or [the son of [a lord]654-a lord here]2552-the son of a lord here , [I]179-tracy would like to reason with [him]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins , and try to show [him]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins how unfair and how selfish [his]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins position is . [I]179-tracy would try to persuade [him]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins to relinquish it , take [his]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins place among [men]669-men on equal terms , earn the bread [he]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins eats , and hold of slight value all deference paid [him]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins because of artificial position , all reverence not the just due of [his]1159-a blacksmith named tompkins own personal merits . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy seemed to be listening to utterances of [his]179-tracy own made in talks with [[his]179-tracy radical friends in [England]11-england]1172-his radical friends in england . It was as if [some eavesdropping phonograph]1173-some eavesdropping phonograph had treasured up [his]179-tracy words and brought them across [the Atlantic]66-the atlantic to accuse [him]179-tracy with [them]1174-them in the hour of [his]179-tracy defection and retreat . Every word spoken by [this stranger]1175-this stranger seemed to leave a blister on [Tracy]179-tracy ’s conscience , and by the time the speech was finished [he]179-tracy felt that [he]179-tracy was all conscience and one blister . [This man]1974-this man ’s deep compassion for [the enslaved and oppressed millions in [Europe]37-europe who had to bear with the contempt of [that small class above [them]1177-the enslaved and oppressed millions in europe who had to bear with the contempt of that small class above them , throned upon shining heights whose paths were shut against them , throned upon shining heights whose paths were shut against [them]1177-the enslaved and oppressed millions in europe who had to bear with the contempt of that small class above them , throned upon shining heights whose paths were shut against them]1178-that small class above them , throned upon shining heights whose paths were shut against them]1177-the enslaved and oppressed millions in europe who had to bear with the contempt of that small class above them , throned upon shining heights whose paths were shut against them , was the very thing [he]179-tracy had often uttered [himself]179-tracy . The pity in [this man]1974-this man ’s voice and words was the very twin of the pity that used to reside in [his]179-tracy own heart and come from [his]179-tracy own lips when [he]179-tracy thought of [these oppressed peoples]1180-these oppressed peoples . [The homeward tramp]1181-the homeward tramp was accomplished in brooding silence . It was a silence most grateful to [Tracy]179-tracy ’s feelings . [He]179-tracy would n’t have broken it for anything ; for [he]179-tracy was ashamed of [himself]179-tracy all the way through to [his]179-tracy spine . [He]179-tracy kept saying to [himself]179-tracy : “ How unanswerable it all is — how absolutely unanswerable ! It is basely , degradingly selfish to keep those unearned honors , and — and — oh , hang it , [nobody]483-nobody but [a cur]2556-a cur — ”[191-barrow] “ What an idiotic damned speech that [Tompkins]206-tompkins made ! ”[179-tracy] This outburst was from [Barrow]191-barrow . [It]1182-it flooded [Tracy]179-tracy ’s demoralized soul with waters of refreshment . These were the darlingest words [the poor vacillating young apostate]1183-the poor vacillating young apostate had ever heard — for [they]1184-they whitewashed [his]179-tracy shame for [him]179-tracy , and that is a good service to have when [you]1185-you ca n’t get the best of all verdicts , self - acquittal . “ Come up to [[my]179-tracy room]523-my room and smoke a pipe , [Tracy]179-tracy . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy had been expecting this invitation , and had had [his]179-tracy declination all ready : but [he]179-tracy was glad enough to accept , now . Was it possible that a reasonable argument could be made against [that man]650-that man ’s desolating speech ? [He]179-tracy was burning to hear [Barrow]191-barrow try it . [He]179-tracy knew how to start [him]191-barrow , and keep [him]191-barrow going : it was to seem to combat [his]191-barrow positions — a process effective with [most people]1187-most people . “ What is it [you]179-tracy object to in [Tompkins]206-tompkins ’s speech , [Barrow]191-barrow ? ”[179-tracy] “ Oh , the leaving out of the factor of human nature ; requiring [another man]2307-another man to do what [you]179-tracy would n’t do [yourself]179-tracy . ”[179-tracy] “ Do [you]179-tracy mean — ”[179-tracy] “ Why here ’s what [I]179-tracy mean ; it ’s very simple . [Tompkins]206-tompkins is [a blacksmith]2559-a blacksmith ; has [a family]2560-a family ; works for wages ; and hard , too — fooling around wo n’t furnish the bread . Suppose it should turn out that by the death of somebody in [England]11-england [he]650-that man is suddenly [an earl]1125-an earl — income , half a million dollars a year . [I]179-tracy would [myself]179-tracy . ”[179-tracy] p148.jpg ( 24 K ) This was balm , this was healing , this was rest and peace and comfort . “ But [I]179-tracy thought [you]179-tracy were opposed to nobilities . ”[179-tracy] “ [Transmissible ones]2569-transmissible ones , yes . [I]179-tracy ’m opposed to [millionaires]2570-millionaires , but it would be dangerous to offer [me]179-tracy the position . ”[179-tracy] “ [You]179-tracy ’d take it ? ”[179-tracy] “ [I]179-tracy would leave the funeral of [[my]179-tracy dearest enemy]2571-my dearest enemy to go and assume its burdens and responsibilities . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy thought a while , then said : “ [I]191-barrow do n’t know that [I]191-barrow quite get the bearings of [your]179-tracy position .
