There is n’t [a lawyer]2573-a lawyer , [doctor]2574-doctor , [editor]2575-editor , [author]272-author , [tinker]2577-tinker , [loafer]2578-loafer , [railroad president]2579-railroad president , saint — land , there is n’t [a human _ being]2580-a human _ being _ in [the United States]67-the united states that would n’t jump at the chance ! ”[179-tracy] “ Except [me]179-tracy , ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy softly . “ Except [you]191-barrow ! ”[191-barrow] [Barrow]191-barrow could hardly get the words out , [his]191-barrow scorn so choked [him]191-barrow . And [he]191-barrow could n’t get any further than that form of words ; it seemed to dam [his]191-barrow flow , utterly . [He]191-barrow got up and came and glared upon [Tracy]179-tracy in a kind of outraged and unappeasable way , and said again , “ Except _ [you]179-tracy ! _ ”[191-barrow] [He]191-barrow walked around [him]191-barrow — inspecting [him]191-barrow from one point of view and then another , and relieving [his]191-barrow soul now and then by exploding that formula at [him]191-barrow ; “ Except _ [you]179-tracy ! _ ”[191-barrow] Finally [he]191-barrow slumped down into [his]191-barrow chair with the air of [one who gives it up]1188-one who gives it up , and said : “ [He]191-barrow ’s straining [his]191-barrow viscera and [he]191-barrow ’s breaking [his]191-barrow heart trying to get some low - down job that [a good dog]2581-a good dog would n’t have , and yet wants to let on that if [he]191-barrow had a chance to scoop an earldom [he]191-barrow would n’t do it . [Tracy]179-tracy , do n’t put this kind of a strain on [me]191-barrow . Lately [I]191-barrow ’m not as strong as [I]191-barrow was . ”[191-barrow] “ Well , [I]191-barrow was n’t meaning to put — a strain on [you]191-barrow , [Barrow]191-barrow , [I]191-barrow was only meaning to intimate that if an earldom ever does fall in [my]191-barrow way — ”[191-barrow] “ There — [I]191-barrow would n’t give [myself]191-barrow any worry about _ that _ , if [I]191-barrow was [you]191-barrow . And besides , [I]191-barrow can settle what [you]191-barrow would do . Are [you]191-barrow any different from [me]191-barrow ? ”[191-barrow] “ Well — no . ”[191-barrow] “ Are [you]191-barrow any better than [me]191-barrow ? ”[191-barrow] “ O,—er — why , certainly not . ”[191-barrow] “ Are [you]191-barrow as _ good ? _ Come ! ”[191-barrow] “ Indeed , [I]191-barrow — the fact is [you]191-barrow take [me]191-barrow so suddenly — ”[191-barrow] “ Suddenly ? What is there sudden about it ? It is n’t a difficult question is it ? Or doubtful ? Just measure [us]2582-us on the only fair lines — the lines of merit — and of course [you]191-barrow ’ll admit that [a journeyman chairmaker that earns [his]1189-the chair - maker twenty dollars a week , and has had the good and genuine culture of contact with [men , and care , and hardship , and failure , and success , and downs and ups and ups and downs]2584-men , and care , and hardship , and failure , and success , and downs and ups and ups and downs]2583-a journeyman chairmaker that earns his twenty dollars a week , and has had the good and genuine culture of contact with men , and care , and hardship , and failure , and success , and downs and ups and ups and downs , is just a trifle the superior of [a young fellow like [you]191-barrow]2585-a young fellow like you , who does n’t know how to do anything that ’s valuable , ca n’t earn [his]1189-the chair - maker living in any secure and steady way , has n’t had any experience of life and its seriousness , has n’t any culture but the artificial culture of books , which adorns but does n’t really educate — come ! if _ [I]179-tracy _ would n’t scorn an earldom , what the devil right have _ [you]191-barrow _ to do it ! ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy dissembled [his]179-tracy joy , though [he]179-tracy wanted to thank [the chair - maker]1189-the chair - maker for that last remark . Presently a thought struck [him]179-tracy , and [he]179-tracy spoke up briskly and said : “ But look here , [I]191-barrow really ca n’t quite get the hang of [your]191-barrow notions — [your]191-barrow principles , if they are principles . [You]191-barrow are inconsistent . [You]191-barrow are opposed to aristocracies , yet [you]191-barrow ’d take an earldom if [you]191-barrow could . Am [I]191-barrow to understand that [you]191-barrow do n’t blame [an earl]1125-an earl for being and remaining [an earl]1125-an earl ? ”[191-barrow] “ [I]191-barrow certainly do n’t . ”[191-barrow] “ And [you]191-barrow would n’t blame [Tompkins]206-tompkins , or [yourself]191-barrow , or [me]179-tracy , or [anybody]1915-anybody , for accepting an earldom if it was offered ? ”[179-tracy] “ Indeed [I]191-barrow would n’t . ”[191-barrow] “ Well , then , whom [_]2589-_ would _ [you]191-barrow blame ? ”[191-barrow] “ [The whole nation]2411-the whole nation — any bulk and mass of population anywhere , in [any country]791-any country , that will put up with the infamy , the outrage , the insult of [a hereditary aristocracy which _ [they]2592-a hereditary aristocracy which _ they _ ca n’t enter _ ca n’t enter]2592-a hereditary aristocracy which _ they _ ca n’t enter — and on absolutely free and equal terms . ”[179-tracy] “ Come , are n’t [you]191-barrow beclouding [yourself]191-barrow with distinctions that are not differences ? ”[191-barrow] “ Indeed [I]191-barrow am not . [I]191-barrow am entirely clear - headed about this thing . If [I]191-barrow could extirpate an aristocratic system by declining its honors , _ then _ [I]191-barrow should be [a rascal]2593-a rascal to accept them . And if enough of [the mass]2594-the mass would join [me]191-barrow to make the extirpation possible , _ then _ [I]191-barrow should be [a rascal to do otherwise than help in the attempt]2595-a rascal to do otherwise than help in the attempt . ”[191-barrow] “ [I]191-barrow believe [I]191-barrow understand — yes , [I]191-barrow think [I]191-barrow get the idea . [You]191-barrow have no blame for [the lucky few who naturally decline to vacate the pleasant nest [they]2596-the lucky few who naturally decline to vacate the pleasant nest they were born into were born into]2596-the lucky few who naturally decline to vacate the pleasant nest they were born into , [you]191-barrow only despise [the all - powerful and stupid mass of [the nation]836-the nation]2597-the all - powerful and stupid mass of the nation for allowing the nest to exist . ”[191-barrow] “ That ’s it , that ’s it ! [You]191-barrow _ can _ get a simple thing through [your]191-barrow head if [you]191-barrow work at it long enough . ”[179-tracy] “ Thanks . ”[179-tracy] “ Do n’t mention it . And [I]191-barrow ’ll give [you]191-barrow some sound advice : when [you]191-barrow go back ; if [you]191-barrow find [[your]191-barrow nation]2599-your nation up and ready to abolish that hoary affront , lend a hand ; but if that is n’t the state of things and [you]191-barrow get a chance at an earldom , do n’t [you]191-barrow be [a fool]1833-a fool — [you]191-barrow take it . ”[191-barrow] [Tracy]179-tracy responded with earnestness and enthusiasm : “ As [I]179-tracy live , [I]179-tracy ’ll do it ! ”[179-tracy] [Barrow]191-barrow laughed . “ [I]191-barrow never saw [such a fellow]2601-such a fellow . [I]191-barrow begin to think [you]191-barrow ’ve got a good deal of imagination . With [you]191-barrow , the idlest fancy freezes into a reality at a breath . Why , [you]191-barrow looked , then , as if it would n’t astonish [you]191-barrow if [you]191-barrow did tumble into an earldom . ”[191-barrow] [Tracy]179-tracy blushed . [Barrow]191-barrow added : “ Earldom ! Oh , yes , take it , if it offers ; but meantime [we]2602-we ’ll go on looking around , in a modest way , and if [you]191-barrow get a chance to superintend a sausage - stuffer at six or eight dollars a week , [you]191-barrow just trade off the earldom for a last year ’s almanac and stick to the sausage - stuffing . ”[179-tracy] CHAPTER XV . [Tracy]179-tracy went to bed happy once more , at rest in [his]179-tracy mind once more . [He]179-tracy had started out on a high emprise — that was to [his]179-tracy credit , [he]179-tracy argued ; [he]179-tracy had fought the best fight [he]179-tracy could , considering the odds against [him]179-tracy — that was to [his]179-tracy credit ; [he]179-tracy had been defeated — certainly there was nothing discreditable in that . Being defeated , [he]179-tracy had a right to retire with the honors of war and go back without prejudice to the position in [the world ’s society to which [he]179-tracy had been born]1190-the world ’s society to which he had been born . Why not ? [even the rabid republican chair - maker]1191-even the rabid republican chair - maker would do that . Yes , [his]179-tracy conscience was comfortable once more . [He]179-tracy woke refreshed , happy , and eager for [his]179-tracy cablegram . [He]179-tracy had been born [an aristocrat]2319-an aristocrat , [he]179-tracy had been [a democrat]1193-a democrat for a time , [he]179-tracy was now [an aristocrat]2319-an aristocrat again . [He]179-tracy marveled to find that this final change was not merely intellectual , it had invaded [his]179-tracy feeling ; and [he]179-tracy also marveled to note that this feeling seemed a good deal less artificial than any [he]179-tracy had entertained in [his]179-tracy system for a long time . [He]179-tracy could also have noted , if [he]179-tracy had thought of it , that [his]179-tracy bearing had stiffened , over night , and that [his]179-tracy chin had lifted itself a shade . Arrived in [the basement]979-the basement , [he]179-tracy was about to enter [the breakfast room]1196-the breakfast room when [he]179-tracy saw [old Marsh]186-mrs. marsh in the dim light of a corner of [the hall]960-the hall , beckoning [him]179-tracy with [his]179-tracy finger to approach . The blood welled slowly up in [Tracy]179-tracy ’s cheek , and [he]179-tracy said with a grade of injured dignity almost ducal : “ Is that for [me]179-tracy ? ”[179-tracy] “ Yes . ”[179-tracy] “ What is the purpose of it ? ”[179-tracy] “ [I]179-tracy want to speak to [you]179-tracy — in private . ”[179-tracy] “ [This spot]728-this spot is private enough for [me]179-tracy . ”[179-tracy] [Marsh]186-mrs. marsh was surprised ; and not particularly pleased . [He]179-tracy approached and said : “ Oh , in public , then , if [you]179-tracy prefer . Though it has n’t been [my]179-tracy way . ”[179-tracy] [The boarders]2352-the boarders gathered to the spot , interested . “ Speak out , ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy . “ What is it [you]179-tracy want ? ”[179-tracy] “ Well , have n’t [you]179-tracy — er — forgot something ? ”[179-tracy] “ [I]179-tracy ? It does n’t interest [me]186-mrs. marsh . If it interests [you]179-tracy , speak out . ”[186-mrs. marsh] “ Well , then , ”[179-tracy] said [Marsh]186-mrs. marsh , raising [his]179-tracy voice to a slightly angry pitch , “ [You]179-tracy forgot to pay [your]179-tracy board yesterday — if [you]179-tracy ’re _ bound _ to have it public . ”[179-tracy] Oh , yes , [this heir to an annual million or so]1199-this heir to an annual million or so had been dreaming and soaring , and had forgotten that pitiful three or four dollars . For penalty [he]179-tracy must have it coarsely flung in [his]179-tracy face in the presence of [these people]1044-these people — [people in whose countenances was already beginning to dawn an uncharitable enjoyment of the situation]1201-people in whose countenances was already beginning to dawn an uncharitable enjoyment of the situation . “ Is _ that _ all ! Take [your]179-tracy money and give [your]179-tracy terrors a rest . ”[179-tracy] [Tracy]179-tracy ’s hand went down into [his]179-tracy pocket with angry decision . But — it did n’t come out . The color began to ebb out of [his]179-tracy face . [The countenances]1202-the countenances about [him]179-tracy showed a growing interest ; and some of [them]1202-the countenances a heightened satisfaction . There was an uncomfortable pause — then [he]179-tracy forced out , with difficulty , the words : “ [I’ve]179-tracy — been robbed ! ”[179-tracy] [Old Marsh]207-old marsh ’s eyes flamed up with Spanish fire , and [he]179-tracy exclaimed : “ Robbed , is it ? _ That ’s _ [your]179-tracy tune ? It ’s too old — been played in [this house]1799-this house too often ; [everybody]404-everybody plays it that ca n’t get work when [he]404-everybody wants it , and wo n’t work when [he]404-everybody can get it . Immediately the sort of quiet began to steal over [the crowd]2117-the crowd which means dawning doubt , misgiving ; and might be translated into the words , “ Maybe [he]198-brady _ is _ expecting a cablegram — maybe [he]198-brady _ has _ got [a father]2641-a father somewhere — maybe [we]2640-we ’ve been just a little too fresh , just a shade too ‘ previous ’ ! ”[191-barrow] Loud talk ceased ; then the mutterings and low murmurings and whisperings died out . [The crowd]2117-the crowd began to crumble apart . By ones and twos the fragments drifted to the breakfast table . [Barrow]191-barrow tried to bring [Tracy]179-tracy in ; but [he]191-barrow said : “ Not yet , [Barrow]191-barrow — presently . ”[191-barrow] [Mrs. Marsh]186-mrs. marsh and [Hattie]187-hattie tried , offering gentle and kindly persuasions ; but [he]191-barrow said ; “ [I]191-barrow would rather wait — till [he]179-tracy comes . ”[191-barrow] Even [old Marsh]186-mrs. marsh began to have suspicions that maybe [he]191-barrow had been a trifle too “ brash , ”[1218-the humorist of the house] as [he]191-barrow called it in the privacy of [his]191-barrow soul , and [he]191-barrow pulled [himself]191-barrow together and started toward [Tracy]179-tracy with invitation in [his]191-barrow eyes ; but [Tracy]179-tracy warned [him]191-barrow off with a gesture which was quite positive and eloquent . Then followed the stillest quarter of an hour which had ever been known in [that house]1213-that house at that time of day . It was so still , and so solemn withal , that when [somebody]368-somebody ’s cup slipped from [his]368-somebody fingers and landed in [his]368-somebody plate the shock made [people]1954-people start , and the sharp sound seemed as indecorous there and as out of place as if a coffin and [mourners]1216-mourners were imminent and being waited for . And at last when [Brady]198-brady ’s feet came clattering down the stairs the sacrilege seemed unbearable . [Everybody]213-everybody rose softly and turned toward the door , where stood [Tracy]179-tracy ; then with a common impulse , moved a step or two in that direction , and stopped . While [they]1954-people gazed , [young Brady]198-brady arrived , panting , and put into [Tracy]179-tracy ’s hand,—sure enough — an envelope . [Tracy]179-tracy fastened a bland victorious eye upon [the gazers]1217-the gazers , and kept it there till one by one [they]1217-the gazers dropped [their]1217-the gazers eyes , vanquished and embarrassed . Then [he]179-tracy tore open the telegram and glanced at its message . The yellow paper fell from [his]179-tracy fingers and fluttered to the floor , and [his]179-tracy face turned white . There was nothing there but one word — “ _ Thanks _ . ”[179-tracy] [The humorist of [the house]365-the house]1218-the humorist of the house , [the tall , raw - boned [Billy Nash]214-billy nash , caulker from [the navy yard]2316-the navy yard]1220-the tall , raw - boned billy nash , caulker from the navy yard , was standing in the rear of [the crowd]2117-the crowd . So perfect was that imitation of [a child]501-a child ’s cry , and so vast the scale of it and so ridiculous the aspect of [the performer]1229-the performer , that all gravity was swept from [the place]411-the place as if by a hurricane , and almost [everybody there]1231-everybody there joined in the crash of laughter provoked by the exhibition . Then [the small mob]1232-the small mob began to take its revenge — revenge for the discomfort and apprehension it had brought upon [itself]1232-the small mob by [its]1232-the small mob own too rash freshness of a little while before . [It]1232-the small mob guyed [[its]1232-the small mob poor victim]1233-its poor victim , baited [him]1233-its poor victim , worried [him]1233-its poor victim , as dogs do with a cornered cat . [You]2647-old fellow ’re a little upset by [your]2647-old fellow troubles , and that ’s natural enough , but do n’t let [your]2647-old fellow mind run on them anymore than [you]2647-old fellow can help ; drag [your]2647-old fellow thoughts away from [your]2647-old fellow troubles by the ears , by the heels , or any other way , so [you]2647-old fellow manage it ; it ’s the healthiest thing a body can do ; dwelling on troubles is deadly , just deadly — and that ’s the softest name there is for it . Brady]215-chapter xvi . brady arrived with a box , and departed , after saying , “ [They]2654-they ’re finishing one up , but [they]2654-they ’ll be along as soon as it ’s done . ”[191-barrow] [Barrow]191-barrow took a frameless oil portrait a foot square from the box , set it up in a good light , without comment , and reached for another , taking a furtive glance at [Tracy]179-tracy , meantime . The stony solemnity in [Tracy]179-tracy ’s face remained as it was , and gave out no sign of interest . [Barrow]191-barrow placed the second portrait beside the first , and stole another glance while reaching for a third . The stone image softened , a shade . [No . 3]1246-no . 3 forced the ghost of a smile , [No . 4]1247-no . 4 swept indifference wholly away , and [No . 5]1248-no . 5 started a laugh which was still in good and hearty condition when No . 14 took its place in the row . p162.jpg ( 17 K ) “ Oh , _ [you]2647-old fellow ’re _ all right , yet , ”[191-barrow] said [Barrow]191-barrow . “ [You]2647-old fellow see [you]2647-old fellow ’re not past amusement . ”[179-tracy] The pictures were fearful , as to color , and atrocious as to drawing and expression ; but the feature which squelched animosity and made them funny was a feature which could not achieve its full force in a single picture , but required the wonder - working assistance of repetition . [One loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude]1249-one loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude , with [his]1249-one loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude hand on a cannon , [ashore]1250-ashore , and [a ship]1251-a ship riding at anchor in [the offing,—this]69-the offing,—this is merely odd ; but when one sees the same cannon and [the same ship]1252-the same ship in fourteen pictures in a row , and [a different mechanic]1253-a different mechanic standing watch in each , the thing gets to be funny . “ Explain — explain these aberrations , ”[179-tracy] said [Tracy]179-tracy . “ Well , they are not the achievement of a single intellect , a single talent — it takes two to do these miracles . [They]2654-they are collaborations ; [the one artist]2655-the one artist does the figure , the other the accessories . [The figure - artist]2656-the figure - artist is [a German shoemaker with an untaught passion for art]2657-a german shoemaker with an untaught passion for art , [the other]808-the other is [a simple hearted old Yankee sailor - man whose possibilities are strictly limited to [[his]1249-one loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude ship]2660-his ship , [his]1249-one loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude cannon and [[his]1249-one loudly dressed mechanic in stately attitude patch of [petrified sea]2662-petrified sea]2661-his patch of petrified sea]2659-a simple hearted old yankee sailor - man whose possibilities are strictly limited to his ship , his cannon and his patch of petrified sea . [They]2654-they work these things up from twenty - five - cent tintypes ; [they]2654-they get six dollars apiece for [them]2654-they , and [they]2654-they can grind out a couple a day when [they]2654-they strike what [they]2654-they call a boost — that is , an inspiration . ”[216-capt . saltmarsh] “ [People]1954-people actually pay money for these calumnies ? ”[2675-the artists] “ [They]1954-people actually do — and quite willingly , too . And [these abortionists]2664-these abortionists could double [their]2664-these abortionists trade and work [the women]1007-the women in , if [Capt . Saltmarsh]216-capt . saltmarsh could whirl a horse in , or a piano , or a guitar , in place of [his]216-capt . saltmarsh cannon . The fact is , [he]216-capt . saltmarsh fatigues the market with that cannon . Even [the male market]2666-the male market , [I]179-tracy mean . [These fourteen in the procession]2667-these fourteen in the procession are not all satisfied . [One]372-one is [an old ‘ independent ’ fireman]2669-an old ‘ independent ’ fireman , and [he]372-one wants an engine in place of the cannon ; [another]2670-another is [a mate of a tug]2671-a mate of a tug , and wants a tug in place of [the ship]2652-the ship — and so on , and so on . But [the captain]2673-the captain ca n’t make a tug that is deceptive , and a fire engine is many flights beyond [his]2673-the captain power . ”[179-tracy] “ [This _]2674-this _ is _ a most extraordinary form of robbery , [I]216-capt . saltmarsh never have heard of anything like it . It ’s interesting . ”[216-capt . saltmarsh] “ Yes , and so are [the artists]2675-the artists . [They]2675-the artists are [perfectly honest men]2676-perfectly honest men , and sincere . [The German]1255-the german was forty and a little fleshy , with a shiny bald head and a kindly face and deferential manner . [Capt . Saltmarsh]216-capt . saltmarsh was sixty , tall , erect , powerfully built , with coal - black hair and whiskers , and [he]216-capt . saltmarsh had a well tanned complexion , and a gait and countenance that were full of command , confidence and decision . [Poor devil]2733-poor devil ! away off here , and not [a friend]971-a friend . ”[191-barrow] CHAPTER XVII . The moment [Tracy]179-tracy was alone [his]179-tracy spirits vanished away , and all the misery of [his]179-tracy situation was manifest to [him]179-tracy . To be moneyless and an object of [the chairmaker]1267-the chairmaker ’s charity — this was bad enough , but [his]179-tracy folly in proclaiming [himself]179-tracy [[an earl]1125-an earl ’s son]2729-an earl ’s son to [that scoffing and unbelieving crew]1270-that scoffing and unbelieving crew , and , on top of that , the humiliating result — the recollection of these things was a sharper torture still . [He]179-tracy made up [his]179-tracy mind that [he]179-tracy would never play [[earl]1271-earl ’s son]1272-earl ’s son again before [a doubtful audience]1273-a doubtful audience . [[His]179-tracy father]302-his father ’s answer was a blow [he]179-tracy could not understand . At times [he]179-tracy thought [[his]179-tracy father]302-his father imagined [he]179-tracy could get work to do in [America]9-america without any trouble , and was minded to let [him]179-tracy try it and cure [himself]179-tracy of [his]179-tracy radicalism by hard , cold , disenchanting experience . That seemed the most plausible theory , yet [he]179-tracy could not content [himself]179-tracy with it . A theory that pleased [him]179-tracy better was , that this cablegram would be followed by another , of a gentler sort , requiring [him]179-tracy to come [home]1782-home . Should [he]179-tracy write and strike [his]179-tracy flag , and ask for a ticket [home]1782-home ? Oh , no , that [he]179-tracy could n’t _ ever _ do . At least , not yet . That cablegram would come , it certainly would . So [he]179-tracy went from [one telegraph office]1278-one telegraph office to another every day for nearly a week , and asked if there was a cablegram for [Howard Tracy]179-tracy . No , there was n’t any . So [they]1279-they answered [him]179-tracy at first . Later , [they]1279-they said it before [he]179-tracy had a chance to ask . Later still [they]1279-they merely shook [their]1279-they heads impatiently as soon as [he]179-tracy came in sight . After that [he]179-tracy was ashamed to go any more . [He]179-tracy was down in the lowest depths of despair , now ; for the harder [Barrow]191-barrow tried to find work for [him]179-tracy the more hopeless the possibilities seemed to grow . At last [he]191-barrow said to [Barrow]191-barrow : “ Look here . [I]191-barrow want to make a confession . [I]191-barrow have got down , now , to where [I]191-barrow am not only willing to acknowledge to [myself]191-barrow that [I]191-barrow am [a shabby creature and full of false pride]2735-a shabby creature and full of false pride , but am willing to acknowledge it to [you]191-barrow . Well , [I]191-barrow ’ve been allowing [you]191-barrow to wear [yourself]191-barrow out hunting for work for [me]191-barrow when there ’s been a chance open to [me]191-barrow all the time . Forgive [my]191-barrow pride — what was left of it . It is all gone , now , and [I]191-barrow ’ve come to confess that if [those ghastly artists]2736-those ghastly artists want another confederate , [I]191-barrow ’m [[their]2736-those ghastly artists man]2737-their man — for at last [I]191-barrow am dead to shame . ”[191-barrow] “ No ? Really , can [you]191-barrow paint ? ”[191-barrow] “ Not as badly as _ [they]2736-those ghastly artists _ . No , [I]191-barrow do n’t claim that , for [I]191-barrow am not [a genius]2738-a genius ; in fact , [I]191-barrow am [a very indifferent amateur]2739-a very indifferent amateur , [a slouchy dabster]2740-a slouchy dabster , a mere artistic sarcasm ; but drunk or asleep [I]191-barrow can beat _ those _ buccaneers . ”[191-barrow] “ Shake ! [I]191-barrow want to shout ! Oh , [I]191-barrow tell [you]191-barrow , [I]191-barrow am immensely delighted and relieved . Oh , just to work — that is life ! No matter what the work is — that ’s of no consequence . Just work itself is bliss when [a man]1806-a man ’s been starving for it . [I]191-barrow ’ve _ been _ there ! Come right along ; [we]2742-we ’ll hunt [the old boys]2743-the old boys up . Do n’t [you]191-barrow feel good ? [I]191-barrow tell [you]191-barrow _ [I]191-barrow _ do . ”[191-barrow] [The freebooters]1280-the freebooters were not at [home]1782-home . But [their]1280-the freebooters “ works ”[227-balaclava] were , displayed in profusion all about [the little ratty studio]1282-the little ratty studio . Cannon to the right of [them]1280-the freebooters , cannon to the left of [them]1280-the freebooters , cannon in front — it was [Balaclava]227-balaclava come again . “ Here ’s [the uncontented hackman]2744-the uncontented hackman , [Tracy]179-tracy . Let [the boys]2121-the boys have a taste of [your]179-tracy quality . ”[2675-the artists] [The artists]2675-the artists arrived just as the last touch was put on . [They]2675-the artists stood transfixed with admiration . “ [My]227-balaclava souls but [she]2746-a hearse ’s [a stunner]2748-a stunner , [that hearse]2749-that hearse ! [The hackman]2750-the hackman will just go all to pieces when [he]2750-the hackman sees that wo n’t [he]2750-the hackman [Andy]222-andy ? ”[227-balaclava] “ Oh , it is sphlennid , sphlennid ! [Herr Tracy]218-tracy , why haf [you]179-tracy not said [you]179-tracy vas [a so sublime aartist]2751-a so sublime aartist ? [Lob ’ Gott]228-lob ’ gott , of [you]179-tracy had lif’d in [Paris]24-paris [you]179-tracy would be a Pree de [Rome]71-rome , dot ’s votes de matter ! ”[110-rossmore] The arrangements were soon made . [Tracy]218-tracy was taken into full and equal partnership , and [he]218-tracy went straight to work , with dash and energy , to reconstructing gems of art whose accessories had failed to satisfy . Under [his]218-tracy hand , on that and succeeding days , artillery disappeared and the emblems of peace and commerce took its place — cats , hacks , sausages , tugs , fire engines , pianos , guitars , rocks , [gardens]1284-gardens , flower - pots , landscapes — whatever was wanted , [he]218-tracy flung it in ; and the more out of place and absurd the required object was , the more joy [he]218-tracy got out of fabricating it . [The pirates]1285-the pirates were delighted , [the customers]1286-the customers applauded , [the sex]1287-the sex began to flock in , great was the prosperity of [the firm]1288-the firm . [Tracy]218-tracy was obliged to confess to [himself]218-tracy that there was something about work,—even such grotesque and humble work as this — which most pleasantly satisfied a something in [his]218-tracy nature which had never been satisfied before , and also gave [him]218-tracy a strange new dignity in [his]218-tracy own private view of [himself]218-tracy . [The Unqualified Member from [Cherokee Strip]20-cherokee strip]1289-the unqualified member from cherokee strip was in a state of deep dejection . For a good while , now , [he]218-tracy had been leading a sort of life which was calculated to kill ; for it had consisted in regularly alternating days of brilliant hope and black disappointment . The brilliant hopes were created by [the magician [Sellers]110-rossmore]1290-the magician sellers , and [they]1291-they always promised that _ now _ [he]218-tracy had got the trick , sure , and would effectively influence that materialized cowboy to call at [the Towers]1292-the towers before night . The black disappointments consisted in the persistent and monotonous failure of these prophecies . At the date which this history has now reached , [Sellers]110-rossmore was appalled to find that the usual remedy was inoperative , and that [Hawkins]114-hawkins ’s low spirits refused absolutely to lift . Something must be done , [he]110-rossmore reflected ; it was heart - breaking , this woe , this smileless misery , this dull despair that looked out from [[his]110-rossmore poor friend]1293-his poor friend ’s face . Yes , [he]218-tracy must be cheered up . [He]110-rossmore mused a while , then [he]110-rossmore saw [his]110-rossmore way . [He]110-rossmore said in [his]110-rossmore most conspicuously casual vein : “ Er — uh — by the way , [Hawkins]114-hawkins , [we]2752-we are feeling disappointed about this thing — the way [the materializee]2753-the materializee is acting , [I]110-rossmore mean — [we]2752-we are disappointed ; [you]114-hawkins concede that ? ”[110-rossmore] “ Concede it ? Why , yes , if [you]114-hawkins like the term . ”[110-rossmore] “ Very well ; so far , so good . Now for the _ basis _ of the feeling . It is not that [your]114-hawkins heart , [your]114-hawkins affections are concerned ; that is to say , it is not that [you]114-hawkins _ want _ the materializee _ Itself _ . [You]114-hawkins concede that ? ”[110-rossmore] “ Yes , [I]537-the earl concede that , too — cordially . ”[537-the earl] “ Very well , again ; [we]2752-we are making progress . To sum up : The feeling , it is conceded , is not engendered by the mere conduct of the materializee ; it is conceded that it does not arise from any pang which the _ personality _ of the materializee could assuage . Now then , ”[537-the earl] said [the earl]537-the earl , with the light of triumph in [his]537-the earl eye , “ the inexorable logic of the situation narrows [us]2752-we down to this : [our]2752-we feeling has its source in the _ money_-loss involved . Come — isn’t that so ? ”[114-hawkins] “ [Goodness]229-goodness knows [I]1295-the old , old seduction concede that , with all [my]1295-the old , old seduction heart . ”[1295-the old , old seduction] “ Very well . When [you]114-hawkins ’ve found out the source of a disease , [you]114-hawkins ’ve also found out what remedy is required — just as in this case . In this case money is required . By this system [the whole of [the hundred millions of [Russia]30-russia]2849-the hundred millions of russia]2848-the whole of the hundred millions of russia are being constantly and patiently sifted , sifted , sifted , by [myriads of trained experts]2850-myriads of trained experts , [spies appointed by [the Emperor personally]2852-the emperor personally]2851-spies appointed by the emperor personally ; and whenever [they]2850-myriads of trained experts catch [a man]1806-a man , [woman]2854-woman or [child that has got any brains or education or character]2855-child that has got any brains or education or character , [they]2850-myriads of trained experts ship [that person]2856-that person straight to [Siberia]17-siberia . [Only excitable people]2867-only excitable people , [impulsive people]2868-impulsive people , are exposed to it . But the circumstances of the present case — [I]537-the earl being [a democrat by birth and preference]2869-a democrat by birth and preference , and [an aristocrat]2319-an aristocrat by inheritance and relish — ”[537-the earl] [The earl]537-the earl stopped suddenly , [his]537-the earl frame stiffened , and [he]537-the earl began to stare speechless through the curtainless window . Then [he]537-the earl pointed , and gasped out a single rapturous word : “ Look ! ”[537-the earl] “ What _ is _ it , [Colonel]95-mulberry ? ”[537-the earl] “ _ It ! _ ”[537-the earl] “ No ! ”[537-the earl] “ Sure as [you]160-hawkins ’re born . Keep perfectly still . [I]537-the earl ’ll apply the influence — [I’ll]537-the earl turn on all [my]537-the earl force . CHAPTER XIX . Meantime [the earl]537-the earl and [Hawkins]232-hawkins were holding a troubled and anxious private consultation . [The earl]537-the earl said : “ The mystery that bothers [me]1327-me , is , where did [It]2898-it get [its]2898-it other arm ? ”[1327-me] “ Yes — it worries [me]1327-me , too . Finally [the earl]537-the earl ’s face began to glow with an inspiration , and [he]1327-me said , impressively : “ [Hawkins]232-hawkins , this materialization is a grander and nobler science than [we]2901-we have dreamed of . [We]2901-we have little imagined what a solemn and stupendous thing [we]2901-we have done . The whole secret is perfectly clear to [me]232-hawkins , now , clear as day . _ [Every man]2906-every man is made up of heredities _ , long - descended atoms and particles of [[his]2906-every man ancestors]2907-his ancestors . This present materialization is incomplete . [We]2901-we have only brought it down to perhaps the beginning of this century . ”[232-hawkins] “ What do [you]2451-the old man mean , [Colonel]95-mulberry ! ”[1327-me] cried [Hawkins]232-hawkins , filled with vague alarms by [the old man]2451-the old man ’s awe - compelling words and manner . “ This . [We]2901-we ’ve materialized [[this burglar]2908-this burglar ’s ancestor]2909-this burglar ’s ancestor ! ”[1327-me] “ Oh , don’t — don’t say that . [Hawkins]232-hawkins said plaintively : “ It ’s a bitter disappointment — bitter . ”[1327-me] “ [I]232-hawkins know it . [I]232-hawkins need money , but [God]178-god knows [I]232-hawkins am not poor enough or shabby enough to be an accessory to the punishing of [[a man]1806-a man ’s ancestor]2921-a man ’s ancestor for crimes committed by [that ancestor]2922-that ancestor ’s posterity . ”[232-hawkins] “ But [Colonel]95-mulberry ! ”[232-hawkins] implored [Hawkins]232-hawkins ; “ stop and think ; do n’t be rash ; [you]95-mulberry know it ’s the _ only _ chance [we]2917-we ’ve got to get the money ; and besides , the Bible itself says posterity to [the fourth generation]2923-the fourth generation shall be punished for the sins and crimes committed by [ancestors]2924-ancestors four generations back that had n’t anything to do with [them]2924-ancestors ; and so it ’s only fair to turn the rule around and make it work both ways . ”[374-the colonel] [The Colonel]374-the colonel was struck with the strong logic of this position . [I]0-i tried to be polite to [him]236-hans christian andersen ; offered [him]236-hans christian andersen a snack”—(Sellers delivered a large wink to [Hawkins]114-hawkins from behind [his]236-hans christian andersen hand ) , “[236-hans christian andersen] but [he]236-hans christian andersen declined , and said [he]236-hans christian andersen was n’t hungry ” ( another sarcastic wink ) ; “[236-hans christian andersen] so [I]0-i brought some apples ” ( doublewink ) , “[236-hans christian andersen] and [he]236-hans christian andersen ate a couple of — ” “[236-hans christian andersen] What ! ” and [the colonel]374-the colonel sprang some yards toward the ceiling and came down quaking with astonishment . [Lady Rossmore]145-lady rossmore was smitten dumb with amazement . [She]145-lady rossmore gazed at the sheepish relic of [Cherokee Strip]20-cherokee strip , then at [[her]145-lady rossmore husband]1022-her husband , and then at [the guest]2954-the guest again . Finally [she]145-lady rossmore said : “[236-hans christian andersen] What is the matter with [you]236-hans christian andersen , [Mulberry]110-rossmore ? ” [He]236-hans christian andersen did not answer immediately . [His]236-hans christian andersen back was turned ; [he]236-hans christian andersen was bending over [his]236-hans christian andersen chair , feeling the seat of it . But [he]236-hans christian andersen answered next moment , and said : “[236-hans christian andersen] Ah , there it is ; it was a tack . ” [The lady]2955-the lady contemplated [him]236-hans christian andersen doubtfully a moment , then said , pretty snappishly : “[0-i] All that for a tack ! Praise goodness it was n’t a shingle nail , it would have landed [you]236-hans christian andersen in [the Milky Way]1347-the milky way . [I]0-i do hate to have [my]0-i nerves shook up so . ” And [she]2955-the lady turned on [her]2955-the lady heel and went [her]2955-the lady way . [Hawkins]114-hawkins it ’s horrible ! Take [me]336-the old gentleman away — [I]336-the old gentleman ca n’t stand it . [They]1348-they tottered back to [the laboratory]1339-the laboratory . [CHAPTER XX . Tracy]237-chapter xx . tracy made slow progress with [his]0-i work , for [his]0-i mind wandered a good deal . Many things were puzzling [him]0-i . Finally a light burst upon [him]0-i all of a sudden — seemed to , at any rate — and [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , “[336-the old gentleman] [I]0-i ’ve got the clew at last — [this man]1974-this man ’s mind is off its balance ; [I]0-i do n’t know how much , but it ’s off a point or two , sure ; off enough to explain this mess of perplexities , anyway . These dreadful chromos which [he]1974-this man takes for [old masters]1350-old masters ; these villainous portraits — which to [his]1974-this man frantic mind represent [Rossmores]238-rossmores ; the hatchments ; the pompous name of [this ramshackle old crib]1351-this ramshackle old crib — [Rossmore Towers]46-rossmore towers ; and that odd assertion of [his]1974-this man , that [I]0-i was expected . How could [I]0-i be expected ? that is , [Lord Berkeley]166-lord berkeley . [He]166-lord berkeley knows by the papers that [that person]2856-that person was burned up in [the New Gadsby]58-the new gadsby . Why , hang it , [he]166-lord berkeley really does n’t know _ who _ [he]166-lord berkeley was expecting ; for [his]166-lord berkeley talk showed that [he]166-lord berkeley was not expecting [an Englishman]1353-an englishman , or yet [an artist]2890-an artist , yet [I]0-i answer [his]166-lord berkeley requirements notwithstanding . [He]166-lord berkeley seems sufficiently satisfied with [me]0-i . Yes , [he]166-lord berkeley is a little off ; in fact [I]0-i am afraid [he]166-lord berkeley is a good deal off , [poor old gentleman]1355-poor old gentleman . But [he]166-lord berkeley ’s interesting — [all people in about [his]166-lord berkeley condition]1356-all people in about his condition are , [I]0-i suppose . [I]0-i hope [he]166-lord berkeley ’ll like [my]0-i work ; [I]0-i would like to come every day and study [him]166-lord berkeley . And when [I]0-i write [[my]0-i father]671-my father — ah , that hurts ! [I]0-i must n’t get on that subject ; it is n’t good for [my]0-i spirits . [Somebody]368-somebody coming — [I]0-i must get to work . [It]368-somebody ’s [the old gentleman]336-the old gentleman again . [He]336-the old gentleman looks bothered . Maybe [my]0-i clothes are suspicious ; and they are — for [an artist]2890-an artist . If [my]0-i conscience would allow [me]0-i to make a change , but that is out of the question . [I]0-i wonder what [he]336-the old gentleman ’s making those passes in the air for , with [his]336-the old gentleman hands . [I]0-i seem to be the object of them . Can [he]336-the old gentleman be trying to mesmerize [me]0-i ? [I]0-i do n’t quite like it . There ’s something uncanny about it . ” [The colonel]374-the colonel muttered to [himself]0-i , “[0-i] It has an effect on [him]336-the old gentleman , [I]0-i can see it [myself]0-i . That ’s enough for one time , [I]0-i reckon . [He]336-the old gentleman ’s not very solid , yet , [I]0-i suppose , and [I]0-i might disintegrate [him]336-the old gentleman . Ah , that ’s fine — that ’s very fine indeed . [You]336-the old gentleman are doing it elegantly . [[My]0-i daughter]584-my daughter will be charmed with this . May [I]0-i sit down by [you]336-the old gentleman ? ” “[0-i] Oh , do ; [I]0-i shall be glad . ” “[0-i] It wo n’t disturb [you]336-the old gentleman ? [I]0-i mean , wo n’t dissipate [your]336-the old gentleman inspirations ? ” [Tracy]179-tracy laughed and said they were not ethereal enough to be very easily discommoded . [The colonel]374-the colonel asked a number of cautious and well - considered questions — questions which seemed pretty odd and flighty to [Tracy]179-tracy — but the answers conveyed the information desired , apparently , for [the colonel]374-the colonel said to [himself]374-the colonel , with mixed pride and gratification : “[1362-he] It ’s a good job as far as [I]0-i ’ve got with it . [He]1362-he ’s solid . Solid and going to last , solid as the real thing . ” “[0-i] It ’s wonderful — wonderful . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i could — petrify [him]1362-he . ” After a little [he]0-i asked , warily “[0-i] Do [you]336-the old gentleman prefer being [here]2214-here , or — or there ? ” “[0-i] There ? Where ? ” “[0-i] Why — er — where [you]336-the old gentleman ’ve been ? ” [Tracy]179-tracy ’s thought flew to [[his]179-tracy boarding - house]2961-his boarding - house , and [he]179-tracy answered with decision . “[0-i] Oh , _ here _ , much ! ” [The colonel]374-the colonel was startled , and said to [himself]374-the colonel , “[0-i] There ’s no uncertain ring about that . Well , it ’s all right . [He]1362-he ’s better off . ” [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen entered from [the street]741-the street , now , looking [her]144-gwendolen divinest , and [the artist]2964-the artist was introduced to [her]144-gwendolen . [The artist]2964-the artist said to [himself]2964-the artist , “[1362-he] [I]0-i think [he]1362-he is a little eccentric , perhaps , but that is all . ” [He]2964-the artist reproached [himself]2964-the artist for having injuriously judged [a man]1806-a man without giving [him]1806-a man any fair chance to show what [he]1806-a man really was . p204.jpg ( 29 K ) Of course [the stranger]935-the stranger was very soon at [his]935-the stranger ease and chatting along comfortably . [The average American girl]2972-the average american girl possesses the valuable qualities of naturalness , honesty , and inoffensive straightforwardness ; [she]2972-the average american girl is nearly barren of troublesome conventions and artificialities , consequently [her]2972-the average american girl presence and [her]2972-the average american girl ways are unembarrassing , and [one]372-one is acquainted with [her]2972-the average american girl and on the pleasantest terms with [her]2972-the average american girl before [he]372-one knows how it came about . This new acquaintanceship — friendship , indeed — progressed swiftly ; and the unusual swiftness of it , and the thoroughness of it are sufficiently evidenced and established by one noteworthy fact — that within the first half hour [both parties]2974-both parties had ceased to be conscious of [Tracy]179-tracy ’s clothes . Later this consciousness was re - awakened ; it was then apparent to [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen that [she]144-gwendolen was almost reconciled to [them]2974-both parties , and it was apparent to [Tracy]179-tracy that [he]179-tracy was n’t . The re - awakening was brought about by [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen ’s inviting [the artist]2964-the artist to stay to dinner . [He]179-tracy had to decline , because [he]179-tracy wanted to live , now — that is , now that there was something to live for — and [he]179-tracy could not survive in those clothes at [a gentleman]2336-a gentleman ’s table . [He]179-tracy thought [he]179-tracy knew that . But [he]179-tracy went away happy , for [he]179-tracy saw that [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was disappointed . And whither did [he]179-tracy go ? [He]179-tracy went straight to [a slopshop]2977-a slopshop and bought as neat and reasonably well - fitting a suit of clothes as [an Englishman]1353-an englishman could be persuaded to wear . [He]179-tracy said—_to _ [himself]179-tracy , but _ at _ [his]179-tracy conscience—“I[1365-he] know it ’s wrong ; but it would be wrong _ not _ to do it ; and two wrongs do not make a right . ” This satisfied [him]179-tracy , and made [his]179-tracy heart light . Perhaps it will also satisfy [the reader]276-the reader — if [he]179-tracy can make out what it means . [The old people]2980-the old people were troubled about [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen at dinner , because [she]144-gwendolen was so distraught and silent . If [they]2980-the old people had noticed , [they]2980-the old people would have found that [she]144-gwendolen was sufficiently alert and interested whenever the talk stumbled upon [the artist]2964-the artist and [his]2964-the artist work ; but [they]2980-the old people did n’t notice , and so the chat would swap around to some other subject , and then [somebody]368-somebody would presently be privately worrying about [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen again , and wondering if [she]144-gwendolen were not well , or if something had gone wrong in [the millinery line]2983-the millinery line . [[Her]144-gwendolen mother]591-her mother offered [her]144-gwendolen various reputable patent medicines , and tonics with iron and other hardware in them , and [[her]144-gwendolen father]617-her father even proposed to send out for wine , [relentless prohibitionist and head of the order in [the District of]2987-the district of [Columbia]56-columbia]2986-relentless prohibitionist and head of the order in the district of columbia as [he]617-her father was , but these kindnesses were all declined — thankfully , but with decision . At bedtime , when [the family]1868-the family were breaking up for the night , [she]144-gwendolen privately looted one of the brushes , saying to [herself]144-gwendolen , “[0-i] It ’s the one [he]1365-he has used , the most . ” The next morning [Tracy]179-tracy went forth wearing [his]179-tracy new suit , and equipped with a pink in [his]179-tracy button - hole — a daily attention from [Puss]188-puss . [His]179-tracy whole soul was full of [Gwendolen Sellers]2989-gwendolen sellers , and this condition was an inspiration , art - wise . All the morning [his]179-tracy brush pawed nimbly away at the canvases , almost without [his]179-tracy awarity — awarity , in this sense being the sense of being aware , though disputed by [some authorities]2990-some authorities — turning out marvel upon marvel , in the way of decorative accessories to the portraits , with a felicity and celerity which amazed [the veterans of [the firm]1288-the firm]2991-the veterans of the firm and fetched out of [them]2991-the veterans of the firm continuous explosions of applause . [Meantime Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was losing [her]144-gwendolen morning , and many dollars . [She]144-gwendolen supposed [Tracy]179-tracy was coming in the forenoon — a conclusion which [she]144-gwendolen had jumped to without outside help . So [she]144-gwendolen tripped down stairs every little while from [[her]144-gwendolen work - parlor]2993-her work - parlor to arrange the brushes and things over again , and see if [he]179-tracy had arrived . And when [she]144-gwendolen was in [[her]144-gwendolen work - parlor]2993-her work - parlor it was not profitable , but just the other way — as [she]144-gwendolen found out to [her]144-gwendolen sorrow . [She]144-gwendolen had put in [her]144-gwendolen idle moments during the last little while back , in designing a particularly rare and capable gown for [herself]144-gwendolen , and this morning [she]144-gwendolen set about making it up ; but [she]144-gwendolen was absent minded , and made an irremediable botch of it . When [she]144-gwendolen saw what [she]144-gwendolen had done , [she]144-gwendolen knew the reason of it and the meaning of it ; and [she]144-gwendolen put [her]144-gwendolen work away from [her]144-gwendolen and said [she]144-gwendolen would accept the sign . And from that time forth [she]144-gwendolen came no more away from [the Audience Chamber]2995-the audience chamber , but remained [there]1907-there and waited . After luncheon [she]144-gwendolen waited again . A whole hour . Then a great joy welled up in [her]144-gwendolen heart , for [she]144-gwendolen saw [him]2997-him coming . So [she]144-gwendolen flew back up [stairs]739-stairs thankful , and could hardly wait for [him]2997-him to miss the principal brush , which [she]144-gwendolen had mislaid down there , but knew where [she]144-gwendolen had mislaid it . However , all in good time [the others]373-the others were called in and could n’t find the brush , and then [she]144-gwendolen was sent for , and [she]144-gwendolen could n’t find it [herself]144-gwendolen for some little time ; but then [she]144-gwendolen found it when [the others]373-the others had gone away to hunt in [the kitchen]1952-the kitchen and down cellar and in [the woodshed]3002-the woodshed , and all those other places where [people]1954-people look for things whose ways [they]1954-people are not familiar with . So [she]144-gwendolen gave [him]2997-him the brush , and remarked that [she]144-gwendolen ought to have seen that everything was ready for [him]2997-him , but it had n’t seemed necessary , because it was so early that [she]144-gwendolen was n’t expecting — but [she]144-gwendolen stopped there , surprised at [herself]144-gwendolen for what [she]144-gwendolen was saying ; and [he]2997-him felt caught and ashamed , and said to [himself]2997-him , “[1367-she] [I]0-i knew [my]0-i impatience would drag [me]0-i [here]2214-here before [I]0-i was expected , and betray [me]0-i , and that is just what it has done ; [she]1367-she sees straight through [me]0-i — and is laughing at [me]0-i , inside , of course . ” [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was very much pleased , on one account , and a little the other way in another ; pleased with the new clothes and the improvement which [they]3004-they had achieved ; less pleased by the pink in the buttonhole . Yesterday ’s pink had hardly interested [her]144-gwendolen ; this one was just like it , but somehow it had got [her]144-gwendolen immediate attention , and kept it . [She]144-gwendolen wished [she]144-gwendolen could think of some way of getting at its history in a properly colorless and indifferent way . Presently [she]144-gwendolen made a venture . [She]144-gwendolen said : “[0-i] Whatever [a man]1806-a man ’s age may be , [he]1806-a man can reduce it several years by putting a bright - colored flower in [his]1806-a man button - hole . [I]0-i have often noticed that . Is that [your]0-i sex ’s reason for wearing a boutonniere ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i fancy not , but certainly that reason would be a sufficient one . [I]0-i ’ve never heard of the idea before . ” “[1806-a man] [You]0-i seem to prefer pinks . Is it on account of the color , or the form ? ” “[1806-a man] Oh no , ” [he]0-i said , simply , “[1369-they] they are given to [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i have any preference . ” “[1369-they] [They]1369-they are given to [him]1806-a man , ” [she]144-gwendolen said to [herself]144-gwendolen , and [she]144-gwendolen felt a coldness toward that pink . “[1806-a man] [I]0-i wonder who it is , and what [she]1370-she is like . ” The flower began to take up a good deal of room ; it obtruded itself everywhere , it intercepted all views , and marred them ; it was becoming exceedingly annoying and conspicuous for a little thing . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if [he]1806-a man cares for [her]1370-she . ” That thought gave [her]144-gwendolen a quite definite pain . CHAPTER XXI . [She]144-gwendolen had made everything comfortable for [the artist]2964-the artist ; there was no further pretext for staying . So [she]144-gwendolen said [she]144-gwendolen would go , now , and asked [him]0-i to summon [the servants]512-the servants in case [he]0-i should need anything . [She]144-gwendolen went away unhappy ; and [she]144-gwendolen left unhappiness behind [her]144-gwendolen ; for [she]144-gwendolen carried away all the sunshine . The time dragged heavily for both , now . [He]0-i could n’t paint for thinking of [her]144-gwendolen ; [she]144-gwendolen could n’t design or millinerize with any heart , for thinking of [him]0-i . Never before had painting seemed so empty to [him]0-i , never before had millinerizing seemed so void of interest to [her]144-gwendolen . [She]144-gwendolen had gone without repeating that dinner - invitation — an almost unendurable disappointment to [him]0-i . On [her]144-gwendolen part - well , [she]144-gwendolen was suffering , too ; for [she]144-gwendolen had found [she]144-gwendolen _ could n’t _ invite [him]0-i . It was not hard yesterday , but it was impossible to - day . A thousand innocent privileges seemed to have been filched from [her]144-gwendolen unawares in the past twenty - four hours . To - day [she]144-gwendolen felt strangely hampered , restrained of [her]144-gwendolen liberty . To - day [she]144-gwendolen could n’t propose to [herself]144-gwendolen to do anything or say anything concerning [this young man]3007-this young man without being instantly paralyzed into non - action by the fear that [he]0-i might “[0-i] suspect . ” Invite [him]0-i to dinner _ to - day ? _ It made [her]144-gwendolen shiver to think of it . And so [her]144-gwendolen afternoon was one long fret . Broken at intervals . Three times [she]144-gwendolen had to go down stairs on errands — that is , [she]144-gwendolen thought [she]144-gwendolen had to go down stairs on errands . Thus , going and coming , [she]144-gwendolen had six glimpses of [him]0-i , in the aggregate , without seeming to look in [his]0-i direction ; and [she]144-gwendolen tried to endure these electric ecstasies without showing any sign , but they fluttered [her]144-gwendolen up a good deal , and [she]144-gwendolen felt that the naturalness [she]144-gwendolen was putting on was overdone and quite too frantically sober and hysterically calm to deceive . [The painter]3008-the painter had [his]3008-the painter share of the rapture ; [he]3008-the painter had [his]3008-the painter six glimpses , and they smote [him]3008-the painter with waves of pleasure that assaulted [him]3008-the painter , beat upon [him]3008-the painter , washed over [him]3008-the painter deliciously , and drowned out all consciousness of what [he]3008-the painter was doing with [his]3008-the painter brush . So there were six places in [his]3008-the painter canvas which had to be done over again . p210.jpg ( 23 K ) At last [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen got some peace of mind by sending word to [the Thompsons]240-the thompsons , in [the neighborhood]1093-the neighborhood , that [she]144-gwendolen was coming [there]1907-there to dinner . [She]144-gwendolen would n’t be reminded , at _ that _ table , that there was [an absentee who ought to be a presentee]3011-an absentee who ought to be a presentee — a word which [she]144-gwendolen meant to look out in the dictionary at a calmer time . About this time [the old earl]1296-the old earl dropped in for a chat with [the artist]2964-the artist , and invited [him]2964-the artist to stay to dinner . [Tracy]179-tracy cramped down [his]179-tracy joy and gratitude by a sudden and powerful exercise of all [his]179-tracy forces ; and [he]179-tracy felt that now that [he]179-tracy was going to be close to [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen , and hear [her]144-gwendolen voice and watch [her]144-gwendolen face during several precious hours , [earth]434-earth had nothing valuable to add to [his]179-tracy life for the present . [The earl]537-the earl said to [himself]0-i , “[0-i] [This spectre]1371-this spectre can eat apples , apparently . [We]1372-we shall find out , now , if that is a specialty . [I]0-i think , [myself]0-i , it ’s a specialty . [Apples]241-apples , without doubt , constitute the spectral limit . It was the case with [[our]1372-we first parents]1373-our first parents . No , [I]0-i am wrong — at least only partly right . The line _ was _ drawn at apples , just as in the present case , but it was from the other direction . ” The new clothes gave [him]179-tracy a thrill of pleasure and pride . [He]179-tracy said to [himself]179-tracy , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve got part of [him]1374-him down to date , anyway . ” [Sellers]144-gwendolen said [he]537-the earl was pleased with [Tracy]179-tracy ’s work ; and [he]537-the earl went on and engaged [him]179-tracy to restore [[his]179-tracy old masters]3016-his old masters , and said [he]537-the earl should also want [him]179-tracy to paint [his]179-tracy portrait and [[his]179-tracy wife]381-his wife ’s and possibly [[his]179-tracy daughter]3018-his daughter ’s . The tide of [the artist]2964-the artist ’s happiness was at flood , now . The chat flowed pleasantly along while [Tracy]179-tracy painted and [Sellers]144-gwendolen carefully unpacked a picture which [he]179-tracy had brought with [him]179-tracy . It was a chromo ; a new one , just out . It was the smirking , self - satisfied portrait of [a man who was inundating [the Union]3021-the union with advertisements inviting [everybody]404-everybody to buy [his]3020-a man who was inundating the union with advertisements inviting everybody to buy his specialty , which was a three - dollar shoe or a dress - suit or something of that kind specialty , which was a three - dollar shoe or a dress - suit or something of that kind]3020-a man who was inundating the union with advertisements inviting everybody to buy his specialty , which was a three - dollar shoe or a dress - suit or something of that kind . [The old gentleman]336-the old gentleman rested the chromo flat upon [his]336-the old gentleman lap and gazed down tenderly upon it , and became silent and meditative . [Presently Tracy]179-tracy noticed that [he]336-the old gentleman was dripping tears on it . This touched [the young fellow]1015-the young fellow ’s sympathetic nature , and at the same time gave [him]336-the old gentleman the painful sense of being [an intruder upon a sacred privacy]3025-an intruder upon a sacred privacy , an observer of emotions which [a stranger]355-a stranger ought not to witness . But [his]336-the old gentleman pity rose superior to other considerations , and compelled [him]336-the old gentleman to try to comfort [the old mourner]3027-the old mourner with kindly words and a show of friendly interest . [He]0-i said : “[1813-a relative] [I]0-i am very sorry — is it a friend whom — ” “[1813-a relative] Ah , more than that , far more than that — [a relative]1813-a relative , the dearest [I]0-i had on [earth]434-earth , although [I]0-i was never permitted to see [him]1813-a relative . Yes , it is young [Lord Berkeley]166-lord berkeley , who perished so heroically in the awful conflagration . What _ could _ the matter be ? [Tracy]179-tracy alone could have told , [the others]373-the others could n’t even invent a theory . Meanwhile [they]3040-they were having a similarly dismal time at [the Thompson house]3041-the thompson house ; in fact a twin experience . [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was ashamed of [herself]144-gwendolen for allowing [her]144-gwendolen disappointment to so depress [her]144-gwendolen spirits and make [her]144-gwendolen so strangely and profoundly miserable ; but feeling ashamed of [herself]144-gwendolen did n’t improve the matter any ; it only seemed to aggravate the suffering . [She]144-gwendolen explained that [she]144-gwendolen was not feeling very well , and [everybody]404-everybody could see that this was true ; so [she]144-gwendolen got sincere sympathy and commiseration ; but that did n’t help the case . Nothing helps that kind of a case . It is best to just stand off and let it fester . In just that infinitely small fraction of a second those two great confessions were made , received , and perfectly understood . All anxiety , apprehension , uncertainty , vanished out of [these young people]1070-these young people ’s hearts and left [them]1070-these young people filled with a great peace . [Sellers]144-gwendolen had had the most confident faith that with the new reinforcement victory would be at this last moment snatched from the jaws of defeat , but it was an error . The talk was as stubbornly disjointed as ever . [He]1462-he was proud of [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen , and liked to show [her]144-gwendolen off , even against [Miss Belle Thompson]244-miss belle , and here had been a great opportunity , and what had [she]244-miss belle made of it ? [He]1462-he felt a good deal put out . [He]1462-he said to [himself]1462-he , with a deep sense of injury , “[1476-she] [He]1468-his ’ll put in [his]1468-his diary — [they]1469-they all keep diaries — [he’ll]1468-his put in [his]1468-his diary that [she]1470-she was miraculously uninteresting — dear , [dear]1855-dear , but _ was n’t _ she!—I never saw the like — and yet looking as beautiful as [Satan]126-satan , too — and could n’t seem to do anything but paw bread crumbs , and pick flowers to pieces , and look fidgety . And it is n’t any better here in [the Hall of [Audience]1473-audience]738-the hall of audience . [I]0-i ’ve had enough ; [I]0-i ’ll haul down [my]0-i flag — [the others]373-the others may fight it out if [they]373-the others want to . ” [He]1462-he shook hands all around and went off to do some work which [he]1462-he said was pressing . [The idolaters]3060-the idolaters were the width of [the room]341-the room apart ; and apparently unconscious of [each other]310-each other ’s presence . The distance got shortened a little , now . Very soon [the mother]2008-the mother withdrew . The distance narrowed again . [Tracy]179-tracy stood before a chromo of [some Ohio politician which had been retouched and chain - mailed for [a crusading Rossmore]110-rossmore]3064-some ohio politician which had been retouched and chain - mailed for a crusading rossmore , and [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen was sitting on the sofa not far from [his]1462-he elbow artificially absorbed in examining a photograph album that had n’t any photographs in it . [The “[1475-you] Senator]3065-the “ senator ” still lingered . [He]1462-he was sorry for [the young people]949-the young people ; it had been a dull evening for [them]949-the young people . In the goodness of [his]1462-he heart [he]1462-he tried to make it pleasant for [them]949-the young people now ; tried to remove the ill impression necessarily left by the general defeat ; tried to be chatty , even tried to be gay . But the responses were sickly , there was no starting any enthusiasm ; [he]1462-he would give it up and quit — it was a day specially picked out and consecrated to failures . But when [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen rose up promptly and smiled a glad smile and said with thankfulness and blessing,—“_Must[1475-you] _ [you]1475-you go ? ” it seemed cruel to desert , and [he]1462-he sat down again . [He]1462-he was about to begin a remark when — when [he]1462-he did n’t . [We]949-the young people have all been there . [He]1462-he did n’t know how [he]1462-he knew [his]1462-he concluding to stay longer had been a mistake , [he]1462-he merely knew it ; and knew it for dead certain , too . And so [he]1462-he bade goodnight , and went mooning out , wondering what [he]1462-he could have done that changed the atmosphere that way . As the door closed behind [him]1462-he [those two]3067-those two were standing side by side , looking at that door — looking at it in a waiting , second - counting , but deeply grateful kind of way . And the instant it closed [they]3067-those two flung [their]3067-those two arms about [each other]310-each other ’s necks , and there , heart to heart and lip to lip — “[1476-she] Oh , [my]0-i God , [she]1476-she ’s kissing it ! ” [Nobody]483-nobody heard this remark , because [Hawkins]114-hawkins , who bred it , only thought it , [he]1462-he did n’t utter it . [He]1462-he had turned , the moment [he]1462-he had closed the door , and had pushed it open a little , intending to re - enter and ask what ill - advised thing [he]1462-he had done or said , and apologize for it . But [he]1462-he did n’t re - enter ; [he]1462-he staggered off stunned , terrified , distressed . p222.jpg ( 33 K ) CHAPTER XXII . Five minutes later [he]1462-he was sitting in [[his]1462-he room]2100-his room , with [his]1462-he head bowed within the circle of [his]1462-he arms , on the table — final attitude of grief and despair . [His]1462-he tears were flowing fast , and now and then a sob broke upon the stillness . Presently [he]1462-he said : “[1828-this one] [I]0-i knew [her]1476-she when [she]1476-she was [a little child]598-a little child and used to climb about [my]0-i knees ; [I]0-i love [her]1476-she as [I]0-i love [my]0-i own , and now — oh , poor thing , poor thing , [I]0-i can not bear it!—she ’s gone and lost [her]1476-she heart to [this mangy materializee]1478-this mangy materializee ! Why _ did n’t _ [we]1479-we see that that might happen ? But how could [we]1479-we ? [Nobody]483-nobody could ; [nobody]483-nobody could ever have dreamed of such a thing . [You]1482-you could n’t expect [a person]2449-a person would fall in love with a wax - work . And [this one]1828-this one does n’t even amount to that . ” [He]0-i went on grieving to [himself]0-i , and now and then giving voice to [his]0-i lamentations . “[0-i] It ’s done , oh , it ’s done , and there ’s no help for it , no undoing the miserable business . If [I]0-i had the nerve , [I]0-i would kill [it]1828-this one . But that would n’t do any good . _ [She]1476-she _ loves it ; [she]1476-she thinks it ’s genuine and authentic . If [she]1476-she lost it [she]1476-she would grieve for it just as [she]1476-she would for [a real person]1485-a real person . And who ’s to break it to [the family]1868-the family ! Not [I]0-i — [I’ll]0-i die first . [Sellers]144-gwendolen is [the best human being]1487-the best human being [I]0-i ever knew and [I]0-i would n’t any more think of — oh , dear , why it ’ll break [his]1487-the best human being heart when [he]1487-the best human being finds it out . And [Polly]117-polly ’s too . _ This _ comes of meddling with such infernal matters ! But for this , the creature would still be roasting in [Sheol]79-sheol where it belongs . How is it that [these people]1044-these people do n’t smell the brimstone ? Sometimes [I]0-i ca n’t come into [the same room]1489-the same room with [him]1487-the best human being without nearly suffocating . ” After a while [he]0-i broke out again : “[144-gwendolen] Well , there ’s _ one _ thing , sure . The materializing has got to stop right where it is . If [she]1476-she ’s got to marry [a spectre]1490-a spectre , let [her]1476-she marry [a decent one out of the Middle Ages]1491-a decent one out of the middle ages , like this one — not [a cowboy]666-a cowboy and [a thief such as this protoplasmic tadpole]1493-a thief such as this protoplasmic tadpole ’s going to turn into if [Sellers]144-gwendolen keeps on fussing at it . [It]1494-it costs five thousand dollars cash and shuts down on [the incorporated company]1495-the incorporated company to stop the works at this point , but [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen ’s happiness is worth more than that . ” [He]0-i heard [Sellers]144-gwendolen coming , and got [himself]0-i to rights . [Sellers]144-gwendolen took a seat , and said : “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i ’ve got to confess [I]0-i ’m a good deal puzzled . [It]1496-him did certainly eat , there ’s no getting around it . Not eat , exactly , either , but it nibbled ; nibbled in an appetiteless way , but still it nibbled ; and that ’s just a marvel . Now the question is , what does it do with those nibblings ? That ’s it — what does it do with [them]1497-them ? [My]0-i idea is that [we]1498-we do n’t begin to know all there is to this stupendous discovery yet . But time will show — time and science — give [us]1498-we a chance , and do n’t get impatient . ” But [he]0-i could n’t get [Hawkins]114-hawkins interested ; could n’t make [him]114-hawkins talk to amount to anything ; could n’t drag [him]114-hawkins out of [his]114-hawkins depression . But at last [he]0-i took a turn that arrested [Hawkins]114-hawkins ’s attention . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m coming to like [him]1496-him , [Hawkins]114-hawkins . [He]1496-him is [a person of stupendous character]1499-a person of stupendous character — absolutely gigantic . Under that placid exterior is concealed the most dare - devil spirit that was ever put into [a man]1806-a man — [he]1496-him ’s just [a Clive]1501-a clive over again . Yes , [I]0-i ’m all admiration for [him]1496-him , on account of [his]1496-him character , and liking naturally follows admiration , [you]114-hawkins know . [I]0-i ’m coming to like [him]1496-him immensely . Do [you]114-hawkins know , [I]0-i have n’t the heart to degrade such a character as that down to [the burglar estate]1502-the burglar estate for money or for anything else ; and [I]0-i ’ve come to ask if [you]114-hawkins are willing to let the reward go , and leave [this poor fellow]1503-this poor fellow — “ Where [he]1503-this poor fellow is ? ”[336-the old gentleman] “ Yes — not bring [him]1503-this poor fellow down to date . ”[0-i] “ Oh , there ’s [my]336-the old gentleman hand ; and [my]336-the old gentleman heart ’s in it , too ! ”[336-the old gentleman] “ [I]336-the old gentleman ’ll never forget [you]114-hawkins for this , [Hawkins]114-hawkins , ”[336-the old gentleman] said [the old gentleman]336-the old gentleman in a voice which [he]336-the old gentleman found it hard to control . “ [You]114-hawkins are making a great sacrifice for [me]144-gwendolen , and one which [you]114-hawkins can ill afford , but [I]144-gwendolen ’ll never forget [your]114-hawkins generosity , and if [I]144-gwendolen live [you]114-hawkins shall not suffer for it , be sure of that . ”[144-gwendolen] [Sally Sellers]144-gwendolen immediately and vividly realized that [she]144-gwendolen was become [a new being]1505-a new being ; [a being of a far higher and worthier sort]1506-a being of a far higher and worthier sort than [she]144-gwendolen had been such a little while before ; an earnest being , in place of [a dreamer]1507-a dreamer ; and supplied with a reason for [her]144-gwendolen presence in [the world]409-the world , where merely a wistful and troubled curiosity about it had existed before . So great and so comprehensive was the change which had been wrought , that [she]144-gwendolen seemed to [herself]144-gwendolen to be [a real person who had lately been a shadow]1509-a real person who had lately been a shadow ; a something which had lately been a nothing ; a purpose , which had lately been a fancy ; [a finished temple , with the altar - fires lit and the voice of worship ascending]1510-a finished temple , with the altar - fires lit and the voice of worship ascending , where before had been but [an architect ’s confusion of arid working plans]1511-an architect ’s confusion of arid working plans , unintelligible to the passing eye and prophesying nothing . “ [Lady ”[144-gwendolen] Gwendolen]144-gwendolen ! The pleasantness of that sound was all gone ; it was an offense to [her]144-gwendolen ear now . [She]144-gwendolen said : “ There — that sham belongs to the past ; [I]144-gwendolen will not be called by it any more . ”[144-gwendolen] “ [I]144-gwendolen may call [you]144-gwendolen simply [Gwendolen]144-gwendolen ? [I]1512-you hate pinks — some pinks . [The girl]953-the girl ’s soul was suddenly invaded by a creepy apprehension , a quite definite sense of suspicion and alarm . [She]144-gwendolen put [his]1512-you arms away from [her]144-gwendolen , looked [him]1512-you searchingly in the eye , and said : “ Answer [me]144-gwendolen truly , on [your]1512-you honor . [You]1512-you are not seeking to marry [me]144-gwendolen on account of [my]144-gwendolen _ rank ? _ ”[144-gwendolen] The shot almost knocked [him]1512-you through the wall , [he]1512-you was so little prepared for it . Then , without wasting precious time , [he]1512-you set about the task of convincing [her]144-gwendolen that [he]1512-you had been lured by [herself]144-gwendolen alone , and had fallen in love with [her]144-gwendolen only , not [her]144-gwendolen title and position ; that [he]1512-you loved [her]144-gwendolen with all [his]1512-you heart , and could not love [her]144-gwendolen more if [she]144-gwendolen were [a duchess]1514-a duchess , or less if [she]144-gwendolen were without [home]1782-home , name or [family]1516-family . [She]144-gwendolen prepared a surprise for [him]1512-you , now , calculated to put a heavy strain upon those disinterested protestations of [his]1512-you ; and thus [she]144-gwendolen delivered it , burning it away word by word as the fuse burns down to a bombshell , and watching to see how far the explosion would lift [him]1512-you : “ Listen — and do not doubt [me]1512-you , for [I]1512-you shall speak the exact truth . [He]179-tracy was conscious of the sting of jealousy .
